story:
Who is Katelin Maylum?

My name is Katelin Maylum and I have been writing, acting, producing and directing for over ten years now. I attended Wayne State University and received my BA in Theater with a Specialization in Performance in 2015. I have been honored to receive several awards and nominations for my work throughout the years, most notably the Tompkins Award from Wayne State University's Department of English for "The Front Lines", a play later to be the basis for the Detroit Filmmaker Awards nominated feature film, "Stay". I am asking for your support for my newest and third feature film, "Jennifer's Counsel", a comedy.

What is "Jennifer's Counsel"?

"Jennifer's Counsel" is about four lawyers on a mission to find their missing paralegal, Jennifer. Their adventure takes them to a strip club, the north side of Flint and to an epic fight to the death! It's definitely a comedy with some edge to it as it deals with race and racial tensions, but we feel that this film is a great story to be told and that it is a fun and hilarious ride from beginning to end! It truly has something for everyone - romance, comedy, a pinch of drama, fight scenes, guns and beautiful women!

We believe that JC has the chance to be our big breakout film, but we have to have the funds, equipment and support to do it big like we dream of. We want to be able to enter film festivals, have an amazing premiere, and show everyone all the talent that Michigan has to offer, but we absolutely need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding for equipment, craft services, compensation for crew and cast positions, location fees and whatever else we might run into along the way on this crazy filmmaking journey. We have a lofty goal of $2,000, but any amount helps!

We will be offering some cool swag for donations, such as: Angry Macey Films DVDs, hand written thank you notes with Hershey Kisses, Special Thanks credits, Facebook shout outs, cameos and more!

If we don't reach our entire goal, we will use all funds raised to help support the film, whether it be for a few meals on set, a gas card for a cast member, or some batteries.

The Impact

This project is important because we have been on a mission since the beginning to try and expose the world to the amazing talent that Michigan has to offer. We see incredibly talented individuals doing awesome work all of the time, but they simply don't have the funds to get onto a bigger platform. We want to change that. We want to make so much on this fundraiser that we can not only PAY cast AND crew, but we can make a beautiful professional product that can compete with the best of them, and put money into the pockets of Flint residents.

Risks & Challenges

Being a filmmaker, I have seen some pretty crazy things over the years with several short films under my belt and three feature films. Not only that, I have been acting professionally since I was 12 years old. Sometimes, things don't work out. Some examples of things not working out in the past: the lead completely disappears from the face of the earth before we are done filming, we are no longer allowed to use the same location that we've been using, the location is a last minute cancellation - no call, no show with the owner, or everyone is just incredibly late to set and we only have an hour or so to shoot. I've dealt with it all, and I've still been able to pull it altogether to create a beautiful work of art. With a little bit of rewriting, re-figuring and determination, there isn't much that has gotten in my way of creating a successful project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We can always accept in kind donations of film equipment, batteries, food/snacks or just spreading the word! We also need some dedicated crew members, so if that's something you're interested in, let us know!

story:
The entire team of Wet Paint Pictures is thrilled and excited to welcome you to the Smack Indie-GoGo fundraising campaign! 

(Photo Credit: Alice Bozga)

SMACK is a full-length drama/romance film meant to shed light on the crippling affects of drug use. Dean and Vanessa's love is stuck in a vicious alternating cycle of euphoria, self-destruction, and despair. 

 

 

The film depicts a passionate couple whose love is quickly tangled in a world of false remedy. It’s a downward spiral of drug dependency that ultimately smacks them in the face. 

In (2020) We set a high record of overdoses in the DMV area. But you probably didn’t know that. You know why? — Because NOBODY talked about it... And that hurt a lot coming from someone who's lost friends and family from this crippling disease....

It's time to STEP UP!


 EMILY CLASSEN - Plays “Vanessa Taylor”  in the film Smack. 

Emily Classen is clever enough to begin her bio with big credits, so watch her in a lead role in “The Forgiving” on Amazon Prime Video (Marketing for Change, Co). Emily is currently based in Baltimore but is originally from New Orleans, and she can’t go back now because then being southern wouldn’t be interesting. Since moving to the DMV area, she’s put her acting degree from the University of Southern Mississippi to good use in both film and theatre. Local stage credits run the gamut from original musicals (Baltimore Rock Opera Society) to the classics (Baltimore Shakespeare Factory). Her film work includes “Ape Canyon” (Mind in Motion Productions) and the tv series “Thespian” (Hold for Scooter Films). She plans to grow her film career in both comedy and drama. Emily was drawn to the impactful story of “Smack,” and she hopes to bring honesty to the romance and grit housing the story’s message. In addition to “Smack,” Emily’s upcoming projects include the feature film “WNUf Halloween Sequel,” produced by Chris and Melissa LaMartina. EmilyClassen.com

What intrigued you about "Smack?"

Films are often the most impactful when they show us things that aren’t pretty. I was drawn to Smack because it explores the full extent of what addiction can do to lives. The script doesn’t shy away from ugliness, and I think that’s what makes it so powerful, because the issue itself is ugly. The slippery slope of addiction is something that almost everyone has a story about, so I think that we as storytellers need to traverse that terrain. I hope that we can help facilitate conversation with this project. 

CODY FAULK - Plays "Dean Owens" in the film smack. 

Cody Faulk is a Washington D.C-based Filmmaker / Actor.

He is commonly known for his Director debut film “VOORHEES" A Friday the 13th Fan Film, which just hit over 1 MILLION views in less than 6 months of release!

Cody is no stranger to being in front of the camera either. He is fresh off of shooting "Bloody Summer Camp," in which he plays the lead. You can also keep an eye out on projects like - “The Dark Office," “Haddonfield Nightmare,” and “The House that Eats Flesh.”

ALEXANDER RIOS - Plays "PUG" In the film Smack.

Alexander Rios - is a Los Angeles based actor who recently moved out west after growing his theatre career in New York. He was most recently seen in the new short film Stalgia, a New York Film Awards Finalist, and is continuing to be showcased in festivals across the country. Alexander’s recent NYC theatre credits include Pip in the Off-Broadway hit Pip’s Island and Chase in the new play Hazing U. He is thrilled to be a part of Smack and is excited to begin production soon!

What intrigued you about "Smack?"

"Smack intrigued me off the bat because it tells a very intimate, vulnerable and unique story that hasn’t been the focus of many films. I think creating a film that revolves around the daily life and struggle of people that are hooked on something so addictive is a pretty rare opportunity, and to be able to explore that through a character like Pug, is something I’ve always wanted to do as an actor."

JEFF MOORE -  Plays "Cliff Taylor"  in the film Smack.

Jeff Moore was born on September 21st in Hollywood, California. He is a film, television and commercial actor. His first stage performance occurred in high school, where he sang "Hand Jive" in Grease. He is best known for his work on Dispatched, La Reina Del Sur, The Zombie Club, A Child of the King, Unsaid, The Perfect Suspect & Turn: Washington's Spies. He resides with his family in Virginia.

What intrigued you about "Smack?"

"Some believe that a film demonstrating evil behavior is inherently bad. I believe that there is a difference between portraying evil behavior and promoting it.  Although SMACK has a dark storyline, it has the potential to educate people about the evils of drug use and addiction and how drugs can destroy, not only our lives, but the lives of those we love. We tend to find what we seek. And if we search for it, there is a tremendous positive message that can be learned from this film. "

KATHY SANDERS - Plays "Robin Taylor"  in the film Smack.

Kathy is an actress and associate producer who loves bringing great stories to life. Her resume includes several films streaming on Amazon Prime, an award-winning web series, tv appearances and numerous commercial & print jobs.
She also enjoys working as a film festival judge and a casting assistant.

What intrigued you about "Smack?"

"Addiction is a dark & ugly beast that destroys everything in its path which is why I was so drawn to Smack's raw depiction of this truth.  Cody's passion for the project is palpable and I'm so grateful to be a part of his vision and desire to bring awareness."

BRIAN LYONS-BURKE - Plays "Jim Ross" in the film Smack.

Brian Lyons-Burke  is a Washington DC stage, film and voiceover actor. He is a two time a WATCH award winner for his portrayal of Judge Turpin in Sweeney Todd and Roger DeBris in The Producers.  Upcoming films include the short films “Three Clicks” and “Departure”.

What intrigued you about "Smack?"

"I was attracted to this project by the commitment and passion of the film-makers, and the power of the script.  This is a serious film, dealing with a serious issue, and the role of Jim Ross will provide a challenge that I look forward to."

JORDAN MILLER - Jordan Miller is an award-winning writer, director and musician from Maryland.  His first feature, "The Red Effect" (now streaming on Tubi TV), was released in early 2017 to praise and awards from both the Queens World Film Festival and the San Francisco Black Film Festival. Jordan's most recent film, a horror short entitled "Three", won various festival awards in 2018 with a subsequent release on popular horror web platform, Crypt TV. He has also directed many music videos across genres and is currently working on completing feature length horror anthology film "The Black Hills Night Hike".

What intrigued you about "Smack?"

"My natural gravitation towards dark storytelling is what drew me to this story initially. That, and the entire addiction aspect. I have seen family and friends fight that fight and in some sad cases lose that battle."

ALICE BOZGA - Alice C. Bozga was born in Oradea, Romania, part of the region known as Transylvania, and moved to the US with her family as a child. She attended The Lee Strasberg Theatre and Film Institute in New York City as a teen and later graduated college with an AA Degree focused in Performing Arts. She is currently a Washington, DC based actress/performer and has appeared in music videos, commercials, and performed with different dance troupes throughout the DC area. 

Alice made her TV debut on Investigation Discovery’s “Southern Fried Homicide” playing a Polo player’s ex-girlfriend. She continued work on several other Investigation Discovery shows and landed a lead on “Deadly Affairs” as Jennifer Pammer. One of her most esteemed roles, however, was a Campaign Staffer in the Netflix original series “House of Cards” where she had the privilege of doing a scene with actress Robin Wright. 

She later got involved with a unique SAG-AFTRA web-series called “Cecilie La Rue: Vampire Hunter” playing a lead as the Vampire Hunter named Edith Sorenson. Alice went on to land another lead as Katrina in the thrilling film “VOORHEES: A Friday the 13th Fan Film,” which has now hit over 1 MILLION VIEWS! She is currently in the principal photography stage of “The Haddonfield Nightmare: A Halloween Fan Film” in a supporting role as Vanessa Cooper, Lauren Tate’s best friend, and post-production stage of “The Dark Office,” where she played Vickie, a pothead and supernatural enthusiast. 

Although Alice is usually in front of the camera, SMACK will be her debut as a Director, allowing her to utilize and hone other facets of hers. She believes that to fully understand and appreciate what it takes to produce an impactful film, it is important to experience and develop in all aspects of the creative process.

What intrigued you about "Smack?"

“SMACK is a gritty, realistic take on the struggles and destruction of drug addiction. Although a romantic drama, it won't be shying away from the painful truth, that sometimes love is not enough.”

CODY FAULK - “We hope you all can support this project and help us bring this vision to life. It’s more than just making a movie, it’s about spreading awareness. This film is deeply personal for me and for many others around the world. It’s a real topic that needs to be talked about MORE. Help be a voice for the voiceless.​ If we can save just ONE life. Then we made a good movie.”

Our goal with this campaign is to raise $15,000 in order to afford the cost of Principal Photography and Post-Production for the film. 

All funds designated for production will go towards film permits, insurance, gear and vehicle rentals, stunts, special FX & make up,  post-production services and other items that are essential in running a safe and productive film set. This funding will allow our production crew to film with the proper Camera and Lighting Equipment, Special-FX Make-Up, Costumes, Props, Food, and several other Post-Production costs such as Editing, Sound Design, Sound and Music Mixing, Color Grading, Marketing, Festival fees, and of course, great Perks for our backers!

GOING BIG!

Come completion of the film, the Wet Paint Pictures Team is diving head on into the film festival circuit. We believe our story and our team have something truly special here. A portion of the funds will be put aside for submission fees. We have high hopes for possibly getting selected!

That being said, we do want to be fully transparent with our amazing backers. One of the major conditions of many festivals is the prohibition of a public theatrical exhibition (including online release). Therefore, the film cannot be viewed by the general public prior to submission or it may be automatically disqualified or deemed ineligible for award consideration. Consequently, this will cause a minor delay on some rewards, such as Blu-Rays and Screenplays. We do not want this to be a deterrent, but rather a testament to our dedication, passion, and importance of the film’s message. We hope you understand this requirement and believe in our journey!

Thank you all for your support, we cannot do this without YOU!

Thank you for taking the time to look over our campaign and know that we are greatly appreciative for any support you can give. After making your contribution, we simply ask that you please share this campaign with friends or family you believe will enjoy this film.

Thank you again for your continued support of independent films. It means the world!

story:
"Rico" Documentary Film

Fundraising Summary

 

At 90 years of age, watercolourist Richard Demarco CBE is recognised as Scotland’s leading promoter of all the arts. For almost 60 years, he has invited 1000s of artists to participate in the Edinburgh Festival and subsequently brought global recognition to some of the 20th century's biggest names in contemporary art; Joseph Beuys, Tadeusz Kantor and Paul Neagu among them. 

However, as the global pandemic halts exhibitions (Richard's only source of income), and with the current home to his archive in complete disrepair, Demarco now faces eviction by Edinburgh City Council. Out-of-favour because he dares to confront the folly of the modern art world,  “Rico” (his mother's nickname for him) believes he’s in a race against time to find a permanent home for his “shrine to the Edinburgh Festival” - or risk losing it upon his death to those who “have commodified the visual art world.”

Emmy and Golden Globe winner Brian Cox joins luminaries in contemporary art such as Marina Abramovic and Sir Nicolas Serota, alongside some of Richard's dearest friends, embarking  on a journey through the incredible Demarco Archive and learning more about this remarkable man..."The last great titan of Scottish art!"

Award-winning filmmaker Dr Marco Federici has directed, produced and edited the film, using personal footage from over 2 decades of filming Richard, as well as precious materials digitised from the Demarco archive.  This is a story of how a man born from hardworking Italo Scottish immigrants, overcame the odds to become one of the nation's most important living figures in art...yet has lived in penury for the last thirty years and is on the verge of losing his life's work. This Indiegogo campaign is an attempt to raise funds to complete the post-production and fund entry to the worlds biggest film festivals, bringing Richard's story to the attention of a global audience.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise £20,000 to complete cinema-standard post-production and market the film to prestigious festivals including Sundance, Tribeca, Venice and Berlin.
  • The post-production will include colour-grading, sound mixing, visual effects work from Scotland's most professional facilities, culminating in the final delivery of a feature-length film for cinema, streaming and televisual broadcast. Currently, the duration is 99mins.
  • In return for your contributions, there are a series of exciting "perks" available, including signed prints from Richard Demarco, DVD's and of course perpetual credits in the final film.

 

The Impact

Richard's life story is incredible however, he is arguably more celebrated and recognised in Poland, Germany, Romania and Italy than in his native Scotland. The documentary aims to tell for the first time on film the high-points and controversies of his career, and the distress of his current plight. The film will introduce him to a new global audience and it is hoped, attract the interest of academic institutions who may wish to learn more about the Demarco Archive.

Richard Demarco has arguably been an unpaid diplomat for Scotland, building bridges between alienated nations in Europe where others turned their backs, and as a result, he has discovered some of the most important contemporary artists of the late 20th century.

Filmmaker Marco Federici is a long-established producer and filmmaker for Scottish Television and BBC Scotland. Recently Marco produced the 90th-anniversary interview with Richard for the National Galleries of Scotland: https://vimeo.com/435444628

His work has made the official selection for the Edinburgh and Milan Film Festivals, and he is currently completing the historic "Restoration Reels" for the Glasgow School of Art, a series of prestigious short academic films documenting the story of the Mackintosh Building's tragic fire and restoration programme.

To learn more about the director and Richard Demarco please visit:

www.demarcoarchive.com

www.mlcproductionsuk.com
story_txt:
"Rico" Documentary Film
Fundraising Summary
 
At 90 years of age, watercolourist Richard Demarco CBE is recognised as Scotland’s leading promoter of all the arts. For almost 60 years, he has invited 1000s of artists to participate in the Edinburgh Festival and subsequently brought global recognition to some of the 20th century's biggest names in contemporary art; Joseph Beuys, Tadeusz Kantor and Paul Neagu among them. 
However, as the global pandemic halts exhibitions (Richard's only source of income), and with the current home to his archive in complete disrepair, Demarco now faces eviction by Edinburgh City Council. Out-of-favour because he dares to confront the folly of the modern art world,  “Rico” (his mother's nickname for him) believes he’s in a race against time to find a permanent home for his “shrine to the Edinburgh Festival” - or risk losing it upon his death to those who “have commodified the visual art world.”
Emmy and Golden Globe winner Brian Cox joins luminaries in contemporary art such as Marina Abramovic and Sir Nicolas Serota, alongside some of Richard's dearest friends, embarking  on a journey through the incredible Demarco Archive and learning more about this remarkable man..."The last great titan of Scottish art!"
Award-winning filmmaker Dr Marco Federici has directed, produced and edited the film, using personal footage from over 2 decades of filming Richard, as well as precious materials digitised from the Demarco archive.  This is a story of how a man born from hardworking Italo Scottish immigrants, overcame the odds to become one of the nation's most important living figures in art...yet has lived in penury for the last thirty years and is on the verge of losing his life's work. This Indiegogo campaign is an attempt to raise funds to complete the post-production and fund entry to the worlds biggest film festivals, bringing Richard's story to the attention of a global audience.
 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise £20,000 to complete cinema-standard post-production and market the film to prestigious festivals including Sundance, Tribeca, Venice and Berlin.
The post-production will include colour-grading, sound mixing, visual effects work from Scotland's most professional facilities, culminating in the final delivery of a feature-length film for cinema, streaming and televisual broadcast. Currently, the duration is 99mins.
In return for your contributions, there are a series of exciting "perks" available, including signed prints from Richard Demarco, DVD's and of course perpetual credits in the final film.


 
The Impact
Richard's life story is incredible however, he is arguably more celebrated and recognised in Poland, Germany, Romania and Italy than in his native Scotland. The documentary aims to tell for the first time on film the high-points and controversies of his career, and the distress of his current plight. The film will introduce him to a new global audience and it is hoped, attract the interest of academic institutions who may wish to learn more about the Demarco Archive.
Richard Demarco has arguably been an unpaid diplomat for Scotland, building bridges between alienated nations in Europe where others turned their backs, and as a result, he has discovered some of the most important contemporary artists of the late 20th century.
Filmmaker Marco Federici is a long-established producer and filmmaker for Scottish Television and BBC Scotland. Recently Marco produced the 90th-anniversary interview with Richard for the National Galleries of Scotland: https://vimeo.com/435444628
His work has made the official selection for the Edinburgh and Milan Film Festivals, and he is currently completing the historic "Restoration Reels" for the Glasgow School of Art, a series of prestigious short academic films documenting the story of the Mackintosh Building's tragic fire and restoration programme.
To learn more about the director and Richard Demarco please visit:
www.demarcoarchive.com
www.mlcproductionsuk.com

story:
What We Need 

True Social Equity in Cannabis, fiscally sponsored by Nothing Without a Company, is raising $42,000.00 for the feature documentary. Below is how the funds will be used for the production.

  • Pay artists who have worked camera, sound, and editing in the last 18 months of production during the COVID-19 scare and winter months as well as pay artists for filming, sound, and editing as we continue to document. 
  • Continue to document the process of fighting for TRUE social equity in cannabis, as the fight has not ended. 
  • Provide food, water, COVID-19 safety costs such as sanitizer and masks/face shields, and travel costs to support the film crew and demonstrations.
  • Application fees for submitting a feature documentary to the Sundance Film Festival, due September 2021, along with application fees for other film festivals. 

 

What You Get

Community Member - $20.00

Perk - Thank you in film credits and on social media!

Community Volunteer - $42.00 

Perks - Thank you in film credits and on social media! "Ex-Cons for Community and Social Change" T-Shirt and a 2020 "Get Your Shit Together: Guide to Getting Your Mind, Credit and Money Right" book by Award Winning Author LaMailede Moore, with a foreword by NY Times bestselling author Raymond Aaron.

Community Leader - $142.00

Perks - The above perks plus "Support Your Local Weed Man" T-Shirt, a 2015 "Man on the Inside Observations of Deviance: Thirteen Prison Character Types" book by Tyrone Muhammad, and a 2018 "Confessions of a Media Maven" book by Erick Porter, MBA Media Maven Worldwide.

Community King/Queen - $420.00

Perks - The above perks with an extra "Ex-Cons for Community and Social Change" and "Support Your Local Weed Man" T-Shirt and a first look at the final cut of the film being submitted to Sundance!  

Community Boss King/Queen - $4,200,00

Perks - The above perks with a total of 4 "Ex-Cons for Community and Social Change" and 4 "Support Your Local Weed Man" T-Shirts, AND Executive Producer Credit in the final cut of the film.  

Director’s Biography

Anna Rose Ii-Epstein (she/her/they/them) is a director, producer, actor, and activist. Anna Rose Co-Founded and is the Producing Director at Nothing Without a Company (NWaC), an immersive, site-specific theatre company founded in 2008. NWaC focuses on uplifting marginalized voices from the AANHPI, BIPOC, and LGBTQIA+ communities through revolutionary acts of theatre and film. Anna Rose has produced, directed, or performed in over 40+ theatre productions and short films in Chicago since 2003. She is a licensed massage therapist, energy worker, and two-time award winning film director with the 48 hour Film Project-Chicago.  Anna Rose is currently working on her first feature documentary about the IL cannabis industry.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Follow "True Social Equity in Cannabis" on Instagram, Facebook & Youtube
  • Share the campaign with a friend! 
  • Support local small biz.  

Short Summary/Director’s Statement

Hello and thank so much for your support following and sharing this movement.  This is dear to my heart as Cannabis has been apart of my life in various was for over 15 years. My Hawaiian wife and I, long-time residents of Uptown, along with 3 bad ass black women who are lifetime residents of Chicago's South Side, devoted our time and savings to apply for a "social equity" cannabis dispensary license. The State of Illinois mismanaged the process. We are not alone--over 4000 other groups have been waiting since mid-2020 when licenses should have been awarded. We, the people, are still waiting. I started documenting this debacle in September 2020 and there has been little to no progress from the state. The documentary which is being developed is about the experience of working with Illinois cannabis legislators.  Legislative ineptitude has derailed achieving TRUE social equity in cannabis and has effectively provided multi-state operators a monopoly over the industry at the expense of local TRUE social equity applicants. - Anna Rose  

About True Social Equity in Cannabis Documentary

It has been over a year and a half since 75 social equity dispensary licenses were scheduled to be issued through the Illinois Adult-Use Cannabis Social Equity Program. The intent of this program is to encourage local persons or communities that were historically impacted by arrest and imprisonment for cannabis offenses to participate in the legal cannabis industry. Yet, as of July 2021, no social equity licenses have been issued and IL cannabis industry ownership is 99% already wealthy white men!

Meanwhile, beginning in March 2021, cannabis sales exceeded alcohol sales with local communities seeing no benefits from cannabis tax dollars meant to rebuild areas impacted by the war on drugs. Multi-state operators are earning billions while formerly incarcerated people are still being locked up for selling and smoking. True social equity applicants have been lied to and excluded from the industry so we must fight for what is right.

Free the plant, free the people, boycott corporate cannabis.

* UPDATE July 12 - 18 / Ex-Cons for Community and Social Change (ECCSC), Tyrone Muhammad, Gregory Sherman Jr., along with Anna Rose Ii-Epstein and other TRUE Social Equity in Cannabis conducted a sit in in-front of Curaleaf on weed street. On day 4 emails where sent to several applicants awarding the long waiting licenses for 1) Transportation 2) Infusion & 3) Craft grow. The Illinois department of financial and professional regulators cannabis licensing also signed a deal with Illinois Lottery setting 2 dates for a lottery that will hand out dispensary licenses. However, applications have not been contacted about revised scores and it is not clear HOW the lottery will be conducted or WHO will be in the lottery. What is next? The whole world is watching. 

*UPDATE Posted August 14th / Controversy surrounds the winners of the lottery and licenses holders as former politicians, former police chiefs, current MSO owners and out of state operators win license. IL residence, impacted by the war on drugs, small business owners receiving these licenses are few and far between. Multiple lawsuits are currently underway and could disrupt the distributions of these "social equity" licenses. Meanwhile, "Illinois dispensaries sold a record $127.8 million in recreational marijuana in July, with a big boost coming from out-of-state fans who converged on Chicago for the Lollapalazoo music festival. The month's sales were 10% higher than May's record of $116.4 million, which were slightly higher than June's $115.6 million, according to a monthly report by the Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation." -  Channel 5

story: SYNOPSIS: when a principal has no teacher to teach summer school, he has no choice but to let the fun, but irresponsible teacher's assistant to do it. if he wants his job next year, he has to get a group of unmotivated, lazy students to pass. he has to learn what it takes to be a responsible teacher with the help of the cute teacher next door.
story_txt: SYNOPSIS: when a principal has no teacher to teach summer school, he has no choice but to let the fun, but irresponsible teacher's assistant to do it. if he wants his job next year, he has to get a group of unmotivated, lazy students to pass. he has to learn what it takes to be a responsible teacher with the help of the cute teacher next door.

story:
Synopsis
Saving Faith is a story about a highly successful Wall Street stockbroker and atheist, Bill Stewart, who has been permanently injured in a car accident while driving intoxicated.  Two years later, Bill attends his first Alcoholics Anonymous meeting the morning after having caused the death of the driver of another vehicle.  Bill is forced to grapple with his past, which now haunts him, and challenge his current life philosophy — or accept a higher power that might save his life.

Background
The story that inspired the film is a very personal one for me, and reflects on a life-changing event in my own life:  my alcoholism and attendance at Alcoholics Anonymous meetings from 2004–2010, which has led to my sixteenth consecutive year of sobriety.  While the plot, characters and relationships are fiction, the film is based on true stories and the people I encountered at those meetings.



New Beginnings
After recently retiring from a 30-year career teaching film and theatre arts, I decided it was time to start my own film production company.  LuckyStory Productions LLC is dedicated to producing films based on personal, universal life moments that are life-changing events worthy of a compelling story.  From short to feature-length films, documentaries to fiction, and comedies to drama, it’s my hope to tell stories that foster discussion, provoke action and entertain.

Early in my career, I had a chance to live in New York City for several years where I worked mainly in live theatre on Off-Broadway.  I worked in Europe and then with regional theatres across the country until my roles on daytime television—All My Children, One Life to Live, and especially my breakthrough part—a recurring role on Guiding Light opposite Morgan England, took me back to New York.

In 1992, I made my television series debut in Arizona as a guest star in Young Riders opposite John DeLancie.  I then co-founded Arizona Shakespeare Festival in 1992 and Southwest Shakespeare Company in 1994.  I have also appeared in Hidden Palms, Maneater with Sarah Chaulke, Deadly Dentists, Discovery ID, and numerous independent and feature films, commercials and industrial training films.  I have directed or performed in over 50 live theatre productions.

This is my first film as a writer, co-director, producer and actor.



LuckyStory Productions, LLC and PsychDesert Productions, LLC will serve as the creative and organizational engines behind this production. 

For information about me -- the writer, co-director, producer and actor, visit:  http://imdb.me/randymessersmith and www.randymessersmith.com.

For more information about PsychDesert Productions, visit:  https://psychdesert.com/.

Meet the team assembled so far:




What We Need & What You Get

The budget for Saving Faith is $20,000.  As you can see, the pre-production, production and post-production costs amount to 73% of the total budget. 

My first financial goal is to raise the $3,250 necessary to enter film festivals and provide marketing for the film so it will be seen by the widest possible audience.  Please see the section "Stretch Goals" below to learn how contributions beyond the original goal will be utilized. 

I invite you to join me on this journey and be an active participant in the realization of this vision. Check out the variety of exciting Perks you will receive when you become a contributor!  Perks are located on the right side of this page. 






How We'll Make a Difference
Producing a short film can be expensive, and it is very rare for a short film to make back any of its investment.  So why do it?   I've been successfully telling stories my entire life -- as a writer, actor, director, fight choreographer and theatre producer.  I've seen how certain stories can change people for the better.  I believe that Saving Faith has the power to be such a story.

We all can relate to the question of Saving Faith:  is it ever too late for redemption, or simply, to ask for forgiveness?  Our story's protagonist is living with an enormous amount of guilt because of what he's done.  He knows there is no going back and he's faced with a dilemma:  how does one react when a tragedy suddenly strikes your life?  This film deals with something so real and raw, and something that many can relate to in one way or another. 



Smooth Seas Do Not Make Skillful Sailors

Our #1 priority is the health and safety of our film and television community.  It is critical to our industry’s economy and continued prosperity.  Due to the COVID-19 pandemic,  we will be following the guidelines set forth by Back2One (the New Mexico Film Office’s health safety initiative) and SAG/AFTRA's Safe Way Forward and Return To Work initiative to ensure we continue to operate a safe set in the current environment.



Ehhh, What's Up Doc?

We'd love to hear from you!  If you want to know what's up with LuckyStory Productions or the Saving Faith film, or even just have a question, use the Contact Us form at the following link:   

Saving Faith Film Contact Us Form

Otherwise, stay up to date on all of the latest news and events, and help us spread the word by engaging with us on social media!

  facebook.com/savingfaithfilm

  @luckystory2021

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Quinn Nelson. I am a student at Vancouver Film School and I am the creator and director of "The Audition." I am asking for a total of $500 in order to achieve my vision. Most of the money will be put into the production design department as it is very important for this to be a believable short film. With your help, my production design team and I will be able to source the materials needed for this project. 

What We Need & What You Get

With our $500 goal, we will be spending this money on three things; the incredible production design as I mentioned before, hiring a sound mixer to ensure we have great dialogue, and food and drinks in order for our crew to stay full and happy! If you donate $20 or more, your name will appear on a special thanks credits page! 

The Impact

If you contribute, you will help fulfill the dreams of many students who haven't gotten the opportunity to shine thus far into our school year. 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge currently is sourcing the items needed for production design, specifically costumes. With our incredible production design team and our amazing costume designer, we will be able to find quick and creative solutions to achieve the vision we want.   

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't available to contribute, consider posting us on your social media! This will help us gain more exposure and help more people get excited for our project!

story:
ABOUT WINDOW 

Window, by first time writer, director, producer Hunter Hawkins, is a memorable, compelling, beautifully-acted and produced five-minute short film. Impossible to forget, Window is already winning awards, starting with Honorable Mention for Best First Time Filmmaker and Best Original Song; Top Shorts Awards.

Learn how you can help get it seen, below.

 

Why We Need Your Help Now

All money raised in this campaign will be used to recoup the cost of filming, including:

  • Equipment rental
  • Insurance
  • Lodging
  • Crew "crafty" meals
  • Costs associated with Covid safety protocols

And, in order to get the film seen—

  • Fees for festival submissions and screenings!

 

Why WINDOW is a Winner

The plot centers on Sarah and Caleb a studious, teen-age introvert brother and his vibrant, queer, college drop out sister. Their complicated family history creates dramatic ripples as long buried frictions erupt during a dark-of-night meeting. Truths are illuminated, love endures and windows literally open.

* Award-Winning Original Score * – Thank You, by written and performed by Hawkins, contributes a perfectly nuanced storytelling element and serves as the film’s dramatic score.

 

Why Window is for Everyone

If you have a sibling, family or a beating heart you’ll love this film. If you’ve ever had a difficult conversation, been afraid to be seen as your authentic self or wanted liberation for someone close, you’ll love this film.

 

MEET THE FILMMAKER

Hunter Hawkins, Writer-Director-Producer

Santa Barbara-local Hunter Hawkins is passionate about the power of media to amplify LGBTQ  voices and leverage the power of film to transform culture. A singer and actor since age eight, Hunter Hawkins has graced sets and stages of school auditoriums, theaters, films, shopping mall parking lots, rock concert venues and shared stages with legends, like Bill Champlain, David Foster, and Kenny Loggins.

A message from the director:

As an artist, I thank you in advance for joining with me to raise our voices and open our wallets to fund this film and create a more accepting, fearless and radiantly diverse world!

 

Learn more about Hunter and the making of the film, go to:

Link to Website: https://www.hunterhawkins.live

Link to Instagram Page: https://www.instagram.com/windowthefilm/
story_txt:
ABOUT WINDOW Window, by first time writer, director, producer Hunter Hawkins, is a memorable, compelling, beautifully-acted and produced five-minute short film. Impossible to forget, Window is already winning awards, starting with Honorable Mention for Best First Time Filmmaker and Best Original Song; Top Shorts Awards.Learn how you can help get it seen, below. Why We Need Your Help NowAll money raised in this campaign will be used to recoup the cost of filming, including:
Equipment rental
Insurance
Lodging
Crew "crafty" meals
Costs associated with Covid safety protocols
And, in order to get the film seen—Fees for festival submissions and screenings! Why WINDOW is a WinnerThe plot centers on Sarah and Caleb a studious, teen-age introvert brother and his vibrant, queer, college drop out sister. Their complicated family history creates dramatic ripples as long buried frictions erupt during a dark-of-night meeting. Truths are illuminated, love endures and windows literally open.* Award-Winning Original Score * – Thank You, by written and performed by Hawkins, contributes a perfectly nuanced storytelling element and serves as the film’s dramatic score. Why Window is for EveryoneIf you have a sibling, family or a beating heart you’ll love this film. If you’ve ever had a difficult conversation, been afraid to be seen as your authentic self or wanted liberation for someone close, you’ll love this film. MEET THE FILMMAKERHunter Hawkins, Writer-Director-ProducerSanta Barbara-local Hunter Hawkins is passionate about the power of media to amplify LGBTQ  voices and leverage the power of film to transform culture. A singer and actor since age eight, Hunter Hawkins has graced sets and stages of school auditoriums, theaters, films, shopping mall parking lots, rock concert venues and shared stages with legends, like Bill Champlain, David Foster, and Kenny Loggins.A message from the director:As an artist, I thank you in advance for joining with me to raise our voices and open our wallets to fund this film and create a more accepting, fearless and radiantly diverse world! Learn more about Hunter and the making of the film, go to:Link to Website: https://www.hunterhawkins.liveLink to Instagram Page: https://www.instagram.com/windowthefilm/

story:
Help bring this funky, junky, ridiculous and rebellious motion picture come to fruition. The script is ready. We are casting now and can't wait to put on our roller skates and fanny packs and get into hilarious trouble along California's freakiest boardwalk!

Roller Junkies is the 16th feature film by the Sultan of Sensationalism, Jared Masters. It is the story of two all-female roller skate gangs who battle for territory in Venice, Santa Monica and along the Boulevard of Broken Dreams!

This picture will be packed full of dangerous and gorgeous girls, clawing their way to their next hit. They need to stay high to ride, cause ruckus and rampage for revenge.

This colorful action-packed feature will amaze you. Funky, exciting, suspenseful... A picture you can be proud to be a part of, and with Frolic Pictures' distribution success rate of 100%, you know this film will be completed and released in a timely fashion.

We can only make it if you cough up a few bucks for the cause! We plead for your dollar, so that we may hire a great cast and crew- and feed them!

We also need the props and wardrobe that are involved in this story, and some equipment to film in glorious 4K HD.

 

 

Find out which gang our leading lady, Allison will be corrupted by, and forced to steal back a lucky skateboard...

THE NEONS:

You'll be amazed by Lucky Star and her specialty with throwing knives, licks 'em and sticks 'em, in your heart or other vital organs... Then there's Snow Flake, with a trade mark you might not expect... Anthrax, but it wont come in your mail, she'll throw it and blow it in your face, to make certain you'll be dead.

THE ANIMALS:

See Jinxie, flick about her deadly switchblades, while Kitty claws your throat out with her 10 inch razor-sharp nails! Then there's Krypto Kim, who claws her way to the top. A hoarder of Dogecoin and not a newbie with the nun-chucks! And don't forget Venus, who's velocity is deadly with a baseball bat.

Check out the great perks on the right... We're giving away some amazing stuff like props and wardrobe used in the film and cool opportunities, like on-screen cameos and VIP wrap party and premiere invitations. Even private dinner with the Gang! This could be your chance to come to Hollywood, and have a first-hand taste of the dream, in all it's hot pink-packaged glory!

And if you're broke, or just don't like to give, please spread the word and pass this page onto someone more charitable. We love you all and hope to rock your socks off with this insane story of the beautiful Beach Bunnies THAT KILL!

story:
About Aaron:

Aaron Toney has been doing stunts & acting professionally for 16 years. His passion for filmmaking lead him to working in other avenues as well, from acting, directing, and producing. He has been able to work with some of the best in the industry, and fortunate to call them mentors in his career, such as Chad Stahelski, David Leitch, J.J. Perry, and more.

Aaron Toney started his career with Marvel as the Falcon Stunt double in Captain America: Winter Soldier, and has been a part of the core team ever since.

He also is one of the Black Panther stunt doubles.

After working 6 years with Marvel, Aaron Toney has gained massive experience. His time working on set with Anthony Mackey, Sabastian Stan, The Russo Brothers, and other amazing people in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, has led Aaron to develop himself as a promising filmmaker. 

With a successful stunt career, he is officially ready to retire the Falcon wings and move on to create his first original series - Project H.

 

About Project H

In 2014, filmmakers Aaron Toney, Jason Sweat, and Linda Jewell set out to create an original film IP entitled “Throne”.

Collectively cumulating in over four decades in stunts, acting, writing, and producing, their partnership bolstered the success of “Throne” and its amazing following. With fans and friends asking for more content, it was clear that “Throne” had created a steady fandom.

Adding Co-Producer, Julia Maggio, and a more direct vision, Halvon Corp. Entertainment and Global Forge Studios was created to pool assets together and develop the expansive world of “Throne”. 

This campaign is to crowdfund for the pilot episode of the series.

Project H is not just some spur of the moment concept thought up over night. This world, its lore, and it’s characters have been passionately refined over the course of YEARS! And each member of this team believes in this material!

Project H has officially secured it's first cast member - Yoshi Sudarso! Most know for his role as Koda in The Power Rangers: Dino Charge series, and Suwo in Buffalo Boys! 

For the last decade we made our living by helping other artists bring their ideas to life. However, now, it is time to use all of the experience we have gained “in the field” for something truly original and our own!

 

What We Need 

Project H is a full budget production. Although we are efficiently and effectively using our resources (financial and otherwise), in accordance with our budget, we needed to create a crowdfunding campaign. The financial resources acquired through a successful campaign will be used to:

  • Fulfill the contracts of our amazing cast and production crews
  • Finance our top-tier post production teams (including digital/practical effects, editing, sound design, and original scoring)
  • Complete the design and manufacturing of our unique props, wardrobe, and sets

 

Challenges

The pandemic has been a blessing and a curse for Project H. These unprecedented times have given us the additional time we need to get Project H in the works and off the ground; but it has also allowed some setbacks for its production.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can financially support Project H, it would mean so much to us!

The other ways to support, include interacting with our campaign by re-posting, sharing, and commenting with our campaign on all social media platforms!

And that's all there is to it!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! We are fundraising to make a short film that aims to raise dementia awareness. Our SAG film, "27 Candles," follows a grandfather and granddaughter over 25 years as they struggle to make memories before dementia takes its toll. The story highlights identity, family, and the importance of making a memory. The screenplay has placed in five festivals to date, and we have pulled together an all-star cast and crew to make this come to life! Our cast members (including Michael Potts, Sofia Bryant, and Alysha Deslorieux) have starred in Netflix,  HBO, and Broadway shows; our cinematographers (Peter Pasacucci & Nikita Carpenter) have created work for Grammy and Emmy winners; and our director (Naaji Adzimah) has worked alongside Emmy winners and Academy Award nominees. We are working to make a film of the utmost quality to increase viewership to spread our message far and wide. With that mission comes the high cost of top quality equipment, shooting in quality locations, meeting new and expensive COVID requirements to keep everyone safe, and continuing to hire (and feed!) an amazing team. Please support our vision coming to fruition, and putting the spotlight on an illness that afflicts 50 million people, and affects the millions more that care for them. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to increase opportunities for distribution, enhanced viewership, and reach of our message, we are making a high caliber film. We can make a top-notch film for $49,336 - that would cover costs throughout pre-production, filming for a week, editing, through submissions for film festival screenings (our path to eventual distribution). The highest costs of our project are professional-grade camera and lighting equipment, rental fees for our various locations, compensation for our team, entry to film festivals, and costs associated to COVID protections. SAG now requires everyone involved to be rapid tested every three days, to have a COVID Compliance Officer on set, have PPE (masks, gloves, etc.) available to all, and to have all locations thoroughly sanitized and prepped. These COVID-prevention-related costs have demanded a sharp increase in our budget, but it is absolutely necessary to keep our team safe. 

In exchange for your support, we can offer producer titles in our credits and on IMDB, signed photos, invitations to the cast/crew screenings, exclusive behind the scenes footage, and more.

If you are interested in supporting us in exchange for a tax benefit, please email naajisky@gmail.com for information on how to donate through our 501(c)(3) non-profit fiscal sponsor.

 

The Impact

Every cent truly matters in helping us to make a quality film! We really appreciate any contributions in assisting us to carry our message forth.  The director's last film on mental illness, "Postal," has been an official selection of 16 film festivals, has played for and educated thousands on schizophrenia, and sparked numerous discussions on how we can better care for our mentally ill neighbors. We want this film to have even broader reach, with the aim to have it viewable on popular streaming platforms to continue to educate and raise awareness about an illness with an astounding 10 million new cases annually.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please support our art and mission by sharing this page! 

If you are interested in supporting us in exchange for a tax benefit, please email naajisky@gmail.com for information on how to donate through our 501(c)(3) non-profit fiscal sponsor.

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Starring - Kansas Bowling (Once Upon a Time in Hollywood), Tamara Glynn (Halloween 5), Adam Probets (Last Tango In Halifax), Lamissah La-Shontae (The Bay), Darren Whitfield (Emmerdale) and more!!

A sci-fi horror movie where a group of  teachers battle an unknown alien force.  Set in a school they must work together to stop the alien virus from escaping and taking over the world. What we think is just a normal day at 'Creek High,' the school becomes a place of 'cat and mouse'; the teachers are being hunted, but they must take measures to prevent the virus from escaping.

Jason's films have been showcased in notable international film festivals such as In The Frame Film Festival, Los Angeles CineFest, Hot Springs International Horror Film Festival, Golden Rake Awards and  Los Angeles Independent Film Festival. 

A Date With Ghosts was released by Wild Eye Releasing in 2015 and has won a broad fan base and warm reviews.  2017's Dark Vale was released May 2018.

Morris is  schedule for a release October 2021.

Currently developing several new feature film projects in a variety of genres, his third feature Morris opened to rave reviews across the board. Also Starring - Halloween/Miami Vice actress Tamara Glynn. Morris will be released worldwide in 2021 to physical and digital platforms.

Jason's previous movies are available at Retailers like Walmart, Target, Best Buy, Amazon Prime, and many more.

Jason was also nominated for best feature for Morris at the Midlands Movies Awards.


 

Creek Encounters 

Locations 

 

 What We Need & What You Get

  We have completed three feature films funded by ourselves and we obtained distribution deals    for all three films in the USA, UK and Europe.  Now we want to step up the game and attach   another named actor to the film Creek Encounters.  We can only create this exciting movie   with a bigger budget! We need your guys help to complete this fourth feature movie. We will   offer some great perks for the movie and you can contact us anytime you like with questions.

 

The Impact

Funding the movie will make a huge difference. We would usually work with a small budget by borrowing money off family and friends and these films still obtained distribution deals. Imagine the possibilities with a bigger budget.  You will help us go the down professional route by hiring talented cast and crew to bring the vision of this fourth feature film CREEK ENCOUNTERS to life!

 We have strong relationships with distributors that will give the film a wide release

 We completed three feature films, all went on to find distribution

You will pay for

Locations:  £500

Production design £500

Actors fees: £2,000 

Named actor fees: £3,000

Provision of refreshments for cast and crew: £2,000

Special effects including the creation of an animatronic spider and crashed UFO :£2,000

Extras in the movie: £500

Petrol fees: £1,000

Runners/Grips: £500 

Boom operator: £500

Make up and costumes: £500

Film insurance: £1,000

Risks & Challenges

We have previously made feature films for £2,000.  We now want to take this next movie to the next level.  If we did not hit our overall funding goal, we will still proceed and make this movie.  However, we have exciting plans and the bigger the budget the better the movie!  We plan to start shooting in summer 2021.  We have already recieved distribution offers for Creek Encounters.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

If you cant contribute to the movie, sharing this appeal can be just as important.

Thank you so much!

Jason Brown

Creek Encounters IMDB

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt13098780/?ref_=nm_...

Facebook

https://www.facebook.com/Creek-Encounters-11387...

Twitter

https://twitter.com/CreekEncounters

 

Meet The Cast

Kansas Bowling

Tamara Glynn

Katie Smart

Adam Probets

Natalie Biggs

James Barnes

Lisa Poisman

Darren Whitfield

 

Darren Randall

Philip Mawdsley

David Blackwell

Jude Forsey

Sam Rose

Lamissah La-Shonta

Olivia Maiden

Sophie Bullock

Alex Bullock

Maximilian SDF

story:
Hello, fellow horror fans or curious individuals! We are Deranged Minds Entertainment, a self-founded independent production company run by two insanely passionate horror fan and film buffs. We wrote, produced, and landed distribution across America on our first film "Red Eye" when we were 18 years old. Now, we're 22 and on post-production for our second feature film, "Inverted". That's the one you're probably curious about, so here is a short summary of our newest film below.

Set in the '70s, an off-the-grid satanic cult known as the "Inverts" kidnap four individuals to recruit for the holy war against the second coming of Christ. A lesbian hippie, drug-addicted prostitute, a man in drag, and a pedophile priest fight to survive through various initiations that push past the most brutal of boundaries. "Inverted" is a satanic slay-fest that is sure to satisfy even the most hardcore horror fans appetite. If "Rosemary's Baby" and "The Lord's of Salem" had a 70's acid baby, it would be "Inverted".

Here's the breakdown, folks! We launched this campaign to give anyone one last chance to preorder "Inverted" in its glorious uncut, limited, hand-numbered and autographed edition. This brutal film is completely shot and is currently being edited as you can see from the official stills throughout the campaign. 100% of the funds raised from this campaign will go directly towards post-production on "Inverted". (For example, authentic 70's music or a renowned composer.)

Furthermore, 100% of any funds remaining after post-production will go directly into the Deranged Minds Entertainment production account to produce more content. What supporters get in return is a handpicked selection of limited edition perks to choose from, the UNCUT version of "Inverted" (which is very important because distribution will surely cut a lot), AND with every single DVD and Blu-Ray purchase you will receive a FREE DVD copy of "16 Days in Hell: The Making of Inverted". 

To wrap up, we are totally aware that some people are in a position where they can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! A simple share of our campaign on your Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter helps get the word out to new faces. Additionally, please tell all your horror pals about this sick satanic slasher that is on the horizon! Get them in on the carnage, we promise that this is a film they and you will surely not regret picking up.  We go above and beyond in this film and are undoubtedly bringing you the most sickening satanic sub-genre film you'll ever see. 

#INVERTYOURSELF

Like us on Facebook at Facebook.com/InvertedFilm and Facebook.com/DerangedMindsEntertainment
story_txt:
Hello, fellow horror fans or curious individuals! We are Deranged Minds Entertainment, a self-founded independent production company run by two insanely passionate horror fan and film buffs. We wrote, produced, and landed distribution across America on our first film "Red Eye" when we were 18 years old. Now, we're 22 and on post-production for our second feature film, "Inverted". That's the one you're probably curious about, so here is a short summary of our newest film below.


Set in the '70s, an off-the-grid satanic cult known as the "Inverts" kidnap four individuals to recruit for the holy war against the second coming of Christ. A lesbian hippie, drug-addicted prostitute, a man in drag, and a pedophile priest fight to survive through various initiations that push past the most brutal of boundaries. "Inverted" is a satanic slay-fest that is sure to satisfy even the most hardcore horror fans appetite. If "Rosemary's Baby" and "The Lord's of Salem" had a 70's acid baby, it would be "Inverted".



Here's the breakdown, folks! We launched this campaign to give anyone one last chance to preorder "Inverted" in its glorious uncut, limited, hand-numbered and autographed edition. This brutal film is completely shot and is currently being edited as you can see from the official stills throughout the campaign. 100% of the funds raised from this campaign will go directly towards post-production on "Inverted". (For example, authentic 70's music or a renowned composer.)
Furthermore, 100% of any funds remaining after post-production will go directly into the Deranged Minds Entertainment production account to produce more content. What supporters get in return is a handpicked selection of limited edition perks to choose from, the UNCUT version of "Inverted" (which is very important because distribution will surely cut a lot), AND with every single DVD and Blu-Ray purchase you will receive a FREE DVD copy of "16 Days in Hell: The Making of Inverted". 


To wrap up, we are totally aware that some people are in a position where they can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! A simple share of our campaign on your Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter helps get the word out to new faces. Additionally, please tell all your horror pals about this sick satanic slasher that is on the horizon! Get them in on the carnage, we promise that this is a film they and you will surely not regret picking up.  We go above and beyond in this film and are undoubtedly bringing you the most sickening satanic sub-genre film you'll ever see. 

#INVERTYOURSELF
Like us on Facebook at Facebook.com/InvertedFilm and Facebook.com/DerangedMindsEntertainment

story:
After being separated for three months, Kate calls up Jake to ask if they can meet. She has some news that is exciting, yet devastating. The meeting prompts the pair to reminisce, exploring what happened to their relationship...

Kate & Jake is a truthful, hard-hitting yet funny tale of adolescent love and working class hardships, exploring the themes of guilt, loss and dreams within the city of Liverpool, England.

 

 

 

Admittedly, £5,000 seems like a lot of money to the normal person. However, in regards to filmmaking, it is considered somewhat of a micro-budget. We need your help in order to fund various different aspects of production, such as: 

  • Securing the various locations needed for the film
  • Hiring sufficient lighting equipment
  • Feeding our cast and crew
  • Transport costs for our cast, crew and equipment
  • Film Festival submissions
     


We have high aspirations for the film, from screening in prestigious film festivals around the world to receiving official distribution ready for its public release. Your contributions and involvement with our project is crucial for us to make Kate & Jake a reality, and even sharing our campaign with others who may be able to help can drive this production in the right direction.

A visual breakdown of our budget is laid out below for you to see what your support would be going towards...

 

 

If we fail to reach our intended goal of £5,000, we will still create the film. No question. It is definitely happening. This is a story that our creative team are determined to tell the world, however, our backs will be up against the wall and production will be much more difficult - that's why every single donation is crucial to the quality of the final product. Our cast and crew are already working for free, so the first element that will take a hit is our budget allowance for film festival submissions. This may result in us setting up a seperate Indiegogo campaign AFTER we have wrapped up on filming.

On the flip side, if we manage to SURPASS our £5,000 target, then we can begin to actually pay our cast and crew for their hard work on the project - which would be lovely. 

Please make sure to check out all of the available perks on offer, there are loads of great ways to get involved with the project and support us!

 

 

Sarah Chadwick

Playing the role of Kate

After starting with a local drama school and casting company, Sarah quickly realised that acting was her passion and developed a love for the craft. She developed her craft since childhood and began training at Liverpool Media Academy (LMA), and earning a first class honours degree in acting during her time there. During this time at LMA, Sarah performed in venues all across Liverpool such Hope Street Theatre, the Everyman Theatre and St George's Hall. She has tackled many strong female roles of the stage throughout her career, such as Propera (The Tempest), Marie (Woyzeck), Donna (The Seven Acts of Mercy) and Else (Festen).

Along with her experience in stage productions, Sarah has starred in various short films such as The Hunt (2017) and Colonize (2019). Also, she has been lucky enough to work with and attend masterclasses from critically acclaimed talent such as Scot Williams (Backbeat, Hillsborough, Meadowlands), Stephen Graham (This is England, Snatch, The Irishman), Sean Bean (The Lord of the Rings, Game of Thrones) and Christine Tremarco (Waterloo Road, Casualty). 

 

Michael Latham

Playing the role of Jake

Michael Latham is a Liverpool native actor who graduated with a first class acting degree from Staffordshire University in the summer of 2019, after completing his extended diploma at the Liverpool Media Academy (LMA). These years that Michael has spent refining his craft have resulted in him performing in some of the most prominent venues throughout Liverpool, whilst also starring in various short films, radio advertisements & voiceover gigs. Michael’s most recent credits include starring in a short film for the Merseyside Police Force, based on knife crime within the city.

He was also in the original cast of A Sacred Thing, a new play which toured around the UK last summer. During his time at University, Michael landed his first professional voiceover role in a film called BB Forever, where he voiced Liverpool icon Paul McCartney, working in partnership with Warner Bros. Other credits also include playing the roles of Woyzeck & Kim (Festen). At the age of 22, Michael has already had neary 10 years of performing experience. Represented by Alan Hamilton, Hamilton Management.

 

Crissy Rock

Playing the role of Auntie Jean

Crissy rose to fame after starring as the leading role in Ken Loach's Ladybird, Ladybird (1994), and subsequently won the Silver Bear at Berlin International Film Festival for her performance. She won the hearts of the British public whilst portraying the character of Janey York in the sitcom hit Benidorm between 2007-2015. In 2019, Crissy won Best Supporting Actress at the Los Angeles Film Awards for her performance in Cotton Wool (2017).

Aside from her acting resumé, she also participated in ITV's I'm a Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here! in 2011, and has been competing in this years Celebrity Masterchef too!

 

Anthony Devine

Playing the role of Ian

Anthony Devine graduated in 2018 with a first class degree in acting from Staffordshire University. Before this he completed his HND at LMA, this gave Anthony the opportunity to perform in some of the most prestigious venues in Liverpool, including The Everyman Theatre. Whilst training, Anthony played a number of leading and supporting roles including King Lear (King Lear), Cheswick (One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest) and Sir Michael (Dahling You Were Marvelous).

After graduating, Anthony's first professional acting job came in the form of playing the character of Leon Carragher in Anders Lustgarten's The Seven Acts of Mercy, under the direction of acclaimed Liverpool actor Scot Williams (Backbeat, Hillsborough, Meadowlands, The Crew). Anthony became the second actor to ever perform this role outside of the Royal Shakespeare Company. With each performance being sold out during the run at the Hope Street Theatre in Liverpool, Anthony received high praise for giving a believable and highly emotional performance of a character 50 years his senior.

 

Jack McLoughlin

Producer-Writer-Director

Jack McLoughlin is a writer, director, editor and producer based in Liverpool, England. Making films since he was a child, when he was 14 his short film Chupacabra won the Freehand Talent Award at FACT's Young Person Cinema Night.

In 2015, Jack's film Victims won the Vesbim Award at the Liverpool International Film Festival. Modern Lennon, a film which he also directed, was shown as part of Hurricane Films' (Of Time and The City, Sunset Song, A Prayer Before Dawn) Sgt Pepper's at 50 Celebration in the prestigious Woolton Picture House. Jack’s most recent short film; Shopping List, was made an Official Selection as part of the Los Angeles Lift Off Film Festival, which will be shown worldwide.

Jack has also worked on professional sets as a floor runner on shows such as Peaky Blinders and Danny Boyle's film Yesterday. He has also shadowed Directors Ben Wheatley and Phillip Barantini, the latter of which he was also the assistant for on his feature film Boiling Point starring Stephen Graham.

 

Thomas Elliott Griffiths

Producer and 1st Assistant Director

Thomas Elliott Griffiths from Wrexham, Wales, is a first-class graduate in Film Studies and Film Production from Edge Hill University. He has directorial experience in documentary, music video and narrative film productions. His debut documentary, Autism: A Curious Case of the Human Mind, earned Best Feature Documentary and Best of Festival awards at the 2017 Carmarthen Bay Film Festival, with the film going on to garner several nominations around the world. His following project, Sticks and Feathers (2018) saw his work awarded with the Best Factual Film prize in 2018 at Hothouse Theatre’s Nottingham Film Festival.

 

Thomas Forfar

Sound Mixer

Thomas' career commenced with the BAFTA nominated and Golden Globe winning production company Hurricane Films LTD. Subsequently, his music has scored the screen in Bill Nighy’s Sometimes Always Never (2018) and documented the Liverpool born British trade unionist Jack Jones in Unsung Hero: The Jack Jones Story (2018).

His sound has immersed audiences in television too, after his work with the family favourite Hollyoaks in 2020, and the Amazon Prime webseries Forward Slash / Jobs (2018 – 2020). His sound work on Captive (2019) attained him a nomination for The Best Sound Award at the Indie Film Awards 2019.

Additional to his Film and Television portfolio, he has worked commercially with ACC Liverpool and helped create podcasts, including The Nostalgic Vagabond (2020). Current productions include Kate & Jake (feature) and Mental Health: Behind the Stigma (feature documentary).

 

 

We have social media accounts on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram in order for everyone to keep updated with the production and development of the project.  Our goal is to help make our supporters feel included in the process of bringing this story to life, and consistently interacting with you all is a big part of that.

Even if you can't afford to contribute financially to the creation of Kate & Jake (2020 has affected just about everybody unfortunately), it doesn't mean that you're not invited to come along on the journey. You can also support this crowdfunding campaign by sharing it far and wide across your social media accounts, and even bringing it to the attention of friends and family that may also be interested in the story that we want to tell.

 

 

As with every film production, there will a number of risks that have to be accounted for beforehand - especially with the emergence of COVID-19 this calendar year. We feel that you deserve to be aware of any hurdles that might come our way, and how we intend to combat them.

The production of Kate & Jake is scheduled to take place over the course of 15 shooting days during the weekends throughout January, February and March, 2021. COVID-19 has the potential to derail this, depending on if it escalates again throughout December and forces us to shut down production. If this is the case, it will simply result in a delay of the film and we can confirm that the film will still head into production as soon as it is deemed safe to do so.

As discussed further above, we will also be filming Kate & Jake regardless of whether or not we meet the £5,000 target goal. Unlike a Sci-Fi or Western genre film, we don't have the challenge of elaborate costume and/or set design. Our story is grounded in drama, and therefore we have the upperhand in telling the story either way. The noticeable only difference will be in our production value - which we obviously would prefer to be as professional as possible.

story:
Our film, A City Within a City, tells historical and contemporary stories of Black men and women in Grand Rapids, Michigan struggling for freedom, equality, and justice.

We explore these stories through the lens of Dr. Todd Robinson's concept of "managerial racism" from his book of the same title. It's the polite, covert tactics that limit the progress of Black citizens while creating the impression of forward movement in a progressive, justice-minded environment.

We started this journey two years ago encapsulated in this book that, as Black Grand Rapidians, we felt had shined a light on a dark history that was hidden. We wanted to find a way to bring the stories from the book to more people, since most people don't read academic dissertations! So the best way for us to get the contents of the book to the masses, especially young people, was to put it in a film. With your help!

What We Need & What You Get

Generous foundations have given us a tremendous start, but this film is a community project: "nothing about us without us!" So the community is being consulted through multiple channels for feedback, materials, and stories, but also through this opportunity to have a financial ownership stake. Your contribution gets us to PRODUCTION! As in Lights, Cameras, ACTION!

  • cameras bought
  • sets designed & built
  • animation created
  • crew hired
  • community apprentices placed & trained

Your contribution will go toward these items even if the entire goal is not met. But it WILL BE! BECAUSE WE HAVE AN AWESOME COMMUNITY!!

The Impact

This film will be distributed across the country to help other communities where managerial racism is rampant. It will equip all who care about their city and want it to be healthier by providing examples of:

  • Resistance to gatekeeping
  • Overcoming roadblocks
  • Identifying managerial racism as it shapeshifts
  • Debating strategies of Black excellence vs. accommodation
  • White allyship

And this is just the beginning. The apprentices we place to learn major film crew roles will be the pioneers for our 501c3 incubator program, Grand Rapids Media Initiative & Film Incubator. The impact of that program will be wide-ranging for Black & brown videographers:

  • Training by pros
  • Top-level equipment lending library/community studio trust
  • Conferences & workshops
  • Networking & partnering
  • Screenings & talkbacks for the community
  • Go-to spot for local institutions seeking excellent videography from a more diverse perspective
  • Pipeline to national channels seeking talent

Risks & Challenges

Risks and obstacles are a part of any film. We have already experienced more than our fair share and do you see us slowing down? With the help of God and our community, nothing will stop us from achieving our goal.

  • Dr. Todd Robinson received many offers to turn his book into a film, he chose ours, has been working closely with us, and is committed to the end.
  • Born and raised in Grand Rapids, we do not have the option of letting our community down. We will make this film with whatever God provides, and it will reflect our voices.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Follow and share our social media channels (#GrandStandPictures) and the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Keep your eyes and ears open for memorabilia, videos, audio, anything that would contribute to this visual story.
  • Tell friends involved in videography to reach out to us if they would like to advance their careers
  • Help build our list of places to screen this film
  • Send us news of film festivals you admire
  • Tell us what gifts you could bring to our Incubator space
  • Email your ideas to info@grandstandpictures.com
