story:
Vea el tráiler y lea la descripción en español
Veja o trailer e leia a descrição em português
 

Summary

In his book Killing Hope, the late William Blum documents more than 50 examples of the U.S.'s interference in countries around the globe, almost half of them in Latin America. In the spirit of his work, we bring you the story of the subversion of Bolivian democracy, culminating in a deadly coup and the massacre of dozens of poor and indigenous protesters.

  • Discover how Bolivia's self-proclaimed democratic revolution has lifted up poor and working people—and provoked the ire of foreign and domestic elites
  • Learn how the United States has interfered in Bolivia's politics for decades, going back to the George W. Bush administration and the anticipated assassination of Evo Morales
  • See how a U.S.-backed fake news operation spread disinformation about Bolivia's government on social media, among international and American audiences
  • Understand the multi-layered conspiracy that framed a president for electoral fraud, provoked a military uprising, and shattered a country

With rarely seen evidence and interviews with journalists, academics, and Bolivians on the ground, we aim to draw attention to this tragic and criminal plot against a sovereign country, dispelling the State Department and corporate media myths that enabled it and striking a blow against imperialist aggression.

Who we are

We're a team of artists and journalists with a history of independent reporting on issues of empire. Moreover, we're assembling a group of prominent academics, commentators, and other personalities to help place this story in its greater context, who we hope to reveal to you very soon.

We need your help!

Your contribution to this project helps us increase our production values and more effectively spread the word by:

  • Allowing us to travel to interview subjects in person
  • Enabling us to dedicate more time to production and editing
  • Helping us ascertain rights to music and footage, invest in equipment, and enter the finished documentary into film festivals

Hitting our fundraising goal will allow us to devote all the resources we need to making this project a success and getting the truth out to as many people as possible. Anything else raised up to that point will go into funding the most crucial elements of the project. See the list of perks we offer our contributors, including various credits and other rewards.

The impact

As of the time of this writing, justice is yet to be served for the many families victimized during the Bolivian coup. The Inter-American Court of Human Rights has yet to release their final decision. Major conspirators are still walking free, even receiving protection in the United States. Bolivian society has been torn apart by those arguing different interpretations of the events, and the reputation of the country's first indigenous government and the movement behind it has been damaged.

Bolivians deserve the truth. And the people of the United States and other countries that took part in this conspiracy deserve to know what their governments do in their name. We hope to offer the definitive statement on Bolivia's 2019 political crisis, using all available evidence to establish without a doubt what took place. Your contribution helps make that happen!

Other ways you can help

Even small contributions help! You can also use the share tools above to help spread the word about this project. We're looking to get the word out to as many people as possible before the funding deadline, so please share this page on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and other platforms. Making noise about this project in your local activist groups, DSA/PSL chapters, etc. also really helps us out; remember, www.washingtonbullets.movie will take people to this page.

Your support will earn our eternal thanks, and the gratitude and solidarity of poor and working-class Bolivians struggling to tell their truth

 

 

 

Resumen

En su libro Killing Hope, William Blum documenta más de 50 ejemplos de la interferencia de Estados Unidos en países de todo el mundo, casi la mitad de ellos en América Latina. En el espíritu de su trabajo, les traemos la historia de la subversión de la democracia boliviana, que culminó con un golpe mortal y la masacre de decenas de manifestantes pobres e indígenas.

  • Descubra cómo la revolución democrática de Bolivia ha levantado a los pobres y trabajadores—y ha provocado la ira de las élites extranjeras y nacionales.
  • Conozca cómo Estados Unidos ha interferido en la política de Bolivia durante décadas, desde la administración de George W. Bush y el asesinato anticipado de Evo Morales.
  • Vea cómo una operación de noticias falsas respaldada por Estados Unidos difundió desinformación sobre el gobierno de Bolivia en las redes sociales, entre el público internacional y estadounidense.
  • Comprenda la conspiración de múltiples capas que acusó falsamente a un presidente de fraude electoral, provocó un levantamiento militar y dividió un país.

Con pruebas raras veces vistas y entrevistas con periodistas, académicos y bolivianos en el terreno, nuestro objetivo es llamar la atención sobre este trágico y criminal complot contra un país soberano, disipando los mitos del Departamento de Estado y de los medios corporativos que lo permitieron y dando un golpe contra los agresiones imperialistas.

Quienes somos

Somos un equipo de artistas y periodistas con un historial de reportajes independientes sobre temas del imperio. Además, estamos reuniendo un grupo de destacados académicos, comentaristas y otras personalidades para ayudar a ubicar esta historia en su contexto más amplio, que esperamos revelarles muy pronto.

¡Necesitamos tu ayuda!

Su contribución a este proyecto nos ayuda a aumentar nuestros valores de producción y a difundir la palabra de manera más eficaz al:

  • Permitiéndonos viajar para entrevistar a los sujetos en persona
  • Permitiéndonos dedicar más tiempo a la producción y edición
  • Ayudándonos a determinar los derechos de la música y el metraje, invertir en equipos e introducir el documental en festivales de cine.

Alcanzar nuestro objetivo de recaudación de fondos nos permitirá dedicar todos los recursos que necesitamos para hacer que este proyecto sea un éxito y hacer que la verdad llegue a la mayor cantidad de personas posible. Cualquier otra cosa que se plantee hasta ese momento se destinará a la financiación de los elementos más cruciales del proyecto. Consulte la lista de beneficios que ofrecemos a nuestros donantes, incluidos varios créditos y otras recompensas.

El impacto

Al momento de escribir esto, aún no se ha hecho justicia para las numerosas familias víctimas del golpe de Estado boliviano. La Corte Interamericana de Derechos Humanos aún no ha emitido su decisión final. Los principales conspiradores todavía caminan libres, incluso reciben protección en los Estados Unidos. La sociedad boliviana ha sido destrozada por quienes argumentan diferentes interpretaciones de los hechos, y la reputación del primer gobierno indígena del país y el movimiento detrás de él se ha visto dañada.

Los bolivianos merecen la verdad. Y el pueblo de Estados Unidos y otros países que participaron en esta conspiración merecen saber qué hacen sus gobiernos en su nombre. Esperamos ofrecer la declaración definitiva sobre la crisis política de Bolivia de 2019, utilizando toda la evidencia disponible para establecer sin lugar a dudas lo que sucedió. ¡Tu contribución ayuda a que eso suceda!

Puedes ayudar de otras formas

¡Incluso las contribuciones pequeñas ayudan! También puede utilizar las herramientas para compartir anteriores para ayudar a difundir este proyecto. Estamos buscando hacer correr la voz a la mayor cantidad de personas posible antes de la fecha límite de financiación, así que por favor comparta esta página en Facebook, Twitter, Instagram y otras plataformas. Hacer ruido sobre este proyecto en tus grupos de activistas locales, secciones de DSA/PSL, etc. también nos ayuda mucho; recuerde, www.washingtonbullets.movie llevará a las personas a esta página.

Su apoyo ganará nuestro eterno agradecimiento, y la gratitud y solidaridad de los bolivianos pobres y de clase trabajadora que luchan por decir su verdad

 

 

 

Resumo

Em seu livro Killing Hope, William Blum documenta mais de 50 exemplos de interferência dos EUA em países ao redor do mundo, quase metade deles na América Latina. No espírito de seu trabalho, trazemos a você a história da subversão da democracia boliviana, que culminou em um golpe fatal e no massacre de dezenas de manifestantes pobres e indígenas.

  • Descubra como a revolução democrática da Bolívia levantou os pobres e os trabalhadores—e provocou a ira das elites estrangeiras e domésticas.
  • Saiba como os Estados Unidos interferiram na política boliviana por décadas, desde o governo George W. Bush e o antecipado assassinato de Evo Morales.
  • Veja como uma operação de notícias falsas apoiada pelos EUA espalhou desinformação sobre o governo boliviano nas redes sociais, para o público internacional e americano.
  • Entenda a conspiração multifacetada que acusou falsamente um presidente de fraude eleitoral, desencadeou uma revolta militar e dividiu um país.

Com evidências raras e entrevistas com jornalistas, acadêmicos e bolivianos no terreno, nosso objetivo é chamar a atenção para esta trama trágica e criminosa contra um país soberano, desfazendo os mitos do Departamento de Estado e da mídia corporativa que o permitiu e dando um golpe contra as agressões imperialistas.

Quem somos

Somos uma equipe de artistas e jornalistas com uma história de reportagem independente sobre questões do império. Além disso, estamos reunindo um grupo de estudiosos, comentaristas e outras personalidades proeminentes para ajudar a colocar esta história em seu contexto mais amplo, que esperamos revelar a você muito em breve.

Nós precisamos da sua ajuda!

Sua contribuição para este projeto nos ajuda a aumentar nossos valores de produção e a espalhar a palavra de forma mais eficaz ao:

  • Permitindo-nos viajar para entrevistar os sujeitos pessoalmente
  • Permitindo-nos gastar mais tempo na produção e edição
  • Ajudando-nos a determinar os direitos da música e das filmagens, investir em equipamentos e apresentar o documentário finalizado aos festivais de cinema

Alcançar nossa meta de arrecadação de fundos nos permitirá dedicar todos os recursos de que precisamos para tornar este projeto um sucesso e para levar a verdade ao maior número de pessoas possível. Qualquer outra coisa que surgir até esse ponto irá para o financiamento dos elementos mais cruciais do projeto. Confira a lista de benefícios que oferecemos aos nossos doadores, incluindo vários créditos e outras recompensas.

O impacto

No momento desta escrita, ainda não foi feita justiça para as muitas famílias que foram vítimas do golpe boliviano. A Corte Interamericana de Direitos Humanos ainda não emitiu sua decisão final. Os principais conspiradores ainda andam em liberdade, mesmo recebendo proteção nos Estados Unidos. A sociedade boliviana foi abalada por aqueles que defendem diferentes interpretações dos acontecimentos, e a reputação do primeiro governo indígena do país e o movimento por trás dele foram prejudicados.

Os bolivianos merecem a verdade. E o povo dos Estados Unidos e de outros países que participaram dessa conspiração merecem saber o que seus governos estão fazendo em seu nome. Esperamos fazer a declaração definitiva sobre a crise política boliviana de 2019, utilizando todas as evidências disponíveis para estabelecer sem dúvida o que aconteceu. Sua contribuição ajuda a fazer isso acontecer!

Você pode ajudar de outras maneiras

Mesmo pequenas contribuições ajudam! Você também pode usar as ferramentas de compartilhamento acima para ajudar a divulgar este projeto. Queremos passar a palavra ao máximo de pessoas possível antes do prazo de financiamento, então por favor compartilhe esta página no Facebook, Twitter, Instagram e outras plataformas. Faça barulho sobre este projeto em seus grupos ativistas locais, capítulos DSA / PSL, etc. também nos ajuda muito; lembre-se, www.washingtonbullets.movie levará as pessoas a esta página.

Seu apoio ganhará nossa gratidão eterna, e a gratidão e solidariedade dos pobres e da classe trabalhadora em Bolívia que lutam para falar sua verdade

Vea el tráiler y lea la descripción en españolVeja o trailer e leia a descrição em português SummaryIn his book Killing Hope, the late William Blum documents more than 50 examples of the U.S.'s interference in countries around the globe, almost half of them in Latin America. In the spirit of his work, we bring you the story of the subversion of Bolivian democracy, culminating in a deadly coup and the massacre of dozens of poor and indigenous protesters.
Discover how Bolivia's self-proclaimed democratic revolution has lifted up poor and working people—and provoked the ire of foreign and domestic elites

Learn how the United States has interfered in Bolivia's politics for decades, going back to the George W. Bush administration and the anticipated assassination of Evo Morales
See how a U.S.-backed fake news operation spread disinformation about Bolivia's government on social media, among international and American audiences
Understand the multi-layered conspiracy that framed a president for electoral fraud, provoked a military uprising, and shattered a country
With rarely seen evidence and interviews with journalists, academics, and Bolivians on the ground, we aim to draw attention to this tragic and criminal plot against a sovereign country, dispelling the State Department and corporate media myths that enabled it and striking a blow against imperialist aggression.Who we areWe're a team of artists and journalists with a history of independent reporting on issues of empire. Moreover, we're assembling a group of prominent academics, commentators, and other personalities to help place this story in its greater context, who we hope to reveal to you very soon.We need your help!Your contribution to this project helps us increase our production values and more effectively spread the word by:
Allowing us to travel to interview subjects in person
Enabling us to dedicate more time to production and editing
Helping us ascertain rights to music and footage, invest in equipment, and enter the finished documentary into film festivals
Hitting our fundraising goal will allow us to devote all the resources we need to making this project a success and getting the truth out to as many people as possible. Anything else raised up to that point will go into funding the most crucial elements of the project. story:
[Desplazar hacia abajo para español]

About the project

Producer and Director Doris Hakim first met the founders of Liwan - Sami Jabali, Sally Azzam and Silke Wanner - back in 2016, when an exhibition she was to put on in Nazareth was banned. They came out to support her, and she immediately fell in love with them and with Liwan.

Sami Jabali, Silke Wanner and Sally Azzam, founders of Liwan

Opening and running Liwan has been a constant struggle for its founders. The space has been attacked in the past, but they have maintained the drive and passion to continue with the project.

Painting bullet marks on the doors of Liwan after the shooting

Liwan was founded in 2016 with the intention of driving a rejuvenation of the souq (market) in the old city of Nazareth.

An Israeli government “redevelopment” project in the late 1990s shut down most businesses in the souq for many years. After the market reopened, it had lost much of its life. Since Liwan opened, other businesses that support and promote Palestinian traditional culture have been starting, and the old city is beginning a new life as a cultural destination.

Palestinians are a minority inside the state of Israel, and their culture has been deliberately and systematically marginalised by the Israeli state. Consequently, another major goal for Liwan is to support and promote local Palestinian culture, by hosting concerts by local Palestinian musicians, poetry readings, art exhibitions, showings of films, and acting as a meeting point for tours visiting Palestinian heritage.

We want to tell the story of Liwan: how it came into being, what its mission is, and to give an insight into the life of the space and its role in the local community. Much coverage of Israel-Palestine in the news focuses on the conflict and on the political situation. This is an opportunity to tell a different story: a story of the everyday struggles of real people, and a rare story of Palestinian Arab success within the state of Israel.

About the producers

Producer and Director Doris Hakim is an artist with a long career specialising in performance art and installations, including many video projects. She was born and raised in Nazareth and is currently based in Seville, Spain where she is doing a PhD on Arab women artists with dual identity.

Producer and Cameraman Adam Newby has a background in software, photography and videography. Born in the UK, Adam studied at Cambridge University before moving to Seville to study flamenco guitar. He is still based there, where he works taking photos in the studio, on location and of live shows, and working on video projects.

How you can help

We already shot the majority of the footage we need to make this movie, paying our own expenses and using our own equipment. Now we need your support to finish it! The next major phase of the project is editing and post-production. We are using local professionals for this, based in Nazareth. This phase of the project can take 1-2 months minimum, and we will need to pay our editor, sound post-producer, etc, for may hours of work. We will also need to secure the rights to archive material, and pay for local artists to provide music for the documentary.

Please help us make this movie by contributing what you can. We have a range of exciting perks we can give you in return!

Thank you!

Doris & Adam

PS don't forget to tell your friends about the project! Use the sharing tools on this page to spread the word, and visit us on Facebook.

Sobre el proyecto

La productora y directora Doris Hakim conoció por primera vez a los fundadores de Liwan, Sami Jabali, Sally Azzam y Silke Wanner, en 2016, cuando prohibieron una exposición que iba a tener lugar en Nazaret. Los tres salieron a apoyarla y ella inmediatamente se enamoró de ellos y de Liwan.

Abrir y mantener Liwan ha sido una lucha constante para sus fundadores. El espacio ha sido atacado en el pasado, pero mantienen el impulso y la pasión para continuar con el proyecto.

Liwan se fundó en 2016 con la intención de impulsar el rejuvenecimiento del zoco (mercado) en el casco antiguo de Nazaret.

Un proyecto de "reurbanización" del gobierno israelí en la última parte de los noventa provocó el cierre de la mayoría de los puestos en el zoco durante muchos años. Cuando se abrió de nuevo, había perdido gran parte de su vida. Desde que Liwan abrió sus puertas, otros negocios que apoyan y promueven la cultura tradicional palestina han abierto, y la ciudad vieja está comenzando una nueva vida como destino cultural.

Los palestinos son una minoría dentro del Estado de Israel, y su cultura ha sido deliberada- y sistemáticamente marginada por él. En consecuencia, otro objetivo importante para Liwan es apoyar y promover la cultura palestina local, organizando conciertos de músicos locales palestinos, lecturas de poesía, exposiciones de arte, proyecciones de películas y actuando como punto de encuentro para visitar el patrimonio palestino.

Queremos contar la historia de Liwan: cómo surgió la idea, cuál es su misión, y dar una idea de la vida del espacio y su papel en la comunidad local. Gran parte de la información sobre Israel-Palestina en las noticias se centra en el conflicto y en la situación política. Esta es una oportunidad para contar una historia diferente: una historia de las luchas cotidianas de personas reales y una historia poco típica del éxito árabe-palestino dentro del Estado de Israel.

La productora y directora Doris Hakim es una artista con una larga carrera especializada en artes escénicas e instalaciones, que incluye muchos proyectos de video. Nació y creció en Nazaret y actualmente reside en Sevilla, España, donde realiza un doctorado sobre artistas árabes con doble identidad.

El productor y cámara Adam Newby tiene experiencia en software, fotografía y vídeo. Nacido en el Reino Unido, Adam estudió en la Universidad de Cambridge antes de mudarse a Sevilla para estudiar guitarra flamenca. Sigue residiendo allí, donde trabaja tomando fotos en el estudio, en la ubicación y de los shows en vivo, y trabajando en proyectos de video.

Como puedes ayudar

Ya grabamos la mayoría del material que necesitamos para hacer este documental, pagando nosotros mismos nuestros gastos, y utilizando nuestro propio material de video etc. Ahora necesitamos vuestra ayuda para terminarlo! La siguiente fase importante del proyecto es edición y pos-producción. Vamos a usar profesionales locales, afincados en Nazaret, para ello. Este fase del proyecto puede durar 1-2 meses como mínimo, y necesitaremos pagar a nuestro editor, pos-productor de sonido, etc, por muchas horas de trabajo. También necesitaremos pagar para derechos de material de archivo, y pagar a artistas locals para producir música para el documental

Por favor ayúdanos a hacer esta película contribuyendo con lo que puedas. ¡Tenemos una colección de interesantes recompensas para ofrecerte a cambio!

¡Gracias!

Doris y Adam

PD no te olvides de contárselos a tus amigos sobre el proyecto! Usa las herramientas en esta página para hacer correr la voz, y visítanos en Facebook.
story_txt: [Desplazar hacia abajo para español]About the projectProducer and Director Doris Hakim first met the founders of Liwan - Sami Jabali, Sally Azzam and Silke Wanner - back in 2016, when an exhibition she was to put on in Nazareth was banned. They came out to support her, and she immediately fell in love with them and with Liwan.Sami Jabali, Silke Wanner and Sally Azzam, founders of LiwanOpening and running Liwan has been a constant struggle for its founders. The space has been attacked in the past, but they have maintained the drive and passion to continue with the project.Painting bullet marks on the doors of Liwan after the shootingLiwan was founded in 2016 with the intention of driving a rejuvenation of the souq (market) in the old city of Nazareth.An Israeli government “redevelopment” project in the late 1990s shut down most businesses in the souq for many years. After the market reopened, it had lost much of its life. Since Liwan opened, other businesses that support and promote Palestinian traditional culture have been starting, and the old city is beginning a new life as a cultural destination.Palestinians are a minority inside the state of Israel, and their culture has been deliberately and systematically marginalised by the Israeli state. Consequently, another major goal for Liwan is to support and promote local Palestinian culture, by hosting concerts by local Palestinian musicians, poetry readings, art exhibitions, showings of films, and acting as a meeting point for tours visiting Palestinian heritage.We want to tell the story of Liwan: how it came into being, what its mission is, and to give an insight into the life of the space and its role in the local community. Much coverage of Israel-Palestine in the news focuses on the conflict and on the political situation. This is an opportunity to tell a different story: a story of the everyday struggles of real people, and a rare story of Palestinian Arab success within the state of Israel.About the producersProducer and Director Doris Hakim is an artist with a long career specialising in performance art and installations, including many video projects. She was born and raised in Nazareth and is currently based in Seville, Spain where she is doing a PhD on Arab women artists with dual identity.Producer and Cameraman Adam Newby has a background in software, photography and videography. Born in the UK, Adam studied at Cambridge University before moving to Seville to study flamenco guitar. He is still based there, where he works taking photos in the studio, on location and of live shows, and working on video projects.How you can helpWe already shot the majority of the footage we need to make this movie, paying our own expenses and using our own equipment. Now we need your support to finish it! The next major phase of the project is editing and post-production. We are using local professionals for this, based in Nazareth. This phase of the project can take 1-2 months minimum, and we will need to pay our editor, sound post-producer, etc, for may hours of work. We will also need to secure the rights to archive material, and pay for local artists to provide music for the documentary.Please help us make this movie by contributing what you can. We have a range of exciting perks we can give you in return!Thank you!Doris & AdamPS don't forget to tell your friends about the project! Use the sharing tools on this page to spread the word, and visit us on Facebook.Sobre el proyectoLa productora y directora Doris Hakim conoció por primera vez a los fundadores de Liwan, Sami Jabali, Sally Azzam y Silke Wanner, en 2016, cuando prohibieron una exposición que iba a tener lugar en Nazaret. Los tres salieron a apoyarla y ella inmediatamente se enamoró de ellos y de Liwan.Abrir y mantener Liwan ha sido una lucha constante para sus fundadores. El espacio ha sido atacado en el pasado, pero mantienen el impulso y la pasión para continuar con el proyecto.Liwan se fundó en 2016 con la intención de impulsar el rejuvenecimiento del zoco (mercado) en el casco antiguo de Nazaret.Un proyecto de "reurbanización" del gobierno israelí en la última parte de los noventa provocó el cierre de la mayoría de los puestos en el zoco durante muchos años. Cuando se abrió de nuevo, había perdido gran parte de su vida. Desde que Liwan abrió sus puertas, otros negocios que apoyan y promueven la cultura tradicional palestina han abierto, y la ciudad vieja está comenzando una nueva vida como destino cultural.Los palestinos son una minoría dentro del Estado de Israel, y su cultura ha sido deliberada- y sistemáticamente marginada por él. En consecuencia, otro objetivo importante para Liwan es apoyar y promover la cultura palestina local, organizando conciertos de músicos locales palestinos, lecturas de poesía, exposiciones de arte, proyecciones de películas y actuando como punto de encuentro para visitar el patrimonio palestino.Queremos contar la historia de Liwan: cómo surgió la idea, cuál es su misión, y dar una idea de la vida del espacio y su papel en la comunidad local. Gran parte de la información sobre Israel-Palestina en las noticias se centra en el conflicto y en la situación política. Esta es una oportunidad para contar una historia diferente: una historia de las luchas cotidianas de personas reales y una historia poco típica del éxito árabe-palestino dentro del Estado de Israel.La productora y directora Doris Hakim es una artista con una larga carrera especializada en artes escénicas e instalaciones, que incluye muchos proyectos de video. Nació y creció en Nazaret y actualmente reside en Sevilla, España, donde realiza un doctorado sobre artistas árabes con doble identidad.El productor y cámara Adam Newby tiene experiencia en software, fotografía y vídeo. Nacido en el Reino Unido, Adam estudió en la Universidad de Cambridge antes de mudarse a Sevilla para estudiar guitarra flamenca. Sigue residiendo allí, donde trabaja tomando fotos en el estudio, en la ubicación y de los shows en vivo, y trabajando en proyectos de video.Como puedes ayudarYa grabamos la mayoría del material que necesitamos para hacer este documental, pagando nosotros mismos nuestros gastos, y utilizando nuestro propio material de video etc. Ahora necesitamos vuestra ayuda para terminarlo! La siguiente fase importante del proyecto es edición y pos-producción. Vamos a usar profesionales locales, afincados en Nazaret, para ello. Este fase del proyecto puede durar 1-2 meses como mínimo, y necesitaremos pagar a nuestro editor, pos-productor de sonido, etc, por muchas horas de trabajo. También necesitaremos pagar para derechos de material de archivo, y pagar a artistas locals para producir música para el documentalPor favor ayúdanos a hacer esta película contribuyendo con lo que puedas. ¡Tenemos una colección de interesantes recompensas para ofrecerte a cambio!¡Gracias!Doris y AdamPD no te olvides de contárselos a tus amigos sobre el proyecto! Usa las herramientas en esta página para hacer correr la voz, y visítanos en Facebook.

story:
ANNOUNCEMENT: WIN THE ULTIMATE SHIRT!

SIGNED BY THE CAST AND CREW!

After you fall in love with the movie, you're going to want to own this shirt, signed by our cast and crew! Everyone who donates $50 or more by 6/30 at 12 PM (American Atlantic Ocean Time) will have their name entered in a drawing to win this soon to be priceless collector's gem. Everyone who's already donated, you're in the drawing already! CHEERS!

ANNOUNCEMENT: WIN SHAWN'S SHIRT!

Recognize this bohunk? That's right. He's Shawn Knox. He's starting to get sort of famous after being in this little movie called "Cherry", it was directed by the guys who made some movie called "The Avengers". It's about superheroes or something. AND WE'RE GIVING AWAY HIS SHIRT FROM THE MOVIE! He's agreed to sign it because he's such a nice guy. 

Anyone who donates $20 or more by Tuesday (6/15) at noon (eastern time) will have their name placed in a raffle to win the shirt. Anyone who has already donated is already in the raffle. We'll announce the winner Tuesday at 5 PM. Cheers!

NEW PERK: LANDSCAPER STORIES!

As mentioned in the video, I had some incredible (mis)adventures with some of the most famous people on the planet. I'll tell you all about the time I ruined Courteney Cox's floor, had a panic attack in front of Charlize Theron, struck out with Giovanni Ribisi (you'll need to let me explain) and more :)

This perk will be included for anyone donating $50 or more and to everyone who has already donated to this point. Thanks for all your help!

ABOUT THE MOVIE

What is Movers Ultimate?

Movers Ultimate is the story of two best friends who must get off work in time to make it to their 10-year high school reunion and reconnect with the girls that got away. Get ready to laugh your asses off.

What's it going to be like?

Prior to filming, the cast and crew were given a list of movies to watch for inspiration. Among those movies, heavy emphasis was placed on Superbad, Sex Drive, Waiting and Booksmart. These movies are hilarious, crude and down to earth. 

WHY INDIEGOGO? 

We need help. Indiegogo gives us the opportunity to reach out to the people directly who (whom?) we're making the movie for. There's a lot that goes into making a movie after you've finished shooting and if you can help us finish it up, we want to make it worth your while.

Finishing Touches

We're 90% finished! The making of any movie contains but isn't limited to its writing, casting, scheduling, production design, prop construction, location scouting, filming, editing, distribution and much, much more. We've got just about all of this done. But like every movie, the scenes, although edited together, need proper color grading, sound editing and music to finalize them. The trailer seen above doesn't include any of this fine tuning, so if you enjoyed what you saw, it's only going to get more ultimate.

Get Your Name In The Credits

Every dollar counts and we appreciate anyone willing to become a part of this project. That's why we're offering backers who make a donation the opportunity to have their name in the end credits under our special thanks! 

Movers Ultimate is expected to release Summer 2022

But we're not making you wait that long! We'll be taking the movie on a proper marketing tour for the duration of 2021 and the majority of 2022 in order to garner a proper wide release. In the mean time, we're offering backers who make a donation to this campaign a sneak peak of the movie THIS LABOR DAY WEEKEND (a couple months from now)! 

Following this sneak peak, we'll be locking Movers Ultimate back up, never to be seen again outside of festivals and the living rooms of those related to us by blood. Distribution deals take time, sometimes years to finalize. But if you're willing to support us, you deserve to see it early and we're eager to share it with you. Cheers!

MEET THE CAST AND CREW

Shawn Knox graduated from Kent State University and attended the Houde School of Acting in Cleveland shortly after. There he studied the Meisner technique, on camera, and improvisation. He also teaches the technique under Jessica Morris, the schools founder/owner. Shawn has worked across multiple Film, TV, and Commercial projects the past few years. His most recent credit being “Cherry” opposite Tom Holland, directed by the Russo Brothers. 

Born and raised in Oakland, CA. Andy J. Carlson was a varsity athlete at Bishop O’Dowd High School who spent his time on a baseball field instead of a stage. Although he enjoyed his tech job after college, he always considered the pursuit of an acting career. After a little push from his hometown friends, that dream became a reality in the Fall of 2017 when he submitted for his first audition.

Acting in films is a main highlight for Annalese’s many interests.

Her career includes being a university photojournalist for many years, a current local news anchor, a massage therapist, and in the last ten years, she has stepped into film and commercial work.

With multiple thrillers and horror films, dramas and comedies, she keeps a sense of playfulness portraying a wide range of characters from soccer moms, to homeless grifters.  ..And just for fun, modeling for the occasional adult underwear ads keeps her sense of humor.

Sé Marie is based out of Los Angeles, earning an acting degree in 2011. She began her career as a stunt double for Rachel McAdams and Vinessa Shaw, before transitioning fully into a career in acting.

Sé has led several feature films to major film festivals, including “Career Opportunities in Organized Crime” (South by Southwest Film Festival 2016) and “Careful Not to Cry” (Toronto International Film Festival 2017). In 2019, she co-starred in a national Nissan commercial campaign alongside actress Joey King.

Sé recently won an award for Best Ensemble Cast for the feature film “Force to Fear” at GenreBlast Film Festival 2020, and was also the winner of the Glorioso Casting One Minute Monologue Challenge, which accepted submissions from around the world.

Sé Marie can be seen in the upcoming feature film “Unsinkable” about the aftermath of the Titanic, pending an upcoming theater release date, and is currently in post-production for the comedy feature film “Movers Ultimate”, which has a wide release set for Summer 2022. She also led the sci-fi short film “Artificial Existence” to many major festivals this year (still currently making its festival run), and produced/directed/starred in an original web series titled “A Very Covid Christmas”, which premiered on YouTube and has been highly reviewed by the press.

Taking advantage of the pandemic year 2020, Sé starred in an international live Zoom play titled “Water Child”, which featured an international cast and was globally hailed for the production’s creativity and talent.

Sé Marie is also currently in post-production for a highly anticipated pilot television project, which she stars in and produces. Further details cannot be disclosed at this time.

Grant Thomas Brooks was born on June 21st, 2001 in Columbus, Ohio. Working for PCG talent in Columbus, Grant is an American stage and film actor, best known for his role as Josh in the horror movie "Don't Run" and as Miles in the reboot of the horror franchise "Wrong Turn".  Grant has been involved with 2 student films associated with the Delaware Area Career Center which have won Emmys in the Ohio Valley Chapter. Along with stage and film acting, Grant spends some of his free time as a World War II reenactor and amateur military historian.  Grant is the youngest in his family, having three older sisters.

Jeremy Farley is a Stage and Screen Actor, Born and raised in LA but now is making his way to New York CIty within 2021.

At a very young age Jeremy started performing in his parents company Mimeistry Int. Todd and Marilyn Farley created Mimeistry Int, after they were trained as professional Mimes by Marceal Marceau in Paris France. With a strong base in Mime, physical storytelling and comedy, Jeremy moved on to Acting. 

In 2019 Jeremy gained a BFA in Acting from Wright State University. Jeremy has performed in everything from Shakespeare to Musicals, Contemporary plays to Long Form Improv, and even some Puppetry and Comedia Larte.

Having studied and performed Commedia Del Arte in Italy, with the Italian master Fabio Mangolini. Although relatively new to film, Jeremy is blasting his way through the industry and is thrilled to be a part of the Movers Ultimate Team!

Grant Kennedy Lewis is an actor based in Chicago, IL with experience in Theatre, Television, and Film. He graduated from Northwestern University in 2018 and has been working professionally in the Midwest ever since. Recently, Grant has appeared in a Season 5 episode of Chicago Med and will be seen in an upcoming episode of How to L0ve, a webseries about tennis ball people. He is very excited to share Movers Ultimate with the greater moving community! 

Steven Strafford is an actor and playwright born in NYC and based in Chicago. On stage, he's been seen around the country and around the world in comedies, musicals, and performances of his one-man show, Methtacular!  He has been on TV, in movies, and in a national commercial in the harrowing role of "real person." 

Chaney Morrow is a film and stage actor known for Haunt (2019), Wrong Turn (2021) and Dark Waters (2019). He is a native of Dayton, OH. 

I'm not going to talk about myself in third person because I'm the one making this page and that feels weird. But the interesting points of my life can be boiled down to this: I had braces three times. After that I freaked my parents out when I was 15 and told them I wanted to make a living as a filmmaker. I got into Ohio University's Scripps School of Communications where I crushed cheap beer and occasionally class. Moved to L.A. Worked freelance on some big commercials and TV shows. When freelance wasn't there, I installed trees for rich people to pay bills and keep the lights on (this gig was crazy, I ruined Courteney Cox's floor one day. On another, I had a panic attack in front of Charlize Theron when I was trying to show off my muscles and a spider crawled on me. I once sold a tree to a homeless lady from Jupiter, or so she claimed. Haven't fact-checked). The job resulted in a back injury. Went broke. Moved home to live in my parents' basement (awesome ice breaker for meeting ladies. Not). Saved money. Became a firefighter while making a movie over the course of 3 years. Got the movie noticed. Almost finished another movie. And here we are. It's wonderful to meet you. 

PERKS FOR CONTRIBUTING

We're offering special contributions for our backers! Check out below for some of our ultimate perks!

Get the Official T-Shirt from the Movie!

 27X40 Movie Poster SIGNED by Ben Rood

Official Movers Sunglasses (available in red, blue, pink or purple). Get one or collect them all!

The Beer Drinkers Koozie! (beer not included...)

The Ultimate Tankie!

RISKS AND CHALLENEGES

THERE IS SO MUCH SH!T ON STREAMING PLATFORMS.

Which is cool, kind of. I don't want to sound like a hypocrite, we're about to be one of them. But as a filmmaker, how do you stand out? How is anyone going to see our movie out of the 14,356 other streaming titles?! Is that a movie with Chris Pratt, George Clooney AND Marilyn Monroe? WTF, how do we compete with that?!?! HOW IS ANYONE GOING TO GIVE A SH!T ABOUT OUR MOVIE MADE BY A BUNCH OF OUTSIDERS?!?!?!   

When you're an indie filmmaker, there's only one thing you can do to survive. You make the movie so damn sweet that people can't help but talk about it. And that all starts with you. 

Why Movers is Ultimate

So what's this mean? This great, ultimate, bromantic extravaganza? It is all of that. It's also hilarious (unless you're easily offended, in which case you might want to skip this one). But also, it's the product of hard work and what happens when determination meets opportunity. It's a movie made by a bunch of outsiders you've never heard of and yet somehow, we've managed to find our way to you. We've clawed for every inch to get here. Me, personally? I look back to when I had a freakin' dollar to my name. And now on behalf of my badass team, I'm here, getting to talk to you. This movie's a testament to following your dreams. And not quitting, even if you're moving furniture and living in your parents' basement to get there.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Money's tight. We respect that. Every buck counts. Let me say that again. Every buck counts. But if you don't have a buck, share us, tell someone about us. Social outreach goes a long way and is heavy lifting we can't do on our own.

SEE YOU SOONER THAN LATER

Thanks for tuning in. We're looking forward to bringing you into our furniture family and sharing this movie with you. Cheers and stay ultimate.

Best,

Ben and The Team

I look back to when I had a freakin' dollar to my name. And now on behalf of my badass team, I'm here, getting to talk to you. This movie's a testament to following your dreams. And not quitting, even if you're moving furniture and living in your parents' basement to get there.OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPMoney's tight. We respect that. Every buck counts. Let me say that again. Every buck counts. But if you don't have a buck, share us, tell someone about us. Social outreach goes a long way and is heavy lifting we can't do on our own.SEE YOU SOONER THAN LATERThanks for tuning in. We're looking forward to bringing you into our furniture family and sharing this movie with you. Cheers and stay ultimate.Best,Ben and The Team

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone, I am Theresa Godly, a professional Actor, Screenwriter and Producer.   I was inspired to write 'The Stranger I Love' because two years ago, I suddenly and without explanation lost contact with my child. I am still fighting my own battle in UK family courts.  When this strange behaviour began I was broken, but I pieced myself together and began to research via every avenue I could find.  I soon discovered that I had become another victim of Parental Alienation  -  a term I had never heard of before.  It astounded me that something which affects millions of people globally and so tragically was virtually unheard of! 

That got me thinking and led me to write an episodic series which took a year.  The idea to write the short film came from a friend who worked as an EP on 'Trial of the Chicago 7' (nominated for 7 Oscars, 3 BAFTAs and winner of Best screenplay at the 2021 Golden Globes) - I figured he knows his stuff, and embarked on writing this film.  The goal is to make sure everyone knows what Parental Alienation is and that we move towards this being illegal in every country of the world.

Our Director is the inimitable Martin Gooch, who is not only hugely experienced but someone I have known for years, worked with and trust implicitly with this film.  Martin is a BBC trained Director and has worked all over the world with many major broadcasters. He directed the BAFTA award winning and EMMY nominated Spooks Interactive (BBC/Kudos) and is a two time BBC New Director of the Year winner. Martin is a Director known for getting great performances from his actors, and every film and TV show he has directed has won an award. He has directed five feature films and worked on more than 200 productions. Martin has a Masters Degree in screenwriting and over 1000 days on set experience. 

This crowdfunding campaign will enable us to raise enough money to hire the best equipment, an experienced crew, and professional actors, as well as supporting artists.  It will assist with location hire, catering, transport,  production insurances and putting sustainability processes in place.  Once we have made the film, the hard work continues with the post-production process. Funds raised will help us to hire an experienced Editor, Sound Mixer, Colour Grader and implement CGI where necessary. All these ingredients go towards making the very best film of the highest sound and picture quality.  Once we have our finished product, we then begin the job of submitting to 176 BAFTA and Academy Awards qualifying film festivals around the world which costs thousands, so funds raised will also help the film to be seen widely and to be considered for various awards.

By donating whatever you can to this crowdfunder, you will be actively helping to affect real change for millions of alienated parents and children.  It will get discussions going around the world which means that the media, and governments have to sit and up and listen.   By educating the world about Parental Alienation;  what it is, it's damaging and destructive results  and how to recognise early signs - we can go some way to preventing other families around the world from being torn apart,  and from  despairing parents taking their own lives.  We really want you to feel you are part of something important, because anyone donating really is and will very much be part of the movement for change.

Hopefully the videos on the crowdfunder page  will go some way to demonstrating just why this film has to be made.  We have been privileged enough to have some very brave victims of Parental Alienation share their stories with us.  They're not easy to watch, but I implore you to. That will make this as real as it gets, especially if you are unaware of the subject matter.

I am not simply a Writer, Actor and Producer - I am an alienated parent who understands first-hand the pain, the grief and the torture of living life without my child. To live in a permanent state of bereavement  whilst trying to get on with daily life.  I hope that my film means alienated parents never having to answer questions like "Why doesn't your child want to see you?" or "What did you do?" - this film aims to be the catalyst for change around the world where Parental Alienation takes place every single day.

If you are not in a position to donate, we completely understand, times are hard for many people. But, you can still help to make a difference by sharing this crowdfunder page via all the sharing tools. If you want to share with those not on social media, the link can be sent via email and text.  The more people who hear about the film and go on to either donate and/or share, the more money we can raise to create an award winning film and gain media attention as a result.  Even if you do donate, we still need you to share this far and wide please. Every penny and every share counts for so much.

Finally - thank you so much for taking time to read this and engage with the videos.  Myself and my team are so so grateful. Having your support is both humbling and heart-warming.  We won't let you down!

story:
Why not?

In July 2018, director Ernie Trinidad and composer Ben Golomb were talking about fan-funded documentaries about movies and franchises.   It was during that conversation that the idea of making a documentary about HOWARD THE DUCK was hatched.    

In March 2019, HOWARD THE DOC began filming.   On April 1, 2019 the original indiegogo campaign began.  In the end, it laid a massive egg much like the film being honored.   Instead of scrapping the project, the decision was made to move forward with the film and to work within an extremely limited budget.  

The first campaign's failure is likely attributable to the fact that at the time the film did not have any commitments from any notable talent associated with the film HOWARD THE DUCK.   A few months later things began to change for the better and over the ensuing months and years that sticking point changed dramatically.

Up until the pandemic shut everything down in March 2020, all interviews were being filmed in-person.  Director Ernie Trinidad made the decision to begin filming interviews via Zoom. 

Since filming the first interview in March 2019, over 40 individuals have been filmed via Zoom or in-person.  With only a few scheduled interviews remaining to be filmed, HOWARD THE DOC will be moving into post-production.     

The post-production phase is where the real magic will be happening and it goes without saying it will be the most significant both creatively and financially.  

The documentary is being made as a labor of love by fans and for fans of HOWARD THE DUCK and this is YOUR unique opportunity to help pull it across the Cosmic Axis and bring it into our reality.   We're getting closer and we need your help!

ERNIE TRINIDAD - DIRECTOR/PRODUCER/WRITER

Director Ernie Trinidad is a life-long movie lover.  Nearly every job he's ever worked has been film related; video store clerk, projectionist, background actor, quality assurance tester, film critic, filmmaker.    Born and raised in South Jersey, not far from Philadelphia, he made the move to Los Angeles in 1998 where he continues to work in the film industry.  He wrote and executive produced the multiple award-winning short film A FUNNY THING HAPPENED ON THE WAY TO THE THEATRE.  His essay about JOHN CARPENTER'S THE THING was published in the Amazon bestselling book MY FAVORITE HORROR MOVIE.   Ernie makes his directorial debut with HOWARD THE DOC.

 

MICHAEL KALLIO - PRODUCER

Producer Michael Kallio was bitten by the filmmaking bug at the early age of six.  Things snowballed after he worked on a horror movie when he was sixteen.  He has worked in numerous departments within the film industry, including art department, lighting and grip and professional special effects, make-up effects and pyrotechnics.   Michael made his feature film directorial debut with his 2002 film HATRED OF A MINUTE which was produced by genre favorite Bruce Campbell.     He made the permanent move from Detroit to Los Angeles in 2004 and has worked on numerous projects ever since arriving.  He currently has several projects in various stages of development and production, including a documentary about Gunnar Hansen 'DINNER WITH LEATHERFACE' and new projects with Bruce Campbell. 

                                                                                                                                                      Photo: Zb Images

BEN GOLOMB - COMPOSER/LYRICIST

Music Composer Ben Golomb (who also doubles as the frontman for the LA-based shoegaze band, Modern Time Machines) has contributed music/songs to projects ranging from Adult Swim’s “The Eric Andre Show”, Netflix’s “My Teacher, My Obsession”, various Lifetime TV movies and short films/commercials, and has been heard on the airwaves on the LA radio station KROQ 106.7FM.  Ben is also scoring various projects in development, including SO HELP YOU GOD by noted filmmaker Ashely York (Netflix’s TIG, HILLBILLY).  Ben was working on a new song with Allee Willis up until her untimely passing.

ELENA SWEENEY - SENIOR GRAPHIC DESIGNER 

Elena Sweeney is a designer, producer, illustrator, and animator. As a producer, she contributed to the feature of Yahoo Finance's Origin Stories. In college, Sweeney began developing her work from zines to animated features in Williamsburg, New York City. With a small following, she realized that her true desire is animating music videos and short features. 

FROM THE FILM

LEA THOMPSON - Actress - Beverly - 'Howard the Duck'

JEFFREY JONES - Actor - Dr. Jenning - 'Howard the Duck'

 

ED GALE - Actor - Howard - 'Howard the Duck'

WILLARD HUYCK - Director, Co-Writer - 'Howard the Duck'

PHIL TIPPETT - Stop-Motion Effects Supervisor -'Howard the Duck'

ALLEE WILLIS - Co-wrote the songs with Thomas Dolby

GARY S. MARTINEZ - Actor - Joe Roma's Cajun Sushi chef - 'Howard the Duck'

PIP REYNOLDS - Actress - Bar Patron - 'Howard the Duck'

SUZANNE VOSS - Actress - Joe Roma's Cajun Sushi patron - 'Howard the Duck'

KATHLEEN WINDSOR - Actress - Bar Patron - 'Howard the Duck'

FILMMAKERS

​JACK BENNETT - Director - 'Never Surrender: A Galaxy Quest Documentary'

JENNY BREZINSKI - Actress - 'From Jennifer'

MEGAN DUFFY - Actress - 'The Affair'

DAVID C. FEIN - Producer - 'Star Trek-The Motion Picture: Director's Edition'

JOSH FORBES - Director - 'Contracted Phase II'

CHRISTOPHER MICHAEL JIMENEZ - C.E.O. - Sinful Celluloid and Copyright Manager at evilive Records/Verotik Inc.

MICHAEL KALLIO - Director - 'Mutant Swinger from Mars'; Producer - 'Howard the Doc'

SUNNY LANE - Actress - 'Don Jon,' 2020 AVN Hall of Fame Inductee

JULIA MARCHESE - Director - 'Out of Print'

EMILY LOUISE RUA - Director - '9 Ways to Hell'

COMIC BOOK CREATORS

DAVID AVALLONE - Author - 'Drawing Blood' and 'Elvira: Mistress of the Dark'

SAMANTHA GERBER - 'Howard the Duck' creator Steve Gerber's daughter

JASON LEVINE - Letterer - 'Howard the Duck (2002)'

VAL MAYERIK - Illustrator - Co-creator of the character "Howard the Duck"

CHIP ZDARSKY - Author - 'Howard the Duck' and 'Sex Crimes' 

AUTHORS & JOURNALISTS

JON BURLINGAME - Author 'The Music of James Bond'

GRAE DRAKE - Host, Journalist, Film Critic - Ms. MovieFone

CASEEN GAINES - Author - 'Howard the Duck: The Oral History'

MICHAEL KLUG - Film Critic - Tom Holland's Terror Time

FRED TOPEL - Film Critic - We Live Entertainment

ELLIS WEINER - Author - 'Howard the Duck' Movie Tie-In

REPERTORY CINEMA PROGRAMMERS & HOSTS

LIESEL HANSON - Actress, co-host 'Trash Film Orgy'

STEPHANIE HYDEN - Actress, co-host 'Trash Film Orgy'

AMBER KLOSS - Actress, co-host 'Trash Film Orgy'

ARTISTS 

LORENA D'AMELIO - Artist - ITALY 

SHAD NOWICKI - Artist - USA  

VIOLA WITTROCKA - Artist - RUSSIA

CONTENT CREATORS

RENATO BASSANINI - Momento Heroico

MICHAEL BORDER - JCARTS ARTS Movie Friends!!

JORDAN CARTWRIGHT - JCARTS ARTS Movie Friends!!

ARNIE CARVALHO - Venganza Media

LOUIE DAIDONE - watchwaddle

MATTHEW & EMILY SUMMERLIN - Just SUMM Reactions

...AND FEATURING

HOLLY GRICE - Associate Director of Physician Liaisons at Massachusetts Eye & Ear

ERNIE TRINIDAD - Director - 'Howard the Doc'

 

Due to the soft results of the first crowdfunding campaign, production of HOWARD THE DOC is being self-produced.  The ultimate goal is to produce the highest quality film possible while working within the extremely limited budget that is available.  George Lucas famously said "we'll fix it in post."   Well, that's what we intend to do.  We're going to put this documentary together in post and we could really use your help.  We want the duck to be proud of what we are doing. 

With your generous support we can make this happen and know that all of your contributions will go directly towards the necessary costs typically associated with post-production.

Such as:

  • Pick Up Shoots
  • Editing
  • Sound Editing & Mixing
  • Scoring
  • Color Timing
  • Graphics Design 
  • Film Festival Fees
  • Digital Cinema Packages
  • Media Creation for the film- Digital Copy and if possible DVD/Blu-ray
  • Media Creation for the soundtrack - Digital Copy and if possible CD
  • Entertainment Attorney Fees - you never know when you'll need one
  • Travel & Accommodations - for any in-person interviews that would require travel
  • Licensing of Film/Music - We are operating under Fair Use but you never know.
  • Marketing Materials
  • Campaign Fees
  • Creation of Perks

Rewards and Incentives are key to a campaign's success, below you'll find a sampling of what quack-tastic delights we have to offer and you can find more details about them on the right-hand-side. 

Your support is instrumental in completing this project so every contribution helps. If you want to ensure that this project is completed and released then please get down and support HOWARD THE DOC today! More amazing perks will be added if we meet our goal and can expand further!

Projects like this rely on the fans; this project is literally a labor of love and a love letter to HOWARD THE DUCK the movie and its fans from around the world.    Every contribution helps!

Please note that international deliveries may take longer due to customs and postage regulations.

Our goal was to have the film finished and released in the first quarter of 2020.   As you can see, life had other ideas.     August 1, 2021 marks the 35th anniversary of the release of HOWARD THE DUCK the movie.   Our new goal is to have the film finished and released somewhere within that 12 month span representing HOWARD THE DUCK's 35th anniversary celebration.

Our ultimate goal was to interview as many talented folks from the film as possible so production did see some delays as we made an effort to achieve this.   The pandemic really held production up but during that period we interviewed Lea Thompson and Jeffrey Jones.   In addition, the Zoom interviews turned out better than expected.

We are again going with a flexible budget and will work with what we have.  If the campaign comes up short it may take longer but we will make every effort to finish it.  However, if it succeeds or even overachieves we will certainly aim higher, and we do have ideas to do just that, to make this project even more quack-tastic.

If there are any delays you will be notified and kept up-to-date on the project's production.

The biggest reason for production delays is, well quite frankly there was a pandemic, that we have day jobs and other projects, however we have factored that into our delivery estimates.

If you are unable to provide a financial contribution, spreading the word on social media and through word of mouth would be greatly appreciated!

If you want to ensure that this project is completed and released then please get down and support HOWARD THE DOC today! More amazing perks will be added if we meet our goal and can expand further!Projects like this rely on the fans; this project is literally a labor of love and a love letter to HOWARD THE DUCK the movie and its fans from around the world.    Every contribution helps!Please note that international deliveries may take longer due to customs and postage regulations.Our goal was to have the film finished and released in the first quarter of 2020.   As you can see, life had other ideas.     August 1, 2021 marks the 35th anniversary of the release of HOWARD THE DUCK the movie.   Our new goal is to have the film finished and released somewhere within that 12 month span representing HOWARD THE DUCK's 35th anniversary celebration.Our ultimate goal was to interview as many talented folks from the film as possible so production did see some delays as we made an effort to achieve this.   The pandemic really held production up but during that period we interviewed Lea Thompson and Jeffrey Jones.   In addition, the Zoom interviews turned out better than expected.We are again going with a flexible budget and will work with what we have.  If the campaign comes up short it may take longer but we will make every effort to finish it.  However, if it succeeds or even overachieves we will certainly aim higher, and we do have ideas to do just that, to make this project even more quack-tastic.If there are any delays you will be notified and kept up-to-date on the project's production.The biggest reason for production delays is, well quite frankly there was a pandemic, that we have day jobs and other projects, however we have factored that into our delivery estimates.If you are unable to provide a financial contribution, spreading the word on social media and through word of mouth would be greatly appreciated!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Sally Muiruri, and I am a visual storyteller. I'm working on a new film called 15 Years Later. It’s a short family drama about parent-child re-connection. Having lived apart from my mom for 13 years, my experiences inform this film on how years of separation and distance resulting from migration, affects family relationships.

In the film, we see how the main characters, PATRICIA and her daughter CHLOE struggle with inner thoughts that lead to distrust and regrets. We see how both characters attempt to face their deep emotional pain and come to terms with an unpleasant mismatch between the reality on the ground and their perceptions towards one another.

What We Need & What You Get

If you feel the need for this kind of awareness in these complicated global times we live in, then I hope you'll help me make the film! As you may know, to make a film requires cameras, lighting equipment, audio equipment, editing software, transportation, and a professional crew. All these costs add up fast. To bring this film to completion, I need to raise $15,000. 

Gifts of any amount add up. If you are able to give $500 or more, we are offering you an exclusive private screening of the film in Boston, Massachusetts.

The Impact

By focusing in on the lives of the main characters. I hope this film will we give you a glimpse of how it’s like to live in a different country. I also hope that it will elicit further thoughts in the realm of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at a local level, as companies and organizations continue to find ways to enhance what’s happening in neighborhoods across the U.S.

Risks & Challenges

I have chosen to focus on a very niche topic. Therefore, raising funds is a challenge for me and my team.

However, many immigrants can identify with some of the issues that are covered in this film.

Other Ways You Can Help

My team and I are accepting help in any way, form or shape. You can help by;

  • Donating a camera, lighting equipment, audio equipment or editing software
  • Donating your studio space, which we can use to edit the film
  • Donating your expertise. If you are a set designer, make up artist or production assistant. Please consider volunteering your time and joining our production team
  •  Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Please share to your friends and family
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Naomi, an Administrative Assistant working in Hollywood, decides to go to therapy for the first time in her life after a recent traumatic experience. By going to therapy she challenges the stereotype of what it means to be labeled a “Strong Black Woman.”

Eboni Nicole is an up-and-coming Director who moved to LA from Middletown, Ohio. She is writing and directing her first short film, Strong Black Woman, inspired by her own experience with mental health. Eboni is a visual storyteller who is passionate about creating content that highlights people of color in spaces that aren't normally seen on television. She was inspired to write Strong Black Woman based on her own experience with mental health. 

“When I was deciding on what my first short film would be about I knew that I wanted to highlight an important topic within the black community. After writing down several topic ideas, I eventually realized that the story I was searching for was already written. My story. About two years ago I went through a traumatic experience that led me to therapy. Back in college I went to group therapy sessions and I was the only person of color in the group, so I knew that this time around I wanted to find a therapist who looked like me. It wasn’t easy looking for a black female therapist since there’s such a small percentage in the mental health field. Thankfully, my black female friends were able to refer me to the organization Therapy for Black Girls where I found my black therapist.

When I walked in the therapy room for the first time with my black female therapist, I felt like I was now a part of a secret society that no one talks about. It didn’t take long for me to realize that I could completely be myself during these therapy sessions with her, and most importantly I felt comfortable doing so. It was refreshing for me to have a safe space where I wasn’t code switching and I didn’t have to over explain my frustrations with society while living life everyday as a black woman. She just...understood me. It was great! 

Having a black female therapist made me realize the importance of being seen and heard when it comes to the topic of mental health. It was important for me to write a story that other black women can relate to and one where they can see themselves as the main character. I’m a strong advocate for therapy, especially for people of color. I hope that our film encourages more people to seek out therapy and know that there is strength in being vulnerable.”  

- Eboni Nicole

Like therapy, making a movie isn't cheap! Your contribution will cover the cost of production (including the cast, crew, and equipment) and post-production.

Diversity and inclusion in front of and behind the camera are fundamental in storytelling, and even more so when the story is this specific and nuanced. That is why we are dedicated to hiring a diverse and skilled crew. We are confident our team of experienced professionals will guide this project to success!

As we all know, there are lots of tools that go into creating those moving pictures. To capture every emotion in the film, we will also be leasing lighting and sound equipment to deliver a film we are proud to present to film festivals - and to YOU! 

Other needs include food for our crew (no one likes to work with a hungry audio engineer!) and film festival fees in order to bring this story to as many people as we can.

Every dollar brings this important message one step closer to the audience that needs to hear it, and we sincerely believe that being a part of change is a reward in itself. But as added incentive, we’ve found fun ways to further include you with perks like: a shoutout on our social media pages, an invitation to a private screening of our short film, your name in the credits, an exclusive invitation to our wrap party, and of course, the opportunity to be an Associate or Executive Producer with IMDb credit!

 

We know that we’re in tough financial times right now and money is tight. Maybe you’d like to help, but can’t afford to do so financially. We completely understand. If you would still like to help, please spread the word about our campaign and the importance of our message. Liking and commenting on our content here on Indiegogo and our social media platforms goes a long way. And feel free to share our campaign with your wealthier friends! Thank you!

story:
The Story

Just This Once follows couple Nora and Michael, as they road-trip towards the California coastline. After many pit-stops and slow downs, an emotionally fragile Nora and a concerned Michael, question wether if and when they will reach their destination. 

Ultimately, this is a story about love, guilt, grief, and mental health. Because of first-hand experience and a deep interest in the psychology of humans, I have always been incredibly passionate about breaking down taboos that plague mental health and mental illness. The more we keep these discussions going, the less people might feel alone or ashamed. Just This Once is only the tip of the iceberg, but I sincerely hope it can convey an important truth and spark honest conversation.

Team

 

Awards

The Just This Once screenplay has been awarded "Best Short Screenplay" at Lonely Wolf: London International Film Festival, runner up in the overall "Best Drama Screenplay" category, winner of "Best Short Screenplay" at Festigious International Film Festival, winner of "Best Screenplay" at the IndieCon awards, and was a semi-finalist at Indie Short Fest LA International Film Festival.

What We Need

We are seeking $5,500 to make this film. We know this is a large chunk of money, but each and every cent will go towards absolutely necessary pieces of this filmmaking process. Your generous contributions will be used for production, post-production, COVID safety procedures/ PPE, and paying our amazing actors and crew! 

Where your donation will go:

1. CAMERA AND EQUIPMENT RENTAL

2. COVID testing, PPE, and a health officer on set

3. CREW AND ACTORS- Firm believer that artists should be properly compensated! 

4. LOCATIONS/PERMITS/INSURANCE

5. CATERING AND CRAFTY- no one goes hangry!

6. POST-PRODUCTION *one of our biggest costs!*- sound design, editing, color-correction, and submitting to film festivals all over the world! 

7.  MISC- Transpo for certain crew members, Hair and makeup, props, and wardrobe

 

The Impact

The conversation about mental health, mental illness, and suicide prevention is one that needs to be had. Openly, honestly, and frequently. We hope that Just This Once will spark and continue  that conversation. We also are optimistic this film will be able to be screened at many festivals internationally, and hopefully available to the general public in the future. 

I am also proud to announce that this crew will be made up mostly of wildly talented women in the industry!

 

Timeline

- We aim to accomplish our funding goals by the end of February 2021

-We aim to shoot by late March or early April 2021

-Film submissions to festivals beginning summer 2021

 

Risks & Challenges

One of our main concerns will be keeping our crew and actors safe from COVID-19. Because of the pandemic, much of your donations will be used to have a safety officer on set, per SAG regulations, make sure everyone is regularly tested, and acquire the appropriate PPE.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We recognize that 2020 and 2021 have been incredibly challenging for many people, and that not everyone has the financial resources to help out. Trust us, we get it! You can still help spread the word and share our campaign with people that you think may feel strongly about mental health advocacy through storytelling, and empowering female filmmakers.

Instagram: @justthisoncefilm

https://www.instagram.com/justthisoncefilm/

IMDb: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt13632456/?ref_=hm_rvi_tt
