story:
THERE'S MORE THAN MEETS THE EYE in the feature film...

 

Thanks for checking out our IndieGoGo page! My name is Rafal Zlak and I am the Writer/Producer. Amazon Prime director of two feature films, Adam M. will tentatively direct. He was one of the executive producers of QT8: The First Eight - a documentary about Quentin Tarantino's first eight films. We are extending a warm welcome to our new crew member, music supervisor, Taylor A. He brings over twenty years of technical experience with multiple instruments.

 

 

ADAM AND EVE GO HIKING is a super-low-budget feature film in the drama-mystery/suspense genre that will be shot on location in Southern Utah. We plan to shoot the film very quickly, in less than a week.

"Adam and Eve go hiking" should garner a 'PG-13' MPAA rating. Our film is a mystery, not a romance. Saying too much by revealing the story plot would be cause for a spoiler alert, and what fun would that be?! What we can tell you is that we believe this project will make for an intriguing, suspenseful, compelling story filled with worthwhile entertainment value.

 

LOGLINE: "Two college friends' annual road trip leads one of their lives to overlap a dangerous network that the other can only imagine."

SYNOPSIS: Two friends, on a much-needed vacation, decide to go hiking to escape their money troubles. They enjoy their brassy company and even play tricks on each other in the spirit of good edgy horseplay. Slowly, they find themselves living in a fluid world where darkness and complexity sneak up on their banter-filled personalities. Before they realize it, a mysterious network overlaps their well-bonded friendship, which leads to unexpected consequences that will change them forever.

 

OH ACTOR, MY ACTOR... THE ACTOR FACTOR.

 

The project's two tentatively cast college-aged lead actors have real-life chemistry because of a friendship built over the years. Actors Lina and Jason, similarly to the characters they'll play, also fatedly met during college. Lina C. will play the character of 'Jez' onscreen, whose persona will be of the Mexican-American girl next door type, who's an L.A. progressive, chip off the block with an elusiveness you can't quite put your finger on. Jason L. will play the character of 'Chad,' whose onscreen presence will be the prudent American everyday working man with a joyful yet cautious appeal. 

 

THE DIRECTOR ...IS IN?

 

We have many reasons to be excited. A brilliant and successful tentative director is one of them! Adam M.'s two films are currently streaming on Amazon Prime. It's a known fact that it's not an everyday occurrence to be reviewed by The Hollywood Reporter. Yet when it does happen, it's cause for celebration, twice it's double the cause for celebration. His talents are many: editing, cinematography, camera work, sound & music mixing, and directing. He has a film degree accompanying much experience working on several productions. Currently, he's on location finishing up cinematography and editing work on another project. Any publicity is good publicity, and we have something to smile about - momentum.

 

 THE PURPOSE OF OUR GOAL...

 

The purpose of this campaign is to raise the budget amount of the costs to film the feature. The proceeds will go towards all expenses on the approximate week-long shoot which includes but isn't limited to expenses for a director, actors, a camera person, extras, transportation, lodging, meals, and miscellaneous details such as post-production, marketing, advertising, and distribution. If fortune smiles on this project and all elements are paid for, then after distribution 5% will go to missing person charities.

 

Our campaign goal is to raise funds to complete this feature in a set amount of time. Most importantly to allow us to hire this particular director to level up the film's quality and potentially increase its likelihood of being sold to distributors similarly as his two previous features were. I believe he and I, as well as the other tentative crew on board, are a great team with the same goal in sight: to complete high-quality art that will resonate as entertaining content streamed to the masses.

 

A POE-ETIC INFLUENCE...

 

Since childhood, I've been curious about both real and fictional mysteries. In particular, I enjoyed and was terrified after watching Rod Serling's 'Twilight Zone' series back in the day, which its tagline read: "Ordinary people find themselves in extraordinarily astounding situations, which they each try to solve in a remarkable manner." Another television series, 'Unsolved Mysteries' left a big impression on me especially once I realized it was based on tragically true events. 

 

I strive for an understanding of people through writing fictional accounts of the different perspectives they have in life, some tragic, others deceptive and even the cause and effect of darker elements in life. I liken it to the saying, 'a cat has nine lives until curiosity killed the cat.'

Edgar Allan Poe's writing, biography, and reading about his peculiar and untimely demise stuck out as a strange phenomenon while I wrapped up an M.A. in Publications Design from the University of Baltimore.  

 

PROCESSING - THE PROCESS...

 

I sat down to write “Adam and Eve go hiking” very recently. My inspirations varied from hiking in Southern Utah with close friends to reading about singer Halsey's tough upbringing to legendary filmmaker David Lynch (Wild at Heart, Twin Peaks, Eraserhead, Blue Velvet, Lost Highway, Mulholland Drive, etc.): he is a tremendously creative, abstract storyteller who never compromises his vision and therefore the term 'Lynchian' has been publicly created to describe his elusive style behind the camera. I alongside millions of fans have admired his use of camera work, blocking, sound design, music choice working with composers Angelo Badalamenti and Olga Neuwirth as well as his non-linear patches of film work which give way to visceral sensibilities into the dark nature of the human experience. When asked about his films, his answers are few, subtle, and vague at best in the hope not to spoil the crux of the spine of his stories. His most profound answer to any question has always been, 'if it feels right, then that's what needs to be put to film.'   

 

I initially wrote “Adam and Eve go hiking” on a whim and as a creative experiment after pitching the idea to a friend of mine over the phone. We got to talking and it sparked a collaborative trail of inspirational bread crumbs which flowered into major plot points within the finished script. In the past, I mainly wrote feature screenplays that took oodles amount of time and sometimes happened to veer into different directions as a result of differing gatekeepers with differing perspectives giving differing professional feedback. Eventually, many of those feature scripts did find their legs and were built up with the help of a very select few extraordinary so-called gatekeepers who happened to elevate their positions during our off-the-record idea sessions. Back then, as is the case when meeting anyone with whom you find yourself mentally compatible, I'd latch on like the proverbial suction cup and extract as much of the gold rush as possible until the nature of the working relationship ran its natural course. I found myself dancing to the tune, 'strike while the iron is hot.' A few of those times felt as if I was amid an epiphany of creative hurricanes which can only be described with the age-old cliché , 'carpe diem - seize the day.'

 

THE ELUSIVE ETHER...

 

The creative process is very elusive similar to David Lynch's interview answers which come and go so quickly that before you realize the interview is over without uttering a logical word, yet an admiration that you can't put your finger on lingers. As an artist, I think the advice that many have given one another including to me on many occasions rings true. They'd say to write 'it' and 'it' being that self-described spark of brilliance immediately, before it evaporates into the ether. A course on writing mystery-thrillers will tell students that it's the most challenging genre to create because it needs to be written from the end to the start. That sounds confusing or brilliant like backward character dialogue in one of David Lynch's mysteries.

 

Being just a fellow human, stumbling in the dark for an idea to light my way, as every other writer I'd attest that using the deep well of abstract worlds helps to complete such an endeavor. This is precisely what I decided to do. I followed Alice down the rabbit hole before the daydreams vanished into thin air. After connecting a string of these daydreams, the script miraculously appeared in record time. If I compare some of the stories I've attempted to finish in the past, a few spanned years, it wouldn't be close. After reflecting on them now, some seemed like pointless toil, except in hindsight they were an exercise in a deeper understanding of how a story can both come together and morph into a new vein. 

 

SI*ZZL*ISM vs. SYM*BOL*ISM...

 

'Adam and Eve go hiking' was a unique writing experience. It was the first micro-low-budget feature that I had both the inspiration and motivation to complete a full draft of rather than toiling away at mid to high-budget complex ideas that could potentially register as blockbusters if they, by the grace of God, ever got off the ground. Even though the ethereal whirlwind of ideas that landed me with a full feature took a lightspeed record of five days, besting Joe Eszterhas's 'Basic Instinct' of ten days and Steven Soderbergh's 'Sex, Lies and Videotape' of eight days, there's still an ocean-sized difference in inference with names 'Adam and Eve' of which could be confused in regards to the previously mentioned films.

 

Today, those names in the same sentence convey something possibly and ironically unholy in comparison to its original meaning. Those same definitions of 'Adam and Eve' famously holy and infamously unholy, at least in the scenes within the feature 'Adam and Eve go hiking' are only symbolic toward painting a picture of ideological comparison within the story. In translation, 'Adam and Eve go hiking' should garner a 'PG-13' MPAA rating rather than a hard 'R' like the aforementioned for obvious reasons. Again, our film is a mystery, not a romance even though everything has its time and place.  

 

THANK YOU WHOLEHEARTEDLY...

 

You're valuable to us! We want to ensure that you know that, so we're giving back to you on this project with a list of perks. Please check out our perks for contributors section if you'd like to be a part of this mysteriously exciting project! 

We appreciate you being a part of our journey so if you'd like to help us along in our goal, then we'd be ever so grateful if you helped get the word out, made some noise, and got attention about this campaign through utilizing the Indiegogo built-in share tools and sharing the campaign YouTube linked video: https://youtu.be/ttaVDtnjF4o

A special thanks to you from Mysterian Film Group, LLC for helping it grow out of infancy. We hope you love mysteries and hiking as much as we do, especially the uniquely beautiful landscape of Southern Utah.

See you on the big screen-

Amazon Prime director of two feature films, Adam M. will tentatively direct. He was one of the executive producers of QT8: The First Eight - a documentary about Quentin Tarantino's first eight films. We are extending a warm welcome to our new crew member, music supervisor, Taylor A. He brings over twenty years of technical experience with multiple instruments.  ADAM AND EVE GO HIKING is a super-low-budget feature film in the drama-mystery/suspense genre that will be shot on location in Southern Utah. We plan to shoot the film very quickly, in less than a week."Adam and Eve go hiking" should garner a 'PG-13' MPAA rating. Our film is a mystery, not a romance. Saying too much by revealing the story plot would be cause for a spoiler alert, and what fun would that be?! What we can tell you is that we believe this project will make for an intriguing, suspenseful, compelling story filled with worthwhile entertainment value. LOGLINE: "Two college friends' annual road trip leads one of their lives to overlap a dangerous network that the other can only imagine."SYNOPSIS: Two friends, on a much-needed vacation, decide to go hiking to escape their money troubles. They enjoy their brassy company and even play tricks on each other in the spirit of good edgy horseplay. Slowly, they find themselves living in a fluid world where darkness and complexity sneak up on their banter-filled personalities. Before they realize it, a mysterious network overlaps their well-bonded friendship, which leads to unexpected consequences that will change them forever. OH ACTOR, MY ACTOR... THE ACTOR FACTOR. The project's two tentatively cast college-aged lead actors have real-life chemistry because of a friendship built over the years. Actors Lina and Jason, similarly to the characters they'll play, also fatedly met during college. Lina C. will play the character of 'Jez' onscreen, whose persona will be of the Mexican-American girl next door type, who's an L.A. progressive, chip off the block with an elusiveness you can't quite put your finger on. Jason L. will play the character of 'Chad,' whose onscreen presence will be the prudent American everyday working man with a joyful yet cautious appeal.  THE DIRECTOR ...IS IN? We have many reasons to be excited. A brilliant and successful tentative director is one of them! Adam M.'s two films are currently streaming on Amazon Prime. It's a known fact that it's not an everyday occurrence to be reviewed by The Hollywood Reporter. Yet when it does happen, it's cause for celebration, twice it's double the cause for celebration. His talents are many: editing, cinematography, camera work, sound & music mixing, and directing. He has a film degree accompanying much experience working on several productions. Currently, he's on location finishing up cinematography and editing work on another project. Any publicity is good publicity, and we have something to smile about - momentum.  THE PURPOSE OF OUR GOAL... The purpose of this campaign is to raise the budget amount of the costs to film the feature. The proceeds will go towards all expenses on the approximate week-long shoot which includes but isn't limited to expenses for a director, actors, a camera person, extras, transportation, lodging, meals, and miscellaneous details such as post-production, marketing, advertising, and distribution. If fortune smiles on this project and all elements are paid for, then after distribution 5% will go to missing person charities. Our campaign goal is to raise funds to complete this feature in a set amount of time. Most importantly to allow us to hire this particular director to level up the film's quality and potentially increase its likelihood of being sold to distributors similarly as his two previous features were. I believe he and I, as well as the other tentative crew on board, are a great team with the same goal in sight: to complete high-quality art that will resonate as entertaining content streamed to the masses. A POE-ETIC INFLUENCE... Since childhood, I've been curious about both real and fictional mysteries. In particular, I enjoyed and was terrified after watching Rod Serling's 'Twilight Zone' series back in the day, which its tagline read: "Ordinary people find themselves in extraordinarily astounding situations, which they each try to solve in a remarkable manner." Another television series, 'Unsolved Mysteries' left a big impression on me especially once I realized it was based on tragically true events.  I strive for an understanding of people through writing fictional accounts of the different perspectives they have in life, some tragic, others deceptive and even the cause and effect of darker elements in life. I liken it to the saying, 'a cat has nine lives until curiosity killed the cat.'Edgar Allan Poe's writing, biography, and reading about his peculiar and untimely demise stuck out as a strange phenomenon while I wrapped up an M.A. in Publications Design from the University of Baltimore.   PROCESSING - THE PROCESS... I sat down to write “Adam and Eve go hiking” very recently. My inspirations varied from hiking in Southern Utah with close friends to reading about singer Halsey's tough upbringing to legendary filmmaker David Lynch (Wild at Heart, Twin Peaks, Eraserhead, Blue Velvet, Lost Highway, Mulholland Drive, etc.): he is a tremendously creative, abstract storyteller who never compromises his vision and therefore the term 'Lynchian' has been publicly created to describe his elusive style behind the camera. I alongside millions of fans have admired his use of camera work, blocking, sound design, music choice working with composers Angelo Badalamenti and Olga Neuwirth as well as his non-linear patches of film work which give way to visceral sensibilities into the dark nature of the human experience. When asked about his films, his answers are few, subtle, and vague at best in the hope not to spoil the crux of the spine of his stories. His most profound answer to any question has always been, 'if it feels right, then that's what needs to be put to film.'    I initially wrote “Adam and Eve go hiking” on a whim and as a creative experiment after pitching the idea to a friend of mine over the phone. We got to talking and it sparked a collaborative trail of inspirational bread crumbs which flowered into major plot points within the finished script. In the past, I mainly wrote feature screenplays that took oodles amount of time and sometimes happened to veer into different directions as a result of differing gatekeepers with differing perspectives giving differing professional feedback. Eventually, many of those feature scripts did find their legs and were built up with the help of a very select few extraordinary so-called gatekeepers who happened to elevate their positions during our off-the-record idea sessions. Back then, as is the case when meeting anyone with whom you find yourself mentally compatible, I'd latch on like the proverbial suction cup and extract as much of the gold rush as possible until the nature of the working relationship ran its natural course. I found myself dancing to the tune, 'strike while the iron is hot.' A few of those times felt as if I was amid an epiphany of creative hurricanes which can only be described with the age-old cliché , 'carpe diem - seize the day.' THE ELUSIVE ETHER... The creative process is very elusive similar to David Lynch's interview answers which come and go so quickly that before you realize the interview is over without uttering a logical word, yet an admiration that you can't put your finger on lingers. As an artist, I think the advice that many have given one another including to me on many occasions rings true. They'd say to write 'it' and 'it' being that self-described spark of brilliance immediately, before it evaporates into the ether. A course on writing mystery-thrillers will tell students that it's the most challenging genre to create because it needs to be written from the end to the start. That sounds confusing or brilliant like backward character dialogue in one of David Lynch's mysteries. Being just a fellow human, stumbling in the dark for an idea to light my way, as every other writer I'd attest that using the deep well of abstract worlds helps to complete such an endeavor. This is precisely what I decided to do. I followed Alice down the rabbit hole before the daydreams vanished into thin air. After connecting a string of these daydreams, the script miraculously appeared in record time. If I compare some of the stories I've attempted to finish in the past, a few spanned years, it wouldn't be close. After reflecting on them now, some seemed like pointless toil, except in hindsight they were an exercise in a deeper understanding of how a story can both come together and morph into a new vein.  SI*ZZL*ISM vs. SYM*BOL*ISM... 'Adam and Eve go hiking' was a unique writing experience. It was the first micro-low-budget feature that I had both the inspiration and motivation to complete a full draft of rather than toiling away at mid to high-budget complex ideas that could potentially register as blockbusters if they, by the grace of God, ever got off the ground. Even though the ethereal whirlwind of ideas that landed me with a full feature took a lightspeed record of five days, besting Joe Eszterhas's 'Basic Instinct' of ten days and Steven Soderbergh's 'Sex, Lies and Videotape' of eight days, there's still an ocean-sized difference in inference with names 'Adam and Eve' of which could be confused in regards to the previously mentioned films. Today, those names in the same sentence convey something possibly and ironically unholy in comparison to its original meaning. Those same definitions of 'Adam and Eve' famously holy and infamously unholy, at least in the scenes within the feature 'Adam and Eve go hiking' are only symbolic toward painting a picture of ideological comparison within the story. In translation, 'Adam and Eve go hiking' should garner a 'PG-13' MPAA rating rather than a hard 'R' like the aforementioned for obvious reasons. Again, our film is a mystery, not a romance even though everything has its time and place.   THANK YOU WHOLEHEARTEDLY... You're valuable to us! We want to ensure that you know that, so we're giving back to you on this project with a list of perks. Please check out our perks for contributors section if you'd like to be a part of this mysteriously exciting project! We appreciate you being a part of our journey so if you'd like to help us along in our goal, then we'd be ever so grateful if you helped get the word out, made some noise, and got attention about this campaign through utilizing the Indiegogo built-in share tools and sharing the campaign YouTube linked video: https://youtu.be/ttaVDtnjF4oA special thanks to you from Mysterian Film Group, LLC for helping it grow out of infancy. We hope you love mysteries and hiking as much as we do, especially the uniquely beautiful landscape of Southern Utah.See you on the big screen-

story:
Balls of Tin is a web series and is a show within a show. It is a comedy. The first season, for which we are seeking funding, is comprised of six episodes.

Balls of Tin takes its title from the oft-used mountain bike phrase "balls of steel" for anyone bold enough to do intense, big maneuvers. This is the story of a small film crew attempting to produce a series about freeride mountain biking in New England called New England Freeride Unleashed:

Lindsay, the show’s creator and director, is an avid cyclist and is early in her career in making sports media content. She teams up with her cycling pal, Edwardo, to pitch the series idea to her ex-girlfriend, Claire. Claire is an executive with a streaming content producer called NewStream, a subsidiary of  Dane Media Group. Claire is now married to Roger Dane. Claire agrees to back the project with the caveat that they use her stepson, Dan Dane, as the star of the show. Dan Dane believes he is a great rider, but he is not. Thus, Balls of Tin. The story is told from shifting perspectives. The view alternates from the "meta" Balls of Tin view of the crew making their series and a view of the New England Freeride Unleashed series they are filming. An additional perspective is offered by the TikTok account of Dan Dane (@TheDanDane) as he takes out his phone to reach out to what he calls "Dan's Fans."


Rachelle Dermer, Showrunner, is an assistant professor at Fitchburg State University. She received her M.F.A in film at Vermont College of Fine Arts. She is an avid mountain biker. Previous feature film credits include Commit to the Line and Photography Gave Me Cancer (and Other Stories I Tell Myself).


Zoë Eisenhaure, Producer, is a Graduate Assistant at Fitchburg State University. She received her B.S. in Film/Video and Professional Communications at Fitchburg State University in 2020. Previous credits include Customer's Choice and Every Man Has His Demons.


Jake Dedian, Director of Photography, is a freelance filmmaker from the South Shore of Massachusetts.   He knew from an early age that he was destined to create behind the camera, and carried it with him all the way to college.  He attended Fitchburg State University majoring in Communications Media, with a double concentration in film/video and professional communications.  Specializing in cinematography and lighting, Jake has a passion for telling stories through the moving image, whether it’s in the narrative or commercial space.   Jake has been cutting his teeth working in the world of commercial video for different production companies around Boston.  In the dawn of his career as a director/cinematographer, Jake has done work for different smaller brands around Massachusetts and Pittsburgh, PA.  


Elizabeth “Buffy” Cautela, Writer & Asst. Director (and Actor) is currently a Senior Communications Media Major with a double concentration in Film/Video and Theater with a minor in Deaf Studies at Fitchburg State University. Her credits include The Pumpkin, Moments In Motherhood, and Friend-iversary. She recently won the prestigious Lacoy Production Fund Grant for her upcoming film Roller Kingdom.  


Rob Kemp, Asst. Producer,  is a Senior at Fitchburg State University studying Communications with a concentration in film. He has previously produced Trip of a Lifetime, The Pumpkin, and Friend-iversary. Rob has an upcoming project he is producing which was granted the 2021 LaCoy Production Fund.


Jonah Perlow, Production Audio, is a senior at Fitchburg State University. He is a Communications Media major with a concentration in Film and Video. Jonah also has a minor in music and has done sound work on fellow student films such as the Pumpkin, Friend-iversry, and is planning to work on the upcoming student film Roller Kingdom. Jonah has also done post sound mixing and audio work for the Fitchburg State University Community Concert Band.


Jack Harney, Writer & Production Design, is a writer/director from East Providence, RI. He is a student at Fitchburg State University with a major in Communications Media (concentration in Film/Video) and a minor in Deaf Studies. 


Jacob Barnes, Writer, is a Communications Media major at Fitchburg State University, studying film. An aspiring screenwriter, director, cartoonist, poet, and author, Jacob’s goal through storytelling is to communicate that no one’s thoughts and/or experiences are too small—that everyone has the ability to think creatively and share to the world the stories that are uniquely theirs. 


Ryan Esteves, Writer, is a junior Film and Video Production major at Fitchburg State University. An aspiring writer-director, he has 3 years of TV Media Production experience and has written, directed, produced, edited, and/or starred in a wide variety of projects, including student news, PSA’s, short-form documentaries, and narrative work.


Tori Weeks, Editor, is a Fitchburg State University Alumni who graduated in 2019 with her B.S. in Film and Video. Tori currently works as a full-time Editor and Camera operator for Votary Films in Worcester Massachusetts. In her spare time, Tori likes to run, talk to her plants, and daydream about being a dog mom.

 


Emma Jacques (Lindsay Milann) is currently a senior at Fitchburg State University majoring in Communications Media with a double concentration in Film/Video and Professional Communications. She has written, directed, and starred in several short films including The Man in the Field, The Photograph, and Welcome to my Uber Vlog.


Guthrie Scrimgeour (Dan Dane) is an actor and writer based out of Salem, MA (where they hanged the witches). He graduated Carnegie Mellon University in 2019 and has been working as a journalist since then while acting on the side. His past stage credits include Mark in "The Idiot Box", Marty in "The House of Yes" at CMU, and he originated the role of Danny in "The Handle" at Newburyport Actors’ Studio and the Boston Theater Marathon. Recently he has been transitioning to film and TV work, acting in several independent film projects and commercials. He received the Best Actor Award at the Bentley University Film Festival. His original play Hash, was selected for a staged reading at the Young Playwrights Festival at the Horizon Theater in Atlanta, GA, and his play Akristos was produced by The Scotch and Soda Student Theater Company at Carnegie Mellon University.


Sriram Emani (Edwardo Lewis) is an actor and model who has played lead roles in several student films and featured extra roles in Netflix productions over the past few years. He has been featured in national television commercials and digital ads with brands like realtor.com, Stop and Shop, Boston Luxury Cruises, Concord Coach Lines amongst others, and corporate training projects for McKinsey, Deloitte, Cengage Learning, iStar, and more. Sriram is a TEDx speaker and a director for music videos and creative collaborations for IndianRaga that have been featured by Lincoln Center, World Government Summit, United Nations General Assembly Hall, and other iconic venues. Sriram speaks 4 languages fluently, is a trained raga and Bollywood singer, and is a Bronze 3 Ballroom and Latin dancer at Arthur Murray dance studios. Sriram is represented by Model Club and is based in Boston. 


Sarah Berlinger (Sadie Bowers) is a full-time high school teacher and part-time actor. She is best known as a science teacher, but also worked on the documentary film, Commit to the Line. Sarah is an avid cyclist, racing during high school and college. Ordinarily, she enjoys spending her summers on her small farm, cycling, hiking and camping with her family and hanging out with her dog, Endo (yes, after the bicycling mishap).

Christopher "Jake" Casper (McKenzie Davidson) is an American actor and FSU alum. While studying theater and history at Fitchburg State University, Jake was cast in over 20 student and independent films working alongside talented actors and filmmakers from NYU, Emerson, Tufts University, and Columbia College. Some of his notable performances include his portrayal of Robert Graham in the award-winning short film Woke (2018) directed by Monica Liao Queliz, the role of Michael in Steelhouse Media's Weekend in Waterville (2020), and Eric in the Amazon Prime Mini-Series When Night Stands Fast (2020). Jake is represented by the Andrew Wilson Agency and works on commercial projects alongside projects in film and television. He has lent his voice on spots for Blue Cross Blue Shield and the One Love Foundation. Recently, Jake's voice could be heard on the One Love Foundation's Love is Learned Campaign. 


Kate Hogan-Hines (Claire Bennett) holds a BFA from Lesley University in photography and videography. She was a gaffer on student films, but when the opportunity came to act, she volunteered and fell in love instantly.  Kate was an archer for 6 years, shot competitively for four years, and coached for three years.  In her photography work, Kate began making self-portraits instead of photographing models because of the pandemic. When in quarantine, she dressed up in wigs and makeup to transform herself into different characters. She would then further transform her appearance in Photoshop to create an image of a completely different person from herself. Kate is a runner, painter, avid museum-goer, thrifter, city-over-country person, talkative, tea drinker.


Elizabeth “Buffy” Cautela (Robin Benning) you already met above in the "crew" category. 

We need to raise $10,000 to cover the remainder of our production expenses. If you help out, you'll get something out of it, too. Each backer tier coincides with some pretty awesome perks. By backing our project, you're ensuring that we make this web series an absolute success! 

This project is unique: the crew is made up of Fitchburg State students, faculty, and alumni and the cast is made up of alumni and local actors. By backing this campaign, you are helping fund up-and-coming filmmakers and actors! This is an opportunity for students and recent grads to gain valuable and paid experience doing what they love.  Additionally, this web series is unique in subject matter and production and you can be a part of making this innovative project a reality.

The only true risk here is NOT getting a chance to be a part of this awesome community!

You may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help us out! Please share this campaign on your social media so we get the most visibility! Send it to your friends, aunts, uncles, grandmas, and grandpops! Let them know you want to help make an impact and show them how they can help out too.

story:
My name is Jesse Bernstein and I’m the director of the MOFAYA documentary. The contributions from this Indiegogo campaign will allow us and a small production crew to visit the Congo, where Mermans' story both begins, and (spoiler alert) comes full circle: Mermans would like to return to the Congo to build a music school for children. 

For the two week shoot, I have budgeted for Mermans, myself, and three crew members.  Round trip transportation to Africa, accommodations in Kinshasa and Luanda, and three meals a day totals $7k per person. I have added an additional $15k to our budget for reimbursing locals for allowing us to film in their neighborhoods.  If we are only able to raise a fraction of this money through this Indiegogo campaign, Mermans and I would still be able to make the trip to the Congo – but it would only be he and I.  However, if we exceed our fundraising goal, the additional funds will be used to purchase musical instruments for the school.

                 

Mermans' story is awe-inspiring. After his father and brother were killed by corrupt armed forces, Mermans “Mofaya” Mosengo left his home in the Democratic Republic of the Congo with nothing more than a guitar and a small bag. Traveling through war-torn Africa without papers or a passport, the odds were stacked against him.  

Mermans successfully smuggled himself across African borders, with music as his guide and his ammunition.  He was eventually discovered by a music producer from Los Angeles while performing at the world-renown Mama Africa in Cape Town. The music producer was none other than Mark Johnson, the founder of Playing for Change – a movement created to inspire and connect the world through music. 

                  

As the lead singer of the Playing for Change band, Mermans has traveled the world and performed in over 25 countries on an O-1 Visa. An O-1 Visa is reserved for people who display an extraordinary ability in the arts, sciences, education, business or athletics. 

I met Mermans in 2013 when I moved to Venice Beach. Fortunately, my next door neighbor was Mark Johnson. Over the years, I have become like family with Mark, Mermans and the entire Playing for Change organization. When Mermans received the news he was granted a Green Card into the United States, Mermans and I, and my dog, Scout, were returning from a beach workout. With the bright, California sun shining down on us, we stood in silence. It was as if, for that moment, the world had stopped spinning on its axis.  This was when I realized we needed to share Mermans’ story with the world. 

    

After I drafted a treatment and filmed a video teaser, Playing for Change provided the initial seed money for me to visit South Africa with Mermans to begin shooting a documentary on his life. Cape Town is where Mermans lived with his three daughters, his son and his wife. The initial plan was to focus on Cape Town, and film Mermans’ family as they packed their belongings and moved to America.    

   

But the documentary quickly evolved into something much more powerful and far-reaching: In addition to the extraordinary story of African Immigrants into America, now that Mermans has achieved international musical acclaim, he would like to give back to the country that has given him so much by building a music school in the Congo. 

But please know, if you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Let’s get the word out and make some noise about the MOFAYA documentary. Please share the link to our fundraising campaign with your friends and family. Also, don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools. Thank you so much for your support!

It means the world to us.
story_txt: My name is Jesse Bernstein and I’m the director of the MOFAYA documentary. The contributions from this Indiegogo campaign will allow us and a small production crew to visit the Congo, where Mermans' story both begins, and (spoiler alert) comes full circle: Mermans would like to return to the Congo to build a music school for children. For the two week shoot, I have budgeted for Mermans, myself, and three crew members.  Round trip transportation to Africa, accommodations in Kinshasa and Luanda, and three meals a day totals $7k per person. I have added an additional $15k to our budget for reimbursing locals for allowing us to film in their neighborhoods.  If we are only able to raise a fraction of this money through this Indiegogo campaign, Mermans and I would still be able to make the trip to the Congo – but it would only be he and I.  However, if we exceed our fundraising goal, the additional funds will be used to purchase musical instruments for the school.                 Mermans' story is awe-inspiring. After his father and brother were killed by corrupt armed forces, Mermans “Mofaya” Mosengo left his home in the Democratic Republic of the Congo with nothing more than a guitar and a small bag. Traveling through war-torn Africa without papers or a passport, the odds were stacked against him.  Mermans successfully smuggled himself across African borders, with music as his guide and his ammunition.  He was eventually discovered by a music producer from Los Angeles while performing at the world-renown Mama Africa in Cape Town. The music producer was none other than Mark Johnson, the founder of Playing for Change – a movement created to inspire and connect the world through music.                   As the lead singer of the Playing for Change band, Mermans has traveled the world and performed in over 25 countries on an O-1 Visa. An O-1 Visa is reserved for people who display an extraordinary ability in the arts, sciences, education, business or athletics. I met Mermans in 2013 when I moved to Venice Beach. Fortunately, my next door neighbor was Mark Johnson. Over the years, I have become like family with Mark, Mermans and the entire Playing for Change organization. When Mermans received the news he was granted a Green Card into the United States, Mermans and I, and my dog, Scout, were returning from a beach workout. The initial plan was to focus on Cape Town, and film Mermans’ family as they packed their belongings and moved to America.       But the documentary quickly evolved into something much more powerful and far-reaching: In addition to the extraordinary story of African Immigrants into America, now that Mermans has achieved international musical acclaim, he would like to give back to the country that has given him so much by building a music school in the Congo. But please know, if you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Let’s get the word out and make some noise about the MOFAYA documentary. Please share the link to our fundraising campaign with your friends and family. Also, don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools. Thank you so much for your support!It means the world to us.

story:
Who are you?

Hey! I'm Dustin Weible, an independent filmmaker located in Orlando, FL. Since I was three years old, I knew I wanted to make movies. I wasn't exactly sure what that meant at the time, how many thousands of hours it would take to learn the craft, or how impossibly difficult it was to "break in" to the industry. All I knew was that I wanted to tell good stories. 

I've always financed my own short films up until now. I've spent years building connections and making friends with extremely talented people in this field, and I love collaborating on projects with them. Generally, I could make a short film for a few hundred dollars by utilizing these connections and spending the time in pre-production to cut down the luxury items on my wish list. I want that to change with this next film. There's only so much you can do with small budgets, and while I believe the challenge of working within these constraints is a useful tool to have, I also believe you have to know when you're ready to take it up a notch.

I'm very excited about the possibilities with my new script A Monster in the House. I decided to turn to crowdfunding as a way of helping this project reach its potential, as well as to test out this avenue for even bigger projects down the road.

If you would like to know more about me personally, see some of my work, or meet with me over some coffee, please visit my website to find out more!

 

What is the film about?

A Monster in the House is about two siblings who must learn to confront their childhood traumas when their abusive father passes away. Their old house, where all of their bad memories remain, is handed down to them. So, they task themselves with cleaning it out to sell and be rid of those memories for good. But their demons don't go away so easily. Sometimes, those demons fight back.

First and foremost, this is a horror film. The story takes place in an old two story home filled with atmosphere, and once the monster comes out to play, things get crazy. The highest compliment I've received from everyone who has read the script is that they got chills when the monster is first introduced. 

Secondly, this is a drama film. We want to portray a realistic brother-sister relationship. Growing up in an abusive household with shared-trauam brings them close together, but like with anyone, sometimes it's difficult to express what's really going on inside you, so you deflect with humor instead of tackling your emotions head-on.

Thirdly, this is a physiological deep dive into the effects of childhood abuse, depression and addiction. How do your past experiences define you? What are you passing down to your children? How do you cope with trauma? I hope watching this short film will make you ask the same questions.

 

What do you need from me?

Simply put, we need around $5,000... but more would be nice too.

Yes, short films may be less expensive than features, but making movies in and of itself is an expensive adventure. Let me break down the costs if we did everything the right way:

  • Cast - $1,000 (5 actors, 4 days of production with SAG minimum payment)
  • Crew - $5,000 (10-12 crew members behind the scenes over 4 days of production)
  • Costume/Wardrobe - $3,000 (Custom monsters are expensive)
  • Set Design/Props - $1,500 (Your sets need to look as nice as the actors)
  • Equipment Rentals - $1000 (Good cameras and lenses don't come cheap)
  • Craft Services - $500 (People gotta eat)
  • BTS Photographer - $400 (Perfect for promotion and updating producers)
  • Stunt Coordinator (or VFX) - $2,500 (There's a pretty big stunt in the film)
  • Location - $1,000 (The house will make or break the entire story)
  • Post Audio - $3,000 (If a movie looks good but sounds horrible, I bet you won't watch it)
  • Music Composer - $3,000 (Building custom tension one note at a time)
  • Festival Budgets/Marketing - $1,500 (We gotta get it out there somehow)

Grand Total - $22,400

Of course, this is the ideal number. We can make adjustments, ask favors, cut some services and ultimately settle for cheaper options, but with a little more latitude, we can do so much more.

That's why we have set our goal to $10,000. We believe this would be the perfect balance between doing what we want and doing what we can. The quality will still be there, but the favors will still need to be asked.

With that being said, for everyone who contributes, we have some pretty cool rewards for you.

$5 - Five Dolla Make Me Holla

Your name will go under the Special Thanks section of the credits, and you can have the satisfaction of knowing our crew appreciates your existence.

$10 - Film Goer

Receive a 4K digital download of the short film upon release plus the perk listed above.

$25 - Cinephile

Receive a list of our curated movies, music and podcasts to help get you in the mood for our short film that reflect similar themes, show our inspiration, and just overall scare you for the fun of it. Plus, receive the perks listed above.

$50 - Behind the Scenes

Receive exclusive BTS photos and videos as the project progresses with newsletters that will update you more fully on technical aspects, crew updates, release strategies and more. This includes all perks listed above.

$100 - Midnight Preview

Receive a special early screener of the short film months before it releases to the public. This includes all perks listed above.

$250 - Film Student

Gain access to an exclusive Director's Webinar where me and several crew members walk you through how to make your own short film from concept to reality by discussing in depth how we made A Monster in the House. This includes all perks listed above.

$500 - VIP

Get two tickets to attend a private premiere of A Monster in the House on the big screen in Orlando, FL. Then join us afterwards for a little celebration at our historic studio with food, drinks, and a lot of fun. This includes all perks listed above.

$1,000 - Executive Producer

Congratulations! You've made a serious contribution to the short film, and you deserve the title of Executive Producer at the beginning of our credits! You'll receive an Executive Producer credit on IMDB as well so you'll basically be famous. Plus, receive the perks listed above.

 

How else can I help?

I understand it's a very weird time right now with the pandemic and it might be difficult for some of you to contribute. But don't worry! If you can't contribute financially, all we ask is you share this campaign and help us to promote the film through social media and word of mouth. That will help more than you even realize, and we can't thank you enough for the support!

 

And that's all there is to it.

Let's make a damn movie!

story:
Ancient story. Modern jokes.

BAE WOLF is a feature-length horror-comedy set in the world of the Beowulf legend.

In our telling of this timeless tale, the hero Beowulf is a woman and a con artist. She and her band of Geats extort villages for protection against fake monsters. But the Danish village of Heorot really is under assault by a very real monster, the desperately-lonely Grendel. Her fraud exposed, Beowulf must transform into a genuine warrior.

Shot on location at a medieval-style castle in Trenton, South Carolina, BAE WOLF boasts striking and authentic production design. But its tone, language, humor and conflicts are all very modern.

BAE WOLF is funny, fast-paced, colorful, playful and weird, with sympathetic heroes, compelling monsters and a surprise ending that will keep people talking. It's got swords, castles, hot men, hotter women and exactly one horse.

 

Weird ideas are free. Weird movies aren't.

Making a movie like BAE WOLF costs around $30,000. We're asking you to help us raise at least $10,000 of that.

  • We're building several monster costumes, multiple special-effects decapitation rigs and something we like to call a "blood cannon."
  • Our actors will quit if we don't pay them. So will the horse.
  • We're shooting this thing in a marathon three-month period in the sweltering South Carolina summer. Your support pays for transportation, meals, equipment and probably a couple funerals for crew who die during the shoot. Just kidding. Kind of.

 

We can make you famous. Well, infamous.

  • A small donation gets you in the credits.
  • Make a bigger donation, and we'll bring you in as a producer. That means an IMDB credit as well as bragging rights at bars.
  • In exchange for a really generous donation, we'll create a character for you, if you want. You can be a Danish or Geat warrior, a hapless villager or even a bloody meal for one of our hungry monsters.

 

In all seriousness ...

We are a committed bunch of filmmakers in the Midlands region of South Carolina. We've made several features and shorts, most of which we're pretty proud of. Our best features include:

  • The Theta Girl (2017): A "punk-rock gore-fest [that] is also a philosophical film." Film Threat
  • Shed (2019): "This isn’t simply a blood-and-guts pic." Post and Courier
  • Lection (2020): "An interesting cautionary tale about the dangers of tribalism." Tennessee Horror News

Key cast and crew include:

  • Writer-director David Axe
  • Producer Stephan Jensen
  • Effects wizard Brandon McIver
  • Mike Amason as "Hrothgar"
  • Jennifer Hill as "Beowulf"
  • Josh Kern as "Grendel"

 

Join us!

You probably won't regret it.

story:
Comedy that is out of this world!

"Bug-Eyed Monsters Invade the Earth!" is the new movie from Canadian actor and filmmaker Anthony D.P. Mann (The Wicker Man, Terror of Dracula, Return to Frightenstein). The film is a story of the things that we love, and those parts of our childhood that we can’t let go of... it’s about love, loss, disappointment, triumph… and it’s got bug-eyed monsters, so what more could you possibly ask for?

As you can tell from the title, the movie is an homage to classic sci-fi films and TV series of the 1950's and 60's, as well as a celebration of our fellow fanboys / fangirls and geekdom everywhere. The plot involves a bus tour taking fans of the obscure TV show “The Adventures of Professor Qur-I/0” to various locations where the series was shot. When the bus breaks down in the middle of nowhere, this band of misfits finds themselves in the middle of a REAL alien invasion, and it’s up to the old series star - Professor Qur-I/0 himself! - to save the day.

In a major coup for our production, "Klakk" - the central alien menace of the film - will be voiced by legendary actor Sylvester McCoy, best known for his portrayal of the seventh television incarnation of Doctor Who, and as "Radagast the Brown" in Peter Jackson's Hobbit movies. Sylvester has already completed his work on Bug-Eyed Monsters Invade the Earth!

 

Help us make a good film even better...

The film is fully-cast, our creative team is in place, our guest star is recorded, and locations are currently being scouted. It's happening, come heck or high-water... but we want to make sure that we have the resources to do the very best that we can, and bring you the very best possible version of Bug-Eyed Monsters Invade the Earth possible - and so, we are launching this Indiegogo campaign, with all sorts of great perks that you can read more about on the main campaign page. These goodies include early digital and DVD copies of the movie and soundtrack, “thank you’s” in the final credits, artwork, props, scripts, behind-the-scenes access, various tiers of producer credits, and even an opportunity to have your voice appear in a scene alongside our special guest star. We’ve set a humble goal, which is realistic for our ambitions - and we hope that you will help us achieve it.

 

Opportunities for artists...

Bleak December Inc. (Anthony Mann's audio and film production company) has always taken pride in offering local and early-career artists opportunities to work on high-profile projects. From local actors to behind-the-scenes crew and creative personnel, our talent has had the opportunity to work alongside icons in the industry, including: Malcolm McDowell, Tony Todd, Brian Blessed, Sir Derek Jacobi, and others. 

In late January 2021, we will be launching an online competition open to children and youth, inviting them to submit their character designs for "Klakk". The winning design (determined via online voting) will serve as the basis for the design of the puppet that will portray the character on-screen. What a wonderful opportunity for young, aspiring artists!

 

Risks & Challenges (the other bug-eyed monsters)...

We are in good shape moving into this project, with an experienced team used to creating magic on limited budgets!

Anthony D.P. Mann has a solid track record of quality film-making with micro budgets, and his work has been celebrated in international publications, including Fangoria, Starburst and Rue Morgue. We have assembled a talented team of actors and behind-the-scenes artists who will help bring this very special film project to life, on time and on budget.

The filmmakers are committed to commence filming in late Spring 2021, with an anticipated completion date in April 2022. We foresee no delays, even under the current pandemic restrictions.

 

Other Ways You Can Help...

Please consider getting involved by contributing to this Indiegogo campaign, and partaking of the great perks on offer. You can also help by sharing this video and link on social media, and with anyone that you think might be interested in joining us on our journey... together, we are confident that can make some wonderful movie magic. Thanks for checking us out!

story:
PROJECT SUMMARY 

"Ampe Study; or Leap into the Sky, Black Girl'' is a documentary film by Ghanaian and Nigerian artists Chineze Okpalaoka, Ife Oluwamuyide, and Claudia Owusu. Set in Columbus, OH and Accra, Ghana, the film highlights the journey of Black Girlhood and the relationships that Ghanaian girls have with their childhood selves through the lens of the traditional game, ampe. Ampe is a rhythmic, high-energy game played by girls in Ghana, West Africa. It includes jumping, clapping, and an all-around cheer and hype as two teams select a stepping pattern and face off. The teams have leading players, referred to as “the mothers'', who start the game and encourage players to compete at their best. The innate joy and competitive edge of ampe reveals the desire that Black girls have to be set free and feel a range of emotions without judgement.

 

PROJECT FOCUS

Ampe is slowly disappearing from the Ghanaian-American cultural landscape; and it's now rare to see Ghanaian girls in Columbus, OH engaging in the game, even though Columbus is home to over 10,000 Ghanaian immigrants and stands as a sister city to Accra, Ghana. With each new generation of immigrants, there’s a loss of history and personal connection. Ampe Study; or Leap into the Sky, Black Girl seeks to reconcile and preserve the cultural memory of Ghanaian traditions. By documenting the experiences of 10 young Ghanaian women in Columbus and Accra, we want to understand the history of ampe as a coming-of-age ritual across the African diaspora, how it informs the way Ghanaian women view themselves, each other, and the world around them.

 

WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL GO TOWARDS

With your support, we will be able to complete this film dedicated to the rememory of Black girls and Black women in the African diaspora. We desire to reach Black women and Black girls because, above all else, this story belongs to them—to us. We want Black girls to understand that their cultural contributions, space, and involvements are invaluable; and it is our mission that more Black women and Black girls will pick up a camera and contribute to the narrative lineage in their own communities after watching our film.

  • In order to transform our innovative idea into a successful production, we are requesting $13,000. Granted funds would cover our project timeline, from pre-production to post-production, and would go towards a professional crew, equipment rental, space rental for shoots, travel & accommodation,  COVID-19 tests in Ghana, visa applications, and yellow fever shots for travel to Ghana, West Africa. 

 

 WHAT YOUR SUPPORT MEANS

 

WHAT YOU GET

  • High-Five Pledge: Back this project simply because you believe in it, you believe in us, and because it speaks to you. Pledges at this level are not associated with perks.

  • Applause Pledge $10+ : You’ll get recognition on our Instagram and in our film credits for backing our project + access to our specially curated Spotify and Apple Music playlists for the film. *We’ll need your name and instagram profile @*

  • Killin' It Pledge $25+ : The first 10 supporters to give at this level will receive a limited edition Ampe Study poster. Other supporters at this level will receive exclusive access to behind the scenes footage through our Instagram close friends’ list.

  • Up Next Pledge $50+ :Think you’ve got what it takes to be an ampe champion? We’ll organize a meetup (location TBA), teach you how to play the game, and host a mini-tournament.

  • Face to Face $100+ : The first 5 supporters to give at this level will be invited to join us on set during one of our filming days in Columbus, OH. Set visits will be organized to ensure the safety of our guests and compliance with COVID-19 policies. Donors outside of Ohio or the U.S., who are not able to join us on set for filming, will be invited to an intimate Q&A session with the directors.

  • Fan Girl $500+ : In addition to the aforementioned awards, the first 10 supporters at the  $500+ level will be invited to an intimate dinner and first access, VIP screening of Ampe Study; or Leap into the Sky, Black Girl.

  • Ampe Queen $1000+ : Supporters at this level will receive an executive producer credit in addition to the dinner and VIP screening. Supporters will also receive posters and personalized, handwritten letters, signed with love.

 

Risks & Challenges

The COVID-19 pandemic has forced many platforms to cancel grant applications or place them on a temporary hold; due to this, we have experienced great difficulty acquiring funds, which has caused us to delay our production timeline. The pandemic has also placed a barrier in our ability to access our subjects due to past flight cancellations and lockdowns. With all of these factors in mind, we are motivated to conduct a safe and sensible production. Before shooting begins, we will require that the cast and crew take COVID-19 tests and wear masks on set. Our first-aid kit will include a thermometer to check temperatures and fevers. As we handle different equipment and props, we will sanitize all surfaces and areas after each interview, and socially distance while on set, and in between shoots. Before we leave for Ghana, we will quarantine for two weeks, take a rapid-result COVID-19 test 72 hours before our flight, and take another test upon arrival. We’ll also take another COVID-19 test 72 hours before our departure from Ghana. We understand the life-threatening effects of COVID-19, and intend to follow all the rules and regulations from the CDC guidelines.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can help our cause by:

  • Getting the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Follow us on Instagram @ampestudyfilm and share our page with your network!

And that's all there is to it.

 

TEAM

As three African filmmakers in a genre where these types of stories are still few and far between, our work seeks to reimagine our personal histories in a way that is redemptive. Through this film, we explore how the emotions ampe evokes carry into other parts of our lives; what it means to take up space and allow the truest parts of ourselves to take flight; and how the games we play are about so much more than just entertainment, but also safety, connection, and understanding in a space created for us, by us. 

 

Chineze Okpalaoka is a Nigerian-American visual artist based in Columbus, OH. Her work is primarily an exploration of black presence and black dignity, with an emphasis on narratives surrounding identity, girlhood, diasporic histories, and faith. She is committed to storytelling as a sacred, revolutionary act of remembrance—a space where we can feel seen, wrestle with reality, and recognize glory even in the ordinariness of our lives. Her work has been exhibited locally at the Columbus Arts Festival, Carnegie Gallery, Shot Tower Gallery, and Cultural Arts Center. In 2018, she began curating her own pop-up gallery experiences through Black Girl Miracle, an online and real-life platform she created to celebrate the beauty and power of womanhood through the art of storytelling.

 

Claudia Owusu is a Ghanaian-American Writer and Filmmaker based in Columbus, Ohio. She writes from these two liminal spaces, internally and externally, trying to make sense of them. She believes in the beauty of community and the intimate stories we share when we think no one is listening. Her work has appeared in Vogue Magazine, Clockhouse Magazine, Quiz & Quill Literary Magazine, Wusgood.black, 20.35 African Contemporary Poetry through Brittle Paper, and Ohio’s Best Emerging Poets 2017 and 2018. Her short films have screened at the Black Femme Supremacy Film Festival, Ohio Shorts Film Festival, Nkabom Literary Art Festival in Accra, Ghana and Lome, Togo, and the No Evil Eye Film Festival in New York.

 

Ife Oluwamuyide is a Nigerian-American visual artist and filmmaker based in both Columbus, OH and Brooklyn, NY. She is a student at Pratt Institute, studying fine art with a minor in community art and design education. As a black female artist it is important that she writes her own narrative, exploring the complexities and beauty of black womanhood and learning to embrace, love, and cherish each and every aspect of it. Through her work she hopes to provide access to the otherwise exclusive medium of visual art.

story:
The Events Surrounding a Peeping Tom is the disturbing story of Martin Malone, a lonely Peeping Tom who finds himself caught and arrested following a misstep. As he nears the end of his court-mandated rehabilitation, Martin is still unable to fight his urges and begins to peep again. It is then that he discovers Rowan, the girl of his dreams. As his obsession with her grows, he begins to suspect that she may be involved with the occult. Using his peeping skills, Martin begins an investigation that leads him down a twisted path to something more horrible than anything he could ever imagine and realizes that all the while, he's being watched himself.


Every movie begins as a spark of artistic inspiration followed by generating sufficient funds to provide tinder vital for turning sparks into healthy, crackling, flames.  Creating an independent, high quality, low-budget, feature-length film during a global pandemic just may be the equivalent of creating fire without matches in the rain forest, but with determination, hard work, and your help, we believe our little spark can roar.

Creating a low-budget independent film means that 100% of each donation will be spent creating a thought-provoking movie even the most ardent fans of psychological horror will find challenging. All the funds raised here will cover pre-determined costs within our stringent budget and will go towards physical production, taking us through the completion of principal photography, not towards the craft table.  We hope you will join us in creating a movie even the most ardent psychological horror fans and movie lovers will find nuanced, challenging, and worthy of rewatching again and again.

To not compromise our vision, we are combining our own funds and resources, such as wonderful filming locations throughout Connecticut, with this campaign. We arrived at our funding goal only after our own funds were depleted, all other avenues exhausted, and every resource we could muster confirmed. While unusual, the route of combining our own funds with a fundraising campaign should attest to our relentless passion and confidence in this film.

By sharing our unbridled confidence and conviction in this movie, we hope it will engender you to support us, allowing for the creation of a movie that will carve out a place in the hallowed halls of our beloved genre of horror. 

Movie-makers apologetic about creating horror movies are growing tiresome. We are proud to stand with horror movie fans and hope you will likewise join us in creating a new timeless horror classic and discover the best part of movie making: the collaborative spirit of the team. Experience alongside us that strange, energizing sensation of sitting down, kicking your feet up, and watching a movie you made possible, knowing you helped feed the artistic spark.

Our sincerest thanks to you for taking the time to hang here, check things out, and, if you so choose, to support this amazing project in any way you can.  This movie means everything to us, and we cannot wait to share the finished project with you.

We will be adding updates (additional casting news and other goodies, etc.) throughout the campaign. Any questions or concerns, PLEASE do not hesitate to ask either here, on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, or any other social networking outlets where we can be tracked down and happily cornered.

story:
10/31 Part 3 is on the way!

And here is how you can help us make it happen! This is also your chance to get some very RARE and Limited Edition 10/31 III Merch that is Exclusive to this Indiegogo Campaign only!

About 10/31 Part 3:

10/31 Part 3 is the third installment of the critically acclaimed Halloween horror anthology films produced by Rocky Gray. Directors for the newest feature include Michael Ballif director of They Live Inside Us, Jacob Perrett director of Spine Chiller, Brad Twigg director of Killer Campout and Zane Hershberger director of Force To Fear with special effects artist Cody Ruch on board providing some KILLER practical effects.

Also returning is our horror hostess Malvolia: The Queen of Screams to guide us into our world of monsters and madmen. Music for all of the segments will be provided by Rocky Gray who also worked on 10/31 and 10/31 Part II. 10/31 Part 3 is already in production and scheduled for a 2021 release through Scream Team Releasing.

Help us make our best Halloween Horror Anthology yet!
 

Items Exclusive to this Advance Pre-Order:

  • All three 10/31 Movies in a Limited Print Collectors Boxset Case. 
  • An Exclusive Version of the 10/31 III Movie Poster.
  • Signed Blu-Rays and CDs (if mentioned in the perk description)
  • All Perks come with an Advance Digital Download of the Movie Soundtrack.
     

What Our Wonderful Backers Will Be Helping With:

The list is long, movie production is something else, but here are the most important parts of 10/31 Part 3 that your contributions will be helping with:

  • Preproduction Needs
  • Practical Special Effects
  • Set Production Costs
  • Postproduction Editing
  • Designer Fees and Artwork Costs
  • CD, Blu-ray, and VHS Manufacturing


How Your Contributions Break Down:

  • 55% Movie Production
  • 35% Manufacturing Merch and Shipping Costs
  • 10% Indiegogo Fees


Other Ways You Can Help:

We understand that the pandemic that has impacted us all the past 12 months. If you are unable to contribute to this campaign then a simple share really goes a long way and we greatly appreciate it! Also make sure to follow Part 3 Updates on our social media platforms:

  • 10/31 Facebook
  • 10/31 Instagram
  • Spotify
     
  • Rocky on Facebook
  • Rocky on Instagram
  • Rocky on Twitter
  • Rocky on YouTube


If you prefer to send us a donation via PayPal (this does not include a perk) you can send away here: https://www.paypal.com/paypalme/Rockygraystore

Thank you so much for making it all the way to the bottom of this page! Since you're still here please now we are super excited to bring you Part 3 of 10/31 and appreciate your support. Thank you for your interest and hang tight! You can find more info in the FAQs and Campaign Updates.

- Rocky Gray and the entire 10/31 team
