story:
Welcome to Dropout Productions! 

My name is Ari Lozano, and I am the founder of Dropout Productions and the writer/director of the brand new short-film MADRUGADA. The team and I couldn't be more excited about this project, and we hope you will be too!

My journey as a film maker has just begun, however I have been involved in the film industry for some time, working on films and commercials in many different capacities. The appreciation and knowledge I have gained during this time has been invaluable. Because the film industry was put on hold due to the pandemic, I decided to undertake my own project to submit for the 2022 spring film festival season.

The team that we have put together is made up of extremely talented, professional, and enthusiastic individuals who all share the same passion for creative endeavors, specifically movies! 

 

MADRUGADA Plot Summary

Zane, a hopeless romantic, sits at a bar with his two outcast friends, building up the courage to finally talk to his secret crush Blanche, the bartender. However, Zane is soon going to realize that there are bigger, scarier, and more hairy obstacles in his way than he anticipated, and it's going to be a long night.

 

Empower a Community

We are located in Denton, Texas which is also where the film takes place. This small Texas college town is overflowing with young, eager, creative minds that are desperate for a chance to put their expertise to use, and Dropout Productions has managed to do just that. 

With your contribution, you will single-handedly allow a tight-knit community of friends, artists and collaborators, the ability to infuse their talents and creative perspectives through the wonderful medium of film! 

 

Meet the Cast

 

BLANCHE

Sarah Harley: Sarah has had a passion for acting for as long as she can remember. Early childhood was spent directing and performing plays with her siblings in her family’s living room until she finally became involved in community theatre at the age of 11. Sarah earned her Bachelor of Science in Performance/Directing and Musical Theatre from Northwestern State University of Louisiana. During her time in college, Sarah received special training in performing Shakespeare, Ibsen and Chekhov, as well as Stage Combat. Throughout her theatre career, she earned several awards for her performances (Best Featured Actress - Penny/Hairspray; Irene Ryan Award Nominee – Echo/Eleemosynary; Best Actress – Brooke Wyeth/Other Desert Cities;  Best Actress – Wendy/Peter Pan). Sarah has also worked on short films across the country and we are excited to have her on the team.

 

ZANE

Caleb Rodriguez: Caleb comes from an acting background beginning in grade school and has continued on into college, where he is now in his second year at the University of North Texas pursuing a degree in Film. Today you can find Caleb slinging drinks behind a coffee bar, volunteering at his church,  or taking on film projects of his own in and out of the classroom. 

 

ROBBIE

Allen Powers: Allen’s artistic career started in the theater behind the curtain, filling roles such as stage hand, technical director and scenic designer. On stage, Allen has performed in many productions including “Mud,” “A Fox on the Fairway,” and “November.” He was also cast as the abusive alcoholic father in “The Boys Next Door.” Allen loves focusing on comedy and improv, and appreciates the gentle moments of sincerity that resonate within the genre. 

 

LINUS

Matt Richardson: Although he tends to fly under the radar at the dinner table, Matt thrives in the spotlight! In college, he appeared in productions ranging from "One Flew Over the Cuckoos Nest" to Alfred Hitchcock's "39 Steps," winning a Best-Actor award along the way, and recently appeared in the TV series "American Horror Story - Freak Show." Matt brings a fantastic energy to the set and we are delighted to work with him.  

 

ROYCE

Cole Hawkins: Cole is immersed in the media arts, and is familiar with being in front of the camera, as well as performing on stage for a live audience. In the theater, Cole has been in such plays as  "Annie Get You Gun," "The King and I," and "The Music Man." On camera, he has produced and acted in many short films, most notably "Delusion" and "All the Things Behind a Cloud."  Cole takes his roles seriously, and we can't wait to collaborate with him! 

 

Why Your Contribution Helps So Much! 

We have spent many hours crafting the budget to be as economical as possible without sacrificing the quality of the film. This means that every donation, big or small, will help enable us to accomplish our aspirations. Below are examples of what we will need to make our film. 

 

  • Costumes and props - When you see the word "costume" you might think Victorian period-piece or a cowboy wearing a leather vest. There will be no curly wigs or spurs featured in this story, however, we need to be able to appropriately dress our characters in a way that expresses who they are as individuals, so the audience can better understand them in the story. 

 

  • Lens rental - If you've ever been behind a camera, you will agree that one of the most important aspects of capturing great shots is the lens (and lighting). We have found a fantastic local company that rents camera gear at resonable prices. Your contributions will allow us to get high-quality gear on set for our talented camera crew to use, turning our super- fun project into a super-fun project that looks great! 

 

  • Location fees - We are thrilled to announce that we were able to snag a fantastic location for free, thanks to our awesome producers and wonderful community that believes in our efforts and supports local art! This will enable us to boost the production quality of the film by dispersing the location fees of the budget as needed.

 

  • Hair and makeup (and prosthetics!!...shhhhhh) - It's fun to watch an actor go from zero to hero in a four-minute montage, while we lay on the couch and try to throw pieces of popcorn into our mouths. What we usually don't realize is that the four-minute montage probably took a minimum of three days of twelve-hour shooting! This means that someone had to make the actor oily or sweaty or dirty every single moment of the three-day shoot! Let's not even mention the effort it takes to make someone look beat up or bloody. Your contribution will allow us to buy the necessary products our talented makeup-team needs in order to create popcorn-munching movie magic! 

 

  • Set design - If you do it right, the attention to detail in the set design can and should immerse the character and the audience by creating an environment that feels authentic to the story. When you make a donation, it will allow us to create the environment for the characters to exist in, and as a result, produce the movie-going experience we are all striving for! 

 

  • Composer and Music licensing - Have you ever watched "Jaws" with the sound off? OF COURSE NOT! The animatronic shark is almost powerless without the brilliance of John Williams' score lurking alongside it. We realize that music and sound might be one of the most important aspects of making a good film, and people with the ability to write good music are far and few between. Fortunately, our team has moved mountains again, and we have found a professional composer (with Broadway credentials) to volunteer his talents to write and oversee the music portion of the project. With your contribution, we will be able to complete this very valuable part of the process using the funds for sound equipment and music licensing fees which can add up very quickly. 

 

  • Film Festival Entry Fees - Festivals are an important part of the independent filmmaker's journey and we're not just talking backstage passes. As mentioned before, our ultimate goal is to get MADRUGADA shown at film festivals all around the country and the world. This can potentially lead to more exposure, naturally connecting us to more donors, which in turn will help us be able to continue making movies. Film Festival entry fees can range from $25 to $125. Your donation will assist us in entering MADRUGADA in the film festival circuit arena, so that we have the chance to not only continue doing what we love, but to be able to share what we love with the rest of the world. 

 

Perks

We want to show our appreciation for your donation by offering "perks" to those of you who contribute specific amounts we feel will have a large impact on the progress of our project. Check out the perks we offer at the top of this page! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you find yourself in a position where you are interested in our project but can not financially contribute, do not be dismayed. Help us by spreading the word about our film through social media, email and the Indiegogo share tools! 

 

We are extremely excited to collaborate our efforts and see this project though. Thank you so much for your time and for your interest in Dropout Productions, and in our brand-new film MADRUGADA!
story_txt:
Welcome to Dropout Productions! 
My name is Ari Lozano, and I am the founder of Dropout Productions and the writer/director of the brand new short-film MADRUGADA. The team and I couldn't be more excited about this project, and we hope you will be too!
My journey as a film maker has just begun, however I have been involved in the film industry for some time, working on films and commercials in many different capacities. The appreciation and knowledge I have gained during this time has been invaluable. Because the film industry was put on hold due to the pandemic, I decided to undertake my own project to submit for the 2022 spring film festival season.
The team that we have put together is made up of extremely talented, professional, and enthusiastic individuals who all share the same passion for creative endeavors, specifically movies! 
 
MADRUGADA Plot Summary
Zane, a hopeless romantic, sits at a bar with his two outcast friends, building up the courage to finally talk to his secret crush Blanche, the bartender. However, Zane is soon going to realize that there are bigger, scarier, and more hairy obstacles in his way than he anticipated, and it's going to be a long night.
 
Empower a Community
We are located in Denton, Texas which is also where the film takes place. This small Texas college town is overflowing with young, eager, creative minds that are desperate for a chance to put their expertise to use, and Dropout Productions has managed to do just that. 
With your contribution, you will single-handedly allow a tight-knit community of friends, artists and collaborators, the ability to infuse their talents and creative perspectives through the wonderful medium of film! 
 
Meet the Cast
 
BLANCHE

Sarah Harley: Sarah has had a passion for acting for as long as she can remember. Early childhood was spent directing and performing plays with her siblings in her family’s living room until she finally became involved in community theatre at the age of 11. Sarah earned her Bachelor of Science in Performance/Directing and Musical Theatre from Northwestern State University of Louisiana. During her time in college, Sarah received special training in performing Shakespeare, Ibsen and Chekhov, as well as Stage Combat. Throughout her theatre career, she earned several awards for her performances (Best Featured Actress - Penny/Hairspray; Irene Ryan Award Nominee – Echo/Eleemosynary; Best Actress – Brooke Wyeth/Other Desert Cities;  Best Actress – Wendy/Peter Pan). Sarah has also worked on short films across the country and we are excited to have her on the team.
 
ZANE

Caleb Rodriguez: Caleb comes from an acting background beginning in grade school and has continued on into college, where he is now in his second year at the University of North Texas pursuing a degree in Film. Today you can find Caleb slinging drinks behind a coffee bar, volunteering at his church,  or taking on film projects of his own in and out of the classroom. 
 
ROBBIE

Allen Powers: Allen’s artistic career started in the theater behind the curtain, filling roles such as stage hand, technical director and scenic designer. On stage, Allen has performed in many productions including “Mud,” “A Fox on the Fairway,” and “November.” He was also cast as the abusive alcoholic father in “The Boys Next Door.” Allen loves focusing on comedy and improv, and appreciates the gentle moments of sincerity that resonate within the genre. 
 
LINUS

Matt Richardson: Although he tends to fly under the radar at the dinner table, Matt thrives in the spotlight! In college, he appeared in productions ranging from "One Flew Over the Cuckoos Nest" to Alfred Hitchcock's "39 Steps," winning a Best-Actor award along the way, and recently appeared in the TV series "American Horror Story - Freak Show." Matt brings a fantastic energy to the set and we are delighted to work with him.  
 
ROYCE

Cole Hawkins: Cole is immersed in the media arts, and is familiar with being in front of the camera, as well as performing on stage for a live audience. In the theater, Cole has been in such plays as  "Annie Get You Gun," "The King and I," and "The Music Man." On camera, he has produced and acted in many short films, most notably "Delusion" and "All the Things Behind a Cloud."  Cole takes his roles seriously, and we can't wait to collaborate with him! 
 

Why Your Contribution Helps So Much! 
We have spent many hours crafting the budget to be as economical as possible without sacrificing the quality of the film. This means that every donation, big or small, will help enable us to accomplish our aspirations. Below are examples of what we will need to make our film. 
 

Costumes and props - When you see the word "costume" you might think Victorian period-piece or a cowboy wearing a leather vest. There will be no curly wigs or spurs featured in this story, however, we need to be able to appropriately dress our characters in a way that expresses who they are as individuals, so the audience can better understand them in the story. 
 

Lens rental - If you've ever been behind a camera, you will agree that one of the most important aspects of capturing great shots is the lens (and lighting). We have found a fantastic local company that rents camera gear at resonable prices. Your contributions will allow us to get high-quality gear on set for our talented camera crew to use, turning our super- fun project into a super-fun project that looks great! 
 

Location fees - We are thrilled to announce that we were able to snag a fantastic location for free, thanks to our awesome producers and wonderful community that believes in our efforts and supports local art! This will enable us to boost the production quality of the film by dispersing the location fees of the budget as needed.
 

Hair and makeup (and prosthetics!!...shhhhhh) - It's fun to watch an actor go from zero to hero in a four-minute montage, while we lay on the couch and try to throw pieces of popcorn into our mouths. What we usually don't realize is that the four-minute montage probably took a minimum of three days of twelve-hour shooting! This means that someone had to make the actor oily or sweaty or dirty every single moment of the three-day shoot! Let's not even mention the effort it takes to make someone look beat up or bloody. Your contribution will allow us to buy the necessary products our talented makeup-team needs in order to create popcorn-munching movie magic! 
 

Set design - If you do it right, the attention to detail in the set design can and should immerse the character and the audience by creating an environment that feels authentic to the story. When you make a donation, it will allow us to create the environment for the characters to exist in, and as a result, produce the movie-going experience we are all striving for! 
 

Composer and Music licensing - Have you ever watched "Jaws" with the sound off? OF COURSE NOT! The animatronic shark is almost powerless without the brilliance of John Williams' score lurking alongside it. We realize that music and sound might be one of the most important aspects of making a good film, and people with the ability to write good music are far and few between. Fortunately, our team has moved mountains again, and we have found a professional composer (with Broadway credentials) to volunteer his talents to write and oversee the music portion of the project. With your contribution, we will be able to complete this very valuable part of the process using the funds for sound equipment and music licensing fees which can add up very quickly. 
 

Film Festival Entry Fees - Festivals are an important part of the independent filmmaker's journey and we're not just talking backstage passes. As mentioned before, our ultimate goal is to get MADRUGADA shown at film festivals all around the country and the world. This can potentially lead to more exposure, naturally connecting us to more donors, which in turn will help us be able to continue making movies. Film Festival entry fees can range from $25 to $125. Your donation will assist us in entering MADRUGADA in the film festival circuit arena, so that we have the chance to not only continue doing what we love, but to be able to share what we love with the rest of the world. 
 
Perks
We want to show our appreciation for your donation by offering "perks" to those of you who contribute specific amounts we feel will have a large impact on the progress of our project. Check out the perks we offer at the top of this page! 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you find yourself in a position where you are interested in our project but can not financially contribute, do not be dismayed. Help us by spreading the word about our film through social media, email and the Indiegogo share tools! 
 
We are extremely excited to collaborate our efforts and see this project though. Thank you so much for your time and for your interest in Dropout Productions, and in our brand-new film MADRUGADA!

story:
• The Concept
  • The Plot
  • Why Animation?
  • The First Ten Minutes - Animatic Cut
  • What We Need
  • The Perks
  • Beyond the Contribution

    I read Lovecraft for the first time by accident. It was a strange chain of events that started the most important project of my life.

   When I was fifteen, I was listening to Metallica's "Call of Ktulu", and that strange name made me curious. I searched on the internet and read about Lovecraft, the monster, the story ... But I didn't think much more about it.
   Months later, I don't know how or why, the name mysteriously returned to my mind: Cthulhu.
   I was going to buy the book on the Internet, but my father stopped me and said, "Look, the book is in the library". So I looked at the top shelf of the library and there was this row of very old white booklets. When I took the book, it was small, ruined, with a really bad cover and yellowed pages. Suddenly I was reluctant to read it. Nevertheless, that night, I started reading.   I read it overnight. I was sorry to find that the story was very short, 33 pages, but immediately afterwards it began another one: "The Shadow Over Innsmouth". I was shaken by those stories, and they became a fixed idea in my mind.

   During high school I started thinking of making a movie about Lovecraft and his creatures... Searching the Internet, I didn't find anything faithfully representing the story of Cthulhu or the inhabitants of Innsmouth. So I started writing the script, dutifully following the two stories and weaving them together with caution.

   After many years the script was ready, but I've realized it was just an utopian idea...

Or maybe not?

   I got some notions of 3D animation and doing the movie in this way seemed like the best approach. So I assembled a team of designers, 3D modelers, animators and we started to work on this teaser trailer...

  In 1926, a young student finds, among documents left to him by his deceased great-uncle, a clay statuette representing a strange monster... From the notes of his uncle, he learns that the sculpture is the work of contemporary artist Henry Wilcox, who made it after awakening from a nightmare. Driven by his strong curiosity, the young man begins to connect several stories, like puzzle pieces coming from different places and different times.

  What combines the delirious nightmares of a young artist, the report of an elderly New Orleans police inspector, the story of a Greenland expedition, and the diary of a Norwegian sailor who died in mysterious circumstances?

   What is the unholy Cult of Cthulhu that unites all these stories?

   In parallel, another student travels with the intention of visiting the most characteristic location in Massachusetts. He arrives in the sinister harbor town of Innsmouth, whose gloomy and mysterious citizens hide an enormous and unspeakable secret...

   Between the walls of those houses, horror awaits the innocent prey...

   While we were writing the script we realized the impossibility of making the film in live action, at least in a satisfactory and professional way for our means. Setting everything in 1920's America (and we're Italians …) is quite impossible for us. It would be just as impossible to create locations such as the fantastical R'lyeh, the foreboding Innsmouth and many others - not to mention Cthulhu himself!

   Animation seemed the solution to the problem. Animation affords a greater, more precise style, as well as being more artistic and functional to the story.

 

   An animatic is an animated storyboard. Boards are cut together with the correct timing and pace of the film. They include basic sound effects, dialogue recordings and scratch soundtrack.

   Take a look!

 

   When the idea of bringing Cthulhu and the inhabitants of Innsmouth to life came into our minds – it was 2011- we started to organize the workflow in every single detail.  

   We decided to start with small steps, which is why the campaign goal is "low" (compared to the budget normally needed in such productions). But nothing prohibits us from overcoming our goals and moving in leaps and bounds!

   The first step, is to realize the concepts for every visual aspect, which will be the basis for the creation of 3d models (characters, locations, props, etc), and to draw a precise storyboard of every shot. Basically, we need professional artists!  

   Then, we need to give to all the characters a voice of their own! In the production of an animated movie, voices are recorded before the animation process itself, to allow the animators to synchronize the character's mouth during dialogue. So, we need professional voice actors.  
 
   These are the two principals goals we're trying to reach with this campaign.
 
   After completing these two steps, we will start with the actual production phase, using the budget collected through this campaign.
 

Almost a third of the estimated budget
will be allocated to the realization
and delivery of rewards.

   These perks were carefully imagined by our team. Some of them are limited perks, due to manufacting and shipping cost – so hurry up! 

   For a more detailed description of the content of each reward check the column to the right.

   Here they are!

   As a demonstration of our gratitude,  we will add your name to the credits of the movie! We hope this list will be VERY LONG!

(This perk will also be included in all the other perk options.)

       A small gift for you: a postcard direct from the dark and unholy sunken city of R'Lyeh!

   Plus you will recieve our beautiful desktop wallpaper.

Art by Domenico "Domeddi" Esposito

   Here's the movie! If you want to be the first to have a look (and listen!) to the finished product, this is the reward for you! You will receive a digital download of the movie and soundtrack! Along with desktop wallpaper, of course!

* Cover designs subject to change*

   If you prefer to have a physical copy, here it is!
   A Blu-Ray copy of the film, in addition to the Digital Download of the Soundtrack, the Desktop Wallpaper and the postcard!

   If you want a DVD copy instead, you can send a private message and, depending on the number of requests, it will be added as an option.

   Are you a proud Cultist? Show it to the world with this beautiful t-shirt! Plus you will receive the Digital Download of the Original Soundtrack and the Movie Blu-Ray! 

   T-shirts are printed with a precise and professional screen printing method, which guarantees the output of every detail of the design.

Art by Dartworks

   In addition you will also receive a beautiful print of our Master!

   Print Size:  20x30 cm /  7,87x11,8 inches

Art by Lorenzo Scipioni

 

   For the most courageous we propose this beautiful  art poster of Our Dark Lord Cthulhu! And as a reward for your courage, we add, not only the Blu-Ray and the Original Soundtrack CD but also the t-shirt and the Art Print!

   Poster size: 42 x 60 cm / 16.5 x 23.6 inches

Art by Antonio De Luca​

   Last October we joined the Inktober challange, but with a little variation... We did the Inkthulhu!
   Here are ten of the best drawings made by our Lead Artist Domeddi, printed on fine and high-quality paper.
   Plus the Digital Download of our Artbook!
   You will also recive the Art Poster, the Art Print, the Blu-Ray, a t-shirt, the desktop wallpaper and the Original Soundtrack CD.

   Prints Size: 15x20 cm /  5,8x8,3 inches

* Cover designs subject to change*

   Choose this perk if you want to receive an exclusive artwork book of the movie. As soon as the campaign ends, we will start working on the concept art of the movie. We will then put the best of that art in a beautiful book!

      It will be at least 200 pages long, 21 x 30 cm \ 8,2 x 11,8 inches, with hardcover.

   This perk also includes the Blu-Ray, the Original Soundtrack CD, the Art Poster, the Art Print, ten Postards, the t-shirt and the desktop wallpaper.

*Box design subject to change*

   This is only for the best cultist among you all...
   A really great, beautiful, unholy, dark, big boxset! In this box you will find: the Blu-Ray, the Original Soundtrack CD, a Postcard, ten Inkthulhu Postards, the Art Poster, the Art Print, the beautiful Artwork Book, TWO t-shirts and...

   A wonderful Hand-Painted Resin Statue of the Great Old One Cthulhu, full of details! 

 On your desk, on your bedside table, on your altar dedicated to the Great Old One ... Put this beautiful reproduction of the hand-painted resin of the great Cthulhu wherever you want!

   Can you prove you are a real Cultist?

   The statue is 19 cm \ 7,4 inches tall and it will be hand-painted in dark grey with pale green details!

   This is a limited perk!

   The film is based not only on "The Call of Cthulhu", but also on "The Shadow Over Innsmouth".

   Which of the two stories do you prefer? With this reward you can choose one of two hand-painted glass plates! Along with it, the Cthulhu Ultimate Boxset will come to your home with all the rewards contained inside!

Glass size: 50 cm / 19,6 inches in diameter​

Art by WormholePaintings

 

   Don't know which of the painted glass plates to choose? Choose both! With this reward you will not only receive both of them, but everything included in the Cthulhu Ultimate Boxset.

   Plus we'll add a ticket to the Movie's Premiere!

   You, like us, strongly believe in this project.
   You, like us, want to see the world created by Lovecraft come to life.
   You, like us, will become fully part of this project.
   By choosing this special reward you will receive all the rewards listed above.
   Additionally, you will be credited as an Associate Producer, with preview access to movie sequences. You will also be able to choose a free reward from a second fundraising campaign.

   You will be our Outer God.

   This movie started with just one person. Now we're growing, but we need to keep our community growing. So, how can you help us bring this movie to life? Not only donating for the campaign, but also sharing this page with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.

   Follow us on our Facebook page where you can find information and all of the movie's updates.  

   We really appreciate your help!

   Cthulhu fhtagn!

 

Risks and challenges

   Our main challenge is time.

   To achieve this movie we need especially time. That's it. 
   As we've already said before, an animated feature film is not easy to make, but we can do it.
   The main risk is to not be able to finish the movie before the deadline we gave to ourself.

   Now we need to complete all the pre-production process, such as artworks, storyboards and voiceovers. We hope to do that in 3-4 months. 
   Then we can move to the full animation process.

   Sooner or later, we are going to finish this movie!

   Prints Size: 15x20 cm /  5,8x8,3 inches



* Cover designs subject to change*
   Choose this perk if you want to receive an exclusive artwork book of the movie. As soon as the campaign ends, we will start working on the concept art of the movie. We will then put the best of that art in a beautiful book!
      It will be at least 200 pages long, 21 x 30 cm \ 8,2 x 11,8 inches, with hardcover.
   This perk also includes the Blu-Ray, the Original Soundtrack CD, the Art Poster, the Art Print, ten Postards, the t-shirt and the desktop wallpaper.


*Box design subject to change*
   This is only for the best cultist among you all...   A really great, beautiful, unholy, dark, big boxset! In this box you will find: the Blu-Ray, the Original Soundtrack CD, a Postcard, ten Inkthulhu Postards, the Art Poster, the Art Print, the beautiful Artwork Book, TWO t-shirts and...
   A wonderful Hand-Painted Resin Statue of the Great Old One Cthulhu, full of details! 
 On your desk, on your bedside table, on your altar dedicated to the Great Old One ... Put this beautiful reproduction of the hand-painted resin of the great Cthulhu wherever you want!
   Can you prove you are a real Cultist?

   The statue is 19 cm \ 7,4 inches tall and it will be hand-painted in dark grey with pale green details!
   This is a limited perk!


   The film is based not only on "The Call of Cthulhu", but also on "The Shadow Over Innsmouth".
   Which of the two stories do you prefer? With this reward you can choose one of two hand-painted glass plates! Along with it, the Cthulhu Ultimate Boxset will come to your home with all the rewards contained inside!
Glass size: 50 cm / 19,6 inches in diameter​

Art by WormholePaintings

 
   Don't know which of the painted glass plates to choose? Choose both! With this reward you will not only receive both of them, but everything included in the Cthulhu Ultimate Boxset.
   Plus we'll add a ticket to the Movie's Premiere!


   You, like us, strongly believe in this project.   You, like us, want to see the world created by Lovecraft come to life.   You, like us, will become fully part of this project.   By choosing this special reward you will receive all the rewards listed above.   Additionally, you will be credited as an Associate Producer, with preview access to movie sequences. You will also be able to choose a free reward from a second fundraising campaign.
   You will be our Outer God.

   This movie started with just one person. Now we're growing, but we need to keep our community growing. So, how can you help us bring this movie to life? Not only donating for the campaign, but also sharing this page with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.
   Follow us on our Facebook page where you can find information and all of the movie's updates.  
   We really appreciate your help!
   Cthulhu fhtagn!

 
Risks and challenges
   Our main challenge is time.
   To achieve this movie we need especially time. That's it.    As we've already said before, an animated feature film is not easy to make, but we can do it.   The main risk is to not be able to finish the movie before the deadline we gave to ourself.
   Now we need to complete all the pre-production process, such as artworks, storyboards and voiceovers. We hope to do that in 3-4 months.    Then we can move to the full animation process.
   Sooner or later, we are going to finish this movie!

story:
"Gabriel’s script ‘Finding Your True Self’ is from the heart and delves into so many emotions. We should be giving filmmakers like Gabriel the opportunity to develop their voice and make films that they care deeply about. I can’t wait to see this script brought to life." - Chris Foggin, Director, Fisherman's Friends.

The Premise

Finding Your True Self is a slice of life story about James, an isolated young man whose only primary human contact is his controlling brother Charlie, whom James also lives with. A chance encounter with best friends Rosalind and Dave, a pair of fun, outgoing personalities, allows James the chance to break free of Charlie, while simultaneously giving him a new chance at friendship and life in general.

With influence from works such as God Help the Girl, T2 Trainspotting, and The Perks of Being a Wallflower, and undertones of drama and romance, Finding Your True Self is a film with an award winning script and an extremely talented cast, set to shoot in the North East of England in early 2021.

Production Background

In the crazy times we are living in, we are endeavouring to stay creative, and Finding Your True Self is the result! 

This film is important to us due to its relatable nature. It is about real people working their way through life, all with very different personalities and stories. This is a true to life tale that looks at strained relationships, and the coming of age you undergo during your 20's.

This film is important to us because of where we live. The North East is relatively lacking when it comes to film shoots, and we want to change that! We want to show that this area is full of talent and potential, and that there are dedicated and passionate filmmakers here with stories to tell.

As well as that, another factor that is key to the creation of this film is our hope to showcase the North East as an amazing area for filming. We plan on utilising plenty of local venues as well as engaging with the amazing businesses we have here.

We also have an absolutely fantastic cast that includes a handful of North East based actors, as well as one young rising star!

Awards And Reviews

The script itself has already been a recipient of several awards at a range of film festivals.

The script has won the following awards so far:

  • Best First Time Screenwriter - Best Script Awards
  • Feature Script (Outstanding Achievement Award) - Calcutta International Cult Film Festival
  • Best Screenwriter Of The Month - CKF International Film Festival
  • Feature Script (Outstanding Achievement Award) - Cult Critic Movie Awards
  • Honorable Mention: First Time Screenwriter - Kosice International Monthly Film Festival
  • Best Feature Script - Prague International Monthly Film Festival
  • Feature Script (Critic's Choice Award) - Tagore International Film Festival
  • 2nd Place (Best Written Screenplay) - Feel The Reel International Film Festival

 

 

We've also had some amazing reviews of the script:

"The script takes advantage of its seemingly simple premise and, with its heart, essence and identity, turns it into a very dynamic and emotive story of growth and personal triumph.This is a very original story that dares to explore somewhat dark but important themes, without going overboard." - Feel The Reel International Film Festival

"The concept is compelling and reliable. The author explores an exciting idea that proves to be among the script’s strengths. This is a quality drama that should see the light of the day." - The Monthly Film Festival

The film has also had some further festival selections as well at Bridge Fest and the Rome Independent Prisma Awards.

 

What We Need & What You Get!

A great amount of time has been spent totting up the costs of putting something like this together. We are doing our best to keep things lower budget and self funded where at all possible, but some help from you will help us truly bring this project to life.

When talking about funding delegations, we agreed that there would be prioritised delegations of funding which would be as follows:

  • Accommodation - £1,580. Some of our actors will need a place to stay for filming, and our intention is also to combine their accommodation with filming locations to help lower costs. 
  • Food - £920. Everyone needs to be well fed on set, and a well fed cast and crew is a happy cast and crew! This is our total allocation based on cast and crews numbers for each day, with a total of 17 shooting days.
  • Actor and Crew Expenses - £835. At the absolute minimum, we want to be able to cover any travel costs for our cast and crew. This total is based on various methods of transport that cast and crew will be using, and is again based on a per day basis.
  • Drone & Props  - £120. There's a scene in the film where we plan to show off Newcastle in all its natural beauty, and some drone footage will help us do just that. Aside from this, there are one or two unique props to be created for the film, and an allocation of costs will go to these.
  • Covid Safety - £33. We already have a temperature gun, but these funds will help us purchase additional face coverings and a large hand sanitiser to help us keep clean and stay safe on set!

 

Any additional amounts generated beyond our funding goal will be placed into areas to generally improve the film and get it seen by as many people as possible, such as paying for screening events to allow the film to be shown to a wider audience.

We have a host of brilliant perks including originally written and personalised monologues for actors, business promo videos, signed scripts, and Zoom calls with our cast and crew!

Every perk has been thought out with the film and TV world in mind, ideal for those working both in front of and behind the camera! That said, there are still plenty of perks to be enjoyed by all, such as a digital download of the film, PDF's of the script, and product placement opportunities.

 

Risks & Challenges

As is expected, the main challenge we face is the coronavirus, the elephant in the room! However, we will be undertaking many precautions to make sure our cast and crew are as safe as can be.

Firstly, we are creating two varying shooting schedules. One of these will be for tier 1, with interior and exterior scenes being permitted for filming. However we are also creating a tier 2/3 shooting schedule, prioritising exterior scenes first, so no matter what, we will be able to film come February!

As well as this we will have all the expected precautions on set, including social distancing, face coverings, hand sanitiser, and temperature checks before entry into any location. All cast and crew will also be completing the ‘Coronavirus basic awareness on production training’ assessment recommended and provided by ScreenSkills UK.

We will be doing everything we possibly can to create a fun, but safe, shooting environment!

 

Our Cast

We have a fantastic cast already signed on to help make this film the best it can be, including feature film newcomers and one rising star!

 

ROBBIE FALLON AS JAMES

 

After graduating in performing arts, Robbie started his professional acting career with a BBC radio commission in A Clockwork Orange. He is now taking his first step into film and is delighted to be involved in this exciting new project.

 

SARAH BULMER AS ROSALIND

 

Sarah is a stage and film actress, who trained on the Project A programme at the Theatre Royal in Newcastle. Following her graduation in 2019, Sarah’s work includes performances for the Brundibar Arts Festival, Theatre in Education and most recently a short film, Burden of Proof. She is absolutely thrilled to be taking part in her first feature.

 

ANTHONY FORD AS DAVE

 

Anthony has been making amateur films purely for fun for 5 years, and is just starting to branch out into professional Film and TV. At Durham University, he got involved in the rich theatre scene and is currently President of the Student Filmmaking Society. He is most noted for playing Mike in the award winning comedy short film Break (2020), and he is looking to act full time once he graduates in July.

 

SHEPSI HAIDER AS CHARLIE

 

Shepsi Haider is an actor from London known for Inner City Rats & Poets are the Destroyers. He is the creator of the Brooklyn Breeze web series and trained at the New York Film Academy in Manhattan.

 

AMANDA DRYDEN WALKER AS DOCTOR EVERGREEN

 

Amanda is proud to be joining the cast of FYTS as Doctor Evergreen. Best known as Molly Costello in Moreland's Firm, Amanda got to work alongside local legends Craig Conway and Stephen Tompkinson. Amanda studied acting at the prestigious ArtsEd London, and has two degrees in Musical Theatre and Performing Arts.

 

IAN LAING AS TREVOR

 

Based in Scotland, Ian is pursuing a later life interest in film and TV opportunities. Success in short films led to Ian securing agent representation and he has subsequently been cast in a number of feature films, commercials and music videos in both lead and supporting roles. He won the Best Actor Award for the short film Today at the 2019 St Andrews Film Festival.

 

ADDISON KEEN AS THE GALLERY HOST

 

Addison has been involved in theatre from a young age and has just recently broken out into film and television. He is gradually increasing his credits/experience both in front of and behind the camera, including co-producing this feature!

 

HAYLEY CORNEY AS JULIE

 

Hayley is a British actress and singer with work concentrated mostly in film and television. She is known to be a friendly, focused, 100% coffee loving, smiley angel of the North!

Hayley's raw talent led her to be cast at her very first audition in 2019 as a lead role for a short film called Quite by Chance, which subsequently won Best Drama at the Royal Television Society Awards (student category) in 2020. More recently, Hayley has been cast as lead roles in two feature films, as well as principal roles in two TV series, various short films, corporate infomercials, as well as student and training productions.

 

LEAH BASKARAN AS SUSAN 

 

Leah has a variety of film and television credits including Coronation Street, The Stranger and Finding Fatimah, as well as working on national and international commercials. She is looking forward to working on a film shot in her home City.

 

ROD GLENN AS PETER

 

Rod is a seasoned television, film and theatre actor. As well as roles in Ripper Street, Emmerdale, Wolfblood and Judge Rinder's Crime Stories, Rod has appeared in films such as American Assassin, The More You Ignore Me, The Hippopotamus and also starred as serial killer Richard in the award-winning psychological horror, Monster. 

Rod’s recent theatre credits include the sell-out Northern drama, The Life of Reilly. Rod is also a writer, with seven published novels, including the best-selling Sinema trilogy.

 

MIA TAYLOR AS DANIELLE

 

Mia has performed in amateur dramatic theatre productions in the North East since 2016 and is currently in her final year of a BA (Hons) degree in Musical Theatre. She is keen to start her acting career in film and television once graduating in 2021, and Finding Your True Self will be her first on-screen role.

 

TYLER GETTINS AS YOUNG JAMES

 

We are also extremely pleased to say we have a rising star amongst our cast, Tyler, who will be playing the younger version of James in a small flashback scene.

Tyler has performed in multiple theatre shows such as High School Musical Junior and also attends the performing arts academy PQA every weekend. This will be his first taste of the film industry.

“I am over the moon to be a part of this film and I'm excited to experience this new adventure.”

 

Who We Are

 

Gabriel Brown - Writer/Director

 

Gabriel is a final year Film and TV Production student at Northumbria University, whose experience ranges from short films to promotional content.

He is currently in the post production stage of a documentary project funded by the Virgin Money Foundation, and works as a Film and TV Assistant at Pauline Quirke Academy Sunderland.

 

Addison Keen - Co-Producer

As well as being part of our cast, Addison is also our co-producer.

Addison wrote and co-produced a short film about anti social behaviour that was part of a showcase at the People's Fair in Prudhoe, and he is currently in his first year at Newcastle University, studying Film Practices. He is in the early stages of producing his next short film.

 

Justina Mitkute - First A.D

Justina is a filmmaker from Lithuania. Her films speak primarily about various social and environmental issues and she is currently working on a doctoral project in Film Practice at Newcastle University. She has previously worked with both Gabriel and Addison on the short film Mick and Rolo.

"I was attracted by the script and I immediately connected with it. I am very happy and excited to be a part of this feature film."

 

Ben Smith - Cinematographer

The founder and owner of Firestone Video, Ben has gained experience through years of work behind the camera.

He was recently DOP for two television show pilots both of which have gained lots of interest from investors, and has also just wrapped a short film he received funding to direct.

 

Paul Martin - Stills Photographer

Paul is a full-time commercial photographer and videographer located in Northumberland, and has recently started his own podcast, The Centre Stage Filmmaker Podcast, where he has interviewed names such as Phil Hawkins, director of the acclaimed Star Wars Origins fan film.

"I’m very excited to work with the great team that has come together to make this film a reality."

See more from Paul here:

https://centrestagephoto.co.uk 

 

Elkie Saint Robson - Soundtrack

We're very pleased to say we have the brilliant Elkie Saint Robson on board, and she'll be providing us with several original songs that will feature in the film! Elkie is originally from Newcastle but is now studying in Leeds, doing a BA degree in songwriting.

"I'm happy to say that I'll be creating some originals for this brilliant movie. Hope you guys all enjoy hearing them as much as I will creating them!"

Listen to some of Elkie's work below!

 

Previous Work

 

To get an idea of the sorts of things Gabriel and Addison have collaborated on in the past, feel free to check out the links below. The stories presented here are very focused on ordinary people going through dramatic events, not unlike the concept of this feature.

 

See other examples of work below, featuring further evidences of Gabriel as a screenwriter and Addison as an actor, and also featuring Hayley too! Again, these works examine dilemmas in a slice of life context.

 

 

Freedom of Speech

For anyone interested in the monologue perks, feel free to check out the playlist of them here! 

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLv_VEIkw...
 

You will also get an IMDb credit as well when joining this project.

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt13373716/

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand it's been a year like no other, and that donating may be tricky. If you would still like to support us in other ways, please go and give our Facebook page a like and our Twitter a follow, and share them with all your friends too!

And more than anything, sharing this campaign is the biggest help you can give us: https://igg.me/at/fytsfilm

https://www.facebook.com/FYTSfilm/ 

https://twitter.com/FYTSfilm

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt13222524/?ref_=nm_... 

Thank you for reading!

See other examples of work below, featuring further evidences of Gabriel as a screenwriter and Addison as an actor, and also featuring Hayley too! Again, these works examine dilemmas in a slice of life context.
 


 


Freedom of Speech
For anyone interested in the monologue perks, feel free to check out the playlist of them here! 
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLv_VEIkw...
 
You will also get an IMDb credit as well when joining this project.
https://www.imdb.com/title/tt13373716/
Other Ways You Can Help
We understand it's been a year like no other, and that donating may be tricky. If you would still like to support us in other ways, please go and give our Facebook page a like and our Twitter a follow, and share them with all your friends too!
And more than anything, sharing this campaign is the biggest help you can give us: https://igg.me/at/fytsfilm
https://www.facebook.com/FYTSfilm/ 
https://twitter.com/FYTSfilm
https://www.imdb.com/title/tt13222524/?ref_=nm_... 
Thank you for reading!

story:
When a closeted photographer in the 1980s discovers her boyfriend plans to propose, she escapes to the early internet to connect with her community for what may be the last time. When she finds a connection that translates into the real world, she must decide if she'll give up the safe life she's established or risk losing herself for good. 

 

 

This is an independent student production, meaning our crew will be covering all expenses from our own pockets. We need to cover location costs and permits, costumes, and food for all cast and crew. We also want to make sure we are able to complete this production safely and within COVID guidelines. Our fundraising goal is $1,900! 

Film budgets can be tricky to follow, so here are some examples of costs and uses on a set:

$12 is a meal for a crew or cast member.

$20 will help pay for production needs throughout the day, like tape, clamps, and extension cords.

$50 will pay for a prop on set.

$100 will cover location permits for one location for a day. We shoot for 3 days. 

$200 will pay for distribution of the film to festivals and short film platforms.

$500 will pay for our locations entirely.

This short is production design intensive. We wanted to create an immersive and authentic experience for our audience. This is why we've budgeted $400 for our Art Department. That includes costumes, makeup and production design elements.

Below is a pie chart with cost breakdown to get a sense of how we will allocate any donations:

 

 

 

Hi all! This is Nadia, the director/producer of Phishing. We are so excited to share this story with you. Phishing finds our protagonist at a major crossroads in her life. It's inspired by real women who pioneered a new form of digital connection through BBS servers, like the one where Cassidy meets Alice, our supporting lead. BBS's were a series of virtual bulletin boards that briefly existed before the dawn of the internet age. It was a dial-up operation that allowed tech savvy youth to interact in ways previously unthinkable. They could be anonymous. They could message each other through an early form of email. They could meet without ever having to leave their homes. When I learned about these servers, I wondered how it must have felt to experience this kind of privacy for the first time. I was curious about the ways it could be utilized to build community and explore identity. 

Luckily for me, nothing on the internet is ever truly lost. I found several archives of lgbt+ women discussing their experiences on these servers. One member in particular described how quickly and fully she and another member fell in love. In her words, it was because they saw each other for who they were before they ever saw one another's faces. Some developed lifelong friendships. Others used the spaces like a private group journal. Conversely, some women stayed anonymous, either closeted, married, or simply curious. These servers provided safe havens for queer women at a time when they were desperately needed. I wanted to tell a story set in this period as a way to highlight this forgotten history. 

Once I knew the story would take place in the early 80s, I set about finding a team to help connect our modern filmmaking practices to some of the iconic techniques and aesthetics popularized in the era. We hope this film will serve as an homage to 1980s queer stories both real and imagined. We'd love to recruit you on our journey to making this possible. Any donation would help.

 

Risks & Challenges

We endeavor to create a COVID safe production environment. While all people involved in the project are fully vaccinated, we are monitoring CDC guidelines for any additional guidance and guidelines. That may mean having to postpone or cancel filming based on the status of the Delta variant and etc. In the event that we do, all donations will be refunded.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Given the state of the world, we understand that donating may not be possible at this time. You can still help by sharing our campaign to your networks. Help spread the word! You can also share our instagram @phishingfilm, where we will be posting some behind-the-scenes and updates about the film as well. Thank you for your support!

story:
About the Film 

Stumblers, is a dramatic comedy short about four high school students from starkly different backgrounds who are brought together under accusations of a threat. Stuck together in a detention room, the four find unlikely common ground as they await their fates. Inspired by The Breakfast Club, this film is sure to leave people invested in each of the characters lives, and what they will do next. 

This film is our senior thesis project and we want to make it as professional as possible. In order to make the film the best it can be we need funding. All funds will go towards equipment rentals, food for cast and crew, location, costumes, props, film festival entries, paying actors, etc. It is crucial that we secure the funds necessary to make this the highest production value possible and really bring the script to life. 

Meet the Team 

 

Jackson Davis (Writer/Director)

Thank you for checking out our project!

My name is Jackson Davis, and I'm Stumblers writer and director!

I am currently a senior at San Diego State University studying Television, Film, and New Media with an emphasis in Production. 

When I first joined the major in the Fall of 2019, I wanted to challenge myself by creating a story that allows people to identify with characters with whom they wouldn’t have expected to identify and see others through a more open, inclusive lens.

The classic movies from the 80’s that so many people love, and that I love, have all white characters.  I want to create a movie in this genre, where all people can see themselves, identifying with both characters who look like them and characters who do not.

Stumblers is a story I hold close to my heart that I’m excited to share with you. 

I really appreciate you taking the time to look into our project. I hope you decide to join us on this journey!

Katie Russell (Producer/Assistant Director) 

Hi! My Name is Katie Russell and I am the producer and assistant director of Stumblers.

I am currently in my senior year at San Diego State University as a Television, Film and New Media Production major. I am a writer/director/producer and am so excited to be working on this project.

Ever since I was little, I have had a passion for the arts. From putting on plays for friends and family to doing school talent shows. I am incredibly honored to be producing and assistant directing. I love bringing stories to life on screen and working with actors, as I believe they are a crucial part of what makes or breaks a film.

I always aim to make and work on films that inspire me, and tell a bigger story than what meets the eye. This film does just that, as it has dynamic characters who are diverse and rarely represented on screen. In my career, I hope to improve representation for those who have been historically left out or misrepresented in Hollywood. This is a great start. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to view our campaign! We can't wait to show you our film!

 

 

Robert Carver (Director of Photography) 

 

 My name is Robert Carver. I am a senior San Diego State University and the Director of Photography for Stumblers. Filmmaking is my passion. Whether it’s films, documentaries, music videos, or videography/editing, I hope to experience the world through this drive I have to express myself visually. I hope to learn more about this world, its people, and myself through these experiences, and in turn become a better version of myself, a better friend/ family member, and a better filmmaker. 

This film is important to me because of its diverse set of main characters. It’s important to have films about diverse main characters and their struggles as those people. Although I feel it’s just as important to have diverse main characters where their struggles don’t directly correlate to their diverse characteristics, as in Stumblers. Also I feel it’s going to be a fun time to watch characters that break stereotypes interact in a way that feels real. This means I’m going to have a lot of fun with the camera as well.

 

What We Need 

We are a group of three extremely passionate film students, who have worked our entire college careers to get to this point. This film is our final piece of work at San Diego State University. All funding comes directly from us, and YOU. 

This film is incredibly important to us because it is about diversity and how under even the most dire circumstances, people can be brought together and find common ground. It is also about adolescence, and how everyone goes through hard times even if they seem like they have it all. Our cast is diverse, and includes characters from different racial and socioeconomic backgrounds and sexual orientations/gender identities. 

Any and all donations make a huge difference as we are all college students and funding this ourselves. If you do not have the means to donate, please consider sharing this campaign with friends and family to spread the word. Regardless, we are beyond excited to make this project come to life, and show it to the world. We plan on entering it in multiple film festivals. 

What You Get 

Our eternal appreciation and thanks. Different perks based on donation amounts ranging from early screenings, to executive producer credits. 

Risks & Challenges

We are all college students, and a very small group. Thus, it is just the three of us contributing to make the film happen. Making films is expensive, especially making great films. We need funding to ensure we can acquire the best talent, crew, equipment etc. We are all very tight on money, and as full time students who all also work when we're not in school, money is hard to come by. It would be a huge help, and relief to have money for this project so we can focus on pre-production planning and production of it without worrying about how we are going to pay for it all. 

Other Ways You Can Help 

Regardless of if you are able to contribute to our campaign monetarily, we ask that you please share this with anyone and everyone you know. The more people that see this, the better the chances of getting the film funded. 

Thank you for visiting our page!

story:
The Filmmakers

Steve Vanderheide and Chad Weber

  • We are two filmmakers who are passionate about telling real stories.
  • We live and work in Northern Colorado.
  • We found a story that is so worth telling, that we were willing to put our own time and money into it.
  • You can view some of our previous work here:
    • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E-EBAPT4W1c
    • http://filmfreerange.com

 

The Documentary

Dreama Walton, the subject of the film, is an ultra-marathon runner, full-time worker and a mom. She has to juggle so much in her schedule to be able to train and compete in races that are as long as 100 miles in under 30 hours. Yes, that's right - 100 miles. Dreama was offered a spot in The Western States 100, the oldest 100-mile race in the world, in Olympic Valley, California.

This story follows her training as she gets ready for Western States, but more importantly, it dives in to the life of Dreama, as we explore her motivation for entering willfully into struggle. Why would somebody ever sign up for something so difficult? What keeps her moving? Who are the people in her life that inspire her to continue running? How is she able to train for something so hard with so many other aspects of regular life seeking her attention?

Our goal is to create an 8-15 minute short documentary, that explores these questions, and culminates in her performance at The Western States 100 race this June 26th, 2021.

 

We Need Your Help

  • We are looking for funding to be able to travel to California and film The Western States 100 Race.
  • In addition to this, any extra funds will go toward additional production and post-production costs so that we can complete the film, as well as helping to cover costs that we have already put into the project.

 

Why Help

Much of Dreama's story pulls from her difficult past, as we talk about how she had to care for herself and her sister who had Spina Bifida. We are interested and moved by the story of how Dreama runs with her sister in mind - someone who was never even able to walk. We also want to tell about how she received so much encouragement from so many strangers over the course of her life, and believe that by donating, you will be helping us help inspire others to do the same.

 

Risks & Challenges

Documentary filmmaking is difficult. You have to be in the right place at the right time, and there is only one opportunity to "get the shot".

  • There will be a lot of logistics planning as we look over the route, to see all the opportunities to film Dreama as she crosses our path during the race.
  • This is a non-stop, 100-mile race, that could take up to 30 hours. This means filming in the heat, filming in the weather, and filming at night. We will need to film in-between naps, and stay alert enough to get coverage of both Dreama, and her crew.
  • Amidst all this, we need to make sure we are getting the "heart" of the story, by spending time only on the worthwhile moments.
  • We will be sticking close to Dreama's crew, both for advice, as well as for covering their part of the story throughout the race.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, we understand. Please help us by:

  • Getting the word out and making some noise about this campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share on social media.

Thank you!

story:
SOME OF THE LATEST NEWS:

 

THE FILM:

After getting dumped by his girlfriend, Bryce quits his job and convinces his best friend Cameron to embark on a road journey that unearths their life callings.

INSPIRATION ROAD is about healing from the trauma of our past, connecting to all of those around us in a meaningful way, appreciating where we've come from, respecting our planet Earth, tasting and awakening to the spiritual -- it's about acceptance, love, serenity, hope, peace and joy in looking towards a brighter future.  

This film is reflective of the times and addresses other personal and culturally relevant topics such as: homophobia, racism, mental health, national and international politics, climate change, life and friendship.

 

SUCCESSFUL TRACK RECORD - WHAT WE'VE ACCOMPLISHED & WHAT WE NEED:

In 2017, we raised just under $30K, and with those funds we shot roughly one third of INSPIRATION ROAD. Our immediate goal now is to raise that same amount in order to shoot the next third of the film in Arizona in August/September 2021. Last year, we raised about $14k, so it is our hope to raise the remaining $16k during this crowd fund! If we surpass this goal, fantastic *stretch goals*, these funds would go towards completing the final portions of INSPIRATION ROAD (2022).

The plan is still to shoot in Arizona, California (and eventually South Dakota), which is very important to the story and unfortunately costs more than shooting in our backyards! "It takes a village," a lot of resources and logistics to make an independent film: Cast, Crew (DP, Sound, Script Supervisor, Grips, Gaffers, PAs, Editors, Colorist, Sound Designer, Mixer, etc.), Locations Fees, Insurance, Equipment (Camera, Lenses, Grip Truck, Dolly, Audio, Drives, etc.), Transportation, Props, Costuming, Food, etc. Plus time, planning, and facilitating during pre-production, production, and post-production. It is and has been a long, on-going process. We couldn't and WE CAN'T DO IT WITHOUT YOU! WE ARE GRATEFUL FOR YOUR SUPPORT! 

 

FILM INVOLVEMENT INCLUDES:

You (Contributing Member) are a credited and an essential contributor to this important project. You have the choice to visit set and be involved in various capacities. 

   

 

Rob Nelson (Writer, Director, Producer, Executive Producer, "Bryce") is a New York and Los Angeles based filmmaker. Most recently he was a Co-Producer on the feature film, WHO ARE YOU PEOPLE, which stars Ema Horvath, Alyssa Milano, Devon Sawa, Yeardley Smith and John Ales. Rob has worked with Sundance-acclaimed producers on the feature film BRAND NEW OLD LOVE, which stars Arturo Castro, Aya Cash, Josh Brener, Mindy Sterling, and Brian Doyle-Murray. He was a producing member on the short film, SCHMOOLIE THE DEATHWATCHER, which won various awards around the US festival circuit. Rob is aligned with a number of other exciting projects, has a focus in partnership development and consults for various producing and creative partners.  

                      

 

Jim Feeney (Contributing Producer, Consulting Editor, "Bar Patron") is a New York City-based television and film editor. He has worked extensively on projects for the History Channel, the Discovery Channel, A&E and National Geographic.

                

 

Mary McGloin (Contributing Producer, Casting Consultant, "Hiker") is an actor and filmmaker based in Brooklyn, New York. She has a MFA from The Shakespeare Theatre’s Academy for Classical Acting at The George Washington University and a BA from UC Santa Barbara and spent time studying with MXAT at Harvard University. She's the main creator of the award-winning web series, Tech Bettys, which is still on the festival circuit. It's a workplace comedy about women in tech based on her many years working in startups as a QA Engineer. As an actor, she is a proud member of SAG-AFTRA and AEA. She has worked Off-Broadway, Off-Off Broadway, and regionally in the the theatre, and in film and television. She was nominated for Best Actress in the Bay Area Critics Circle Awards for her performance of Susan in How the World Began. She is a member of FilmShop. She is co-founder of Goodly Rotten Apple Productions, LLC, which produces film and theatre. marymcgloin.com - techbettys.com

                       

 

Mar Kelly (Co-Executive Producer)  is an Environmental Entrepreneur and Climate Activist. Most recently Mar designed and installed some of the first electrical vehicle charging hubs in New York City and Boston. She pioneered teams and technology for early solar energy projects with large public utilities, major retailers and organic farmers up and down the east coast. She has a Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Science from Rutgers University and a Masters in Conservation Biology from Fordham University. She is proud of her work on an educational project for New York City High Schools with the Wildlife Conservation Society at the Bronx Zoo while a Robert Noyce National Science Foundation Fellow. She was awarded “Solar Projects of the Year” by the Solar Energy Industry Association and featured on the front page of the Wall Street Journal. Her compass is always pointed to Mother Earth and she can be seen at some mountain top every Saturday!

                                 

 

Brendan Fitzgibbons ("Cameron") is an actor, writer, stand-up and host living in New York and Los Angeles. His writing and acting work has been featured on Comedy Central, Full Frontal with Samantha Bee, Girl Code vs. Guy Code, NBC, Vox, HuffPost, the Onion and the Tribeca Film Festival. He’s been featured in several commercials and was named one of “NY’s Funniest!” He also doesn’t vape.

   

 

Meghan Roberts ("Ashley") is an actor and model working in New York and Los Angeles. Her acting work includes roles in How to Get Girls, The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel, Gossip Girl, and Blue Bloods. 

                                  

 

Anthony Abeson ("Neil") has been an acting teacher and acting coach in New York City for over 30 years. His work has been documented in the Emmy award-winning episode of the Bill Moyers PBS series "Creativity," the Ace award-winning Manhattan Cable Television documentary "Chasing Dreams" and the BBC's documentary "Bus and Truck." He has been interviewed on E! Entertainment and Shine Television of England. As an author, Anthony has had articles published in The Village Voice, The Washington Star, The Theatre Paper and, in July 2008, the Outlook Section of The Washington Post. His first book, "Acting 2.0 - Doing Work That Gets Work in a High-Tech World" (Smith & Kraus) was published in 2016. He is currently finishing his second, "'Theatre of Grunt' - How to Get Thrown Out of Missouri in a Hot Second, and Other Stories. Many of his acting students have gone on to LA and successful careers in film and television.

                

 

Jim "Fitz" Fitzpatrick ("Fred") loves working in independent films. In the past year he’s played a high powered boss in "Inspiration Road" (thanks Rob Nelson), the main character of a lonely old geezer in "Who Wants to Live With Barney Johnson, Anyway," a husband with no clue his wife is unhappy in "Luna Maria," and a cranky graveyard attendant in "The Last Trip," to name some favorites. Fitz is no stranger to the stage either having spent nine months traveling this nation doing the first national tour of a Broadway show "State Fair," worked Off-Broadway, and several regional theatres around the country. Thanks for supporting indie films!

                           

 

Mark Keaton ("Nick") - originally hails from Texas, but has been in NYC almost as long as he lived in his home state. He's appeared on stage all over NYC over the years in productions like "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest," "Henry V," and "The Exonerated." He has appeared in film/TV projects like "Wonderstruck," "The Enemy Within," and an upcoming episode (season 21, episode 19) of  "Law and Order: SVU." He truly enjoyed the chance to play this very, uh, interesting character. 

                  

 

Rob Leonard (Music Consultant) covered Johnny Cash's "Won't Back Down" in the project teaser and excels as a "one man band." Rob is multi-instrumental and enjoys guitars, vocals, keys and percussion. His biggest influences range from Classic Rock to Bebop Jazz to Death/Black Metal to Baroque Classical. A Philly native, you can now find Rob in Santa Monica, California. 

        

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

Pass this campaign along! Any and all help is greatly appreciated - so please help spread the word and share INSPIRATION ROAD's campaign! Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Like on Facebook! > INSPIRATION ROAD 

Follow on Instagram! > INSPIRATION ROAD

Your contribution is to society and making OUR WORLD a better place.

Once the film is complete, we plan to submit the film to all the big festivals such as Sundance, Toronto, Tribeca, SXSW, as well as some smaller festivals. We also want to fully explore digital distribution with platforms like Netflix, Hulu, Amazon and/or iTunes. We plan to make a strong push for INSPIRATION ROAD to find a home on one of these sites.

 

ON-GOING CHALLENGES:

My project wouldn't be here if it weren't for those who helped, encouraged and believed in it and in me along the way. Fundraising has been the biggest hurdle in this process (and generally is in independent filmmaking); stretching the dollar and reaching a level necessary to plan, polish, shoot, cut and execute at a professional level. 

We know these times are challenging; however, we feel that INSPIRATION ROAD is uniquely relevant to these times as a hopeful and healing film. So here we are. 

Fortunately, I continue to come across and maintain various team support, in the film industry and out, who are excited for this project and happy to help me see it to completion. If you want to help, participate, intern, volunteer, sponsor or advertise, please email: inspirationroadthemovie@gmail.com

As referenced above, we continue to explore Art Grants and Corporate Sponsorships. 

A VERY SPECIAL THANKS to those who have contributed to the film's journey thus far and to my growth as an artist, a filmmaker and a person - you know who you are... 

***In line with the entire film's content and vision, this production has been and is committed to diversity (BIPOC) in cast and crew. 

"It always seems impossible until it's done." - Nelson Mandela
story_txt: SOME OF THE LATEST NEWS: THE FILM:After getting dumped by his girlfriend, Bryce quits his job and convinces his best friend Cameron to embark on a road journey that unearths their life callings.INSPIRATION ROAD is about healing from the trauma of our past, connecting to all of those around us in a meaningful way, appreciating where we've come from, respecting our planet Earth, tasting and awakening to the spiritual -- it's about acceptance, love, serenity, hope, peace and joy in looking towards a brighter future.  This film is reflective of the times and addresses other personal and culturally relevant topics such as: homophobia, racism, mental health, national and international politics, climate change, life and friendship. SUCCESSFUL TRACK RECORD - WHAT WE'VE ACCOMPLISHED & WHAT WE NEED:In 2017, we raised just under $30K, and with those funds we shot roughly one third of INSPIRATION ROAD. Our immediate goal now is to raise that same amount in order to shoot the next third of the film in Arizona in August/September 2021. Last year, we raised about $14k, so it is our hope to raise the remaining $16k during this crowd fund! If we surpass this goal, fantastic *stretch goals*, these funds would go towards completing the final portions of INSPIRATION ROAD (2022).The plan is still to shoot in Arizona, California (and eventually South Dakota), which is very important to the story and unfortunately costs more than shooting in our backyards! "It takes a village," a lot of resources and logistics to make an independent film: Cast, Crew (DP, Sound, Script Supervisor, Grips, Gaffers, PAs, Editors, Colorist, Sound Designer, Mixer, etc.), Locations Fees, Insurance, Equipment (Camera, Lenses, Grip Truck, Dolly, Audio, Drives, etc.), Transportation, Props, Costuming, Food, etc. Plus time, planning, and facilitating during pre-production, production, and post-production. It is and has been a long, on-going process. We couldn't and WE CAN'T DO IT WITHOUT YOU! WE ARE GRATEFUL FOR YOUR SUPPORT!  FILM INVOLVEMENT INCLUDES:You (Contributing Member) are a credited and an essential contributor to this important project. You have the choice to visit set and be involved in various capacities.     Rob Nelson (Writer, Director, Producer, Executive Producer, "Bryce") is a New York and Los Angeles based filmmaker. Most recently he was a Co-Producer on the feature film, WHO ARE YOU PEOPLE, which stars Ema Horvath, Alyssa Milano, Devon Sawa, Yeardley Smith and John Ales. Rob has worked with Sundance-acclaimed producers on the feature film BRAND NEW OLD LOVE, which stars Arturo Castro, Aya Cash, Josh Brener, Mindy Sterling, and Brian Doyle-Murray. He was a producing member on the short film, SCHMOOLIE THE DEATHWATCHER, which won various awards around the US festival circuit. Rob is aligned with a number of other exciting projects, has a focus in partnership development and consults for various producing and creative partners.                         Jim Feeney (Contributing Producer, Consulting Editor, "Bar Patron") is a New York City-based television and film editor. He has worked extensively on projects for the History Channel, the Discovery Channel, A&E and National Geographic.                 Mary McGloin (Contributing Producer, Casting Consultant, "Hiker") is an actor and filmmaker based in Brooklyn, New York. She has a MFA from The Shakespeare Theatre’s Academy for Classical Acting at The George Washington University and a BA from UC Santa Barbara and spent time studying with MXAT at Harvard University. She's the main creator of the award-winning web series, Tech Bettys, which is still on the festival circuit. It's a workplace comedy about women in tech based on her many years working in startups as a QA Engineer. As an actor, she is a proud member of SAG-AFTRA and AEA. She has worked Off-Broadway, Off-Off Broadway, and regionally in the the theatre, and in film and television. She was nominated for Best Actress in the Bay Area Critics Circle Awards for her performance of Susan in How the World Began. She is a member of FilmShop. She is co-founder of Goodly Rotten Apple Productions, LLC, which produces film and theatre. marymcgloin.com - techbettys.com                        Mar Kelly (Co-Executive Producer)  is an Environmental Entrepreneur and Climate Activist. Most recently Mar designed and installed some of the first electrical vehicle charging hubs in New York City and Boston. She pioneered teams and technology for early solar energy projects with large public utilities, major retailers and organic farmers up and down the east coast. She has a Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Science from Rutgers University and a Masters in Conservation Biology from Fordham University. She is proud of her work on an educational project for New York City High Schools with the Wildlife Conservation Society at the Bronx Zoo while a Robert Noyce National Science Foundation Fellow. She was awarded “Solar Projects of the Year” by the Solar Energy Industry Association and featured on the front page of the Wall Street Journal. Her compass is always pointed to Mother Earth and she can be seen at some mountain top every Saturday!                                  Brendan Fitzgibbons ("Cameron") is an actor, writer, stand-up and host living in New York and Los Angeles. His writing and acting work has been featured on Comedy Central, Full Frontal with Samantha Bee, Girl Code vs. Guy Code, NBC, Vox, HuffPost, the Onion and the Tribeca Film Festival. He’s been featured in several commercials and was named one of “NY’s Funniest!” He also doesn’t vape.    Meghan Roberts ("Ashley") is an actor and model working in New York and Los Angeles. He has been interviewed on E! Entertainment and Shine Television of England.
