story:
Short Summary

This is to help with an independent film that is planned for filming starting late September to December 2020. The movie is during the year 2050 when pollution, radiation and virus are rampant all over the world, and people needs to live with masks covering their faces. This story is about a serial killer is on the lose and the detectives need to catch the killer before it's too late. But they somehow ventured into a world of sorcery and witchcraft.

We opted to film this in Fall/Winter season as it helps increase production value for the film as well as having something for everyone to do during this slow seasons. We will be filming with at least 4 cameras (BMPCC4K and GH5, all using their highest quality standard) and breaking into different units. As this film's story evolves at evenings and night time, we opted to use mostly the Sirui's Anamorphic lenses.

Our crew for this project has been considered the all star members within the Cleveland/Akron film community while our Cast are seasonal veterans and we believed they will bring the story to life.

We have had very successful crowdfunding campaigns in the past and have also made several feature films that got distributions worldwide, our current feature film Wu Xia 2 The Code is now being distributed starting September 1st as Immortal Combat The Code by High Octane Picture,  it has been screen at many film festivals as well as being the recipient of Best Action Feature Film at the 2020 Indie Gathering and Film Festival, here's the current trailer for Immortal Combat the Code:

 

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution would help us on the following:

  • As we will be filming all over Ohio and our cast/crew are from all parts of Cleveland/Akron even Columbus areas, we would love to provide some stipend to cover their gas during our weekends filming.
  • Additional monies will be used to purchase meals for cast/crew during production
  • Some portable warmers and heating pads and wardrobe for the cast.

The Impact and Concern

We understand while living in the current pandemic world, film productions are needed to adapt and increase safety precautions to make sure all members of the project is protected and safe.

As an no/low budget independent filmmaker, me and my team have been championing production safety. It is our number one priority in the past and continued to be so now. We have created a detailed safety guidelines as well as having  a national pandemic team representative as part of our crew. We are also, perhaps, the first in Ohio's independent filmmakers that will include various type of face masks, face shields and others to be part of the set where cast will be wearing them as part of the story, while it may limit their facial expression, but it would be also a welcoming challenge that they've accepted to demonstrate how talented they are. Of course, we will follow CDC and State's recommendation and suggestions and constantly adapt as needed. While we can not guaranteed everyone would be 100% safe, like everything in life, there is always risk involved, and here, we are doing our best to make sure everyone's safety is our priority.

Suffice to say: We will do as much as we can to make sure everyone on set is safe and protected. While creating an opportunity for us to express our vision and creativity to make a compelling feature film.

Risks & Challenges

As this is a crowdfunding, there always risk involved, however, we will keep it as minimal, and perhaps the worst it may happen is that due to CDC and State's Mandate, we may have to push it to 2021. As of now, we are still planned ahead.

Your contribution will help us finish our production that you will be proud of.

Other Ways You Can Help

Understanding that we are right now in world where financial contribution can be hard, we would love that you can help share this project to your friends and family and ask them to consider supporting this independent film. Become our champion and help spread the words.

Some of the talented award winning Crew helping with this project:

Johnny K. Wu. A native Clevelander raised in Central America, Johnny Wu is, a veteran award-winning producer with an MBA (from Cleveland State University) specialization in branding. Fluent in Chinese, Spanish and English, Johnny is well known and respected within the Asian Pacific American community in Ohio, he is one of the co-founder of the Cleveland Asian Festival, as well as recognized by ethnic cultural groups as the Producer for Cleveland Cultural Gardens’ One World Day since 2015.  Wu is one of the few pioneers in engaging talents/skills in Cleveland’s independent filmmakers’ industry. In October 2003, he founded the monthly Cleveland IndieClub to provide a voice for local visual artists to showcase their work and visions, IndieClub was a national movement with meet up at numerous cities, Cleveland is now the oldest running group.  Owner of Media Design Imaging (mdifilm.com), Johnny has been working providing video and event producing to corporates and independent filmmaking community since 1998. He also has numerous feature films successful distributed worldwide since 2005. He has given workshops and talk about filmmaking, marketing, producing and distribution at several conventions including Wizard World Cleveland for the last 5 years, Horror Hotel Film Festival and Convention (since its inception), IndieGathering Film Festival and Convention for over 10 years, and at CES and NAB in Las Vegas. Recently due to the Covid-19 restrictions, he has started a weekly live chat interview with filmmakers on his YouTube channel.  In his spare time, he loves to watch movies, eat different cuisines and sleep.  Wu currently sits as an executive board member of St. Clair Superior Development Corp, member of the International Task Force for Cleveland Museum of Art, WKYC Community Council Member, City of Cleveland Consumer Affairs Community Board, VP of Organizations Relation for OCA Cleveland Chapter, to name a few. He is an inductee to two Martial Arts Hall of Fames, and an inductee of the International Indie Filmmakers Hall of Fame.

Jason L. Wang, a break dancer turned classical ballet, was raised in Iowa where he began his artistic journey. During his professional career he appeared on stage with the Cincinnati Ballet, Louisville Ballet, Cleveland Ballet, and North Pointe Ballet. When not on the dance stage, he brings his years of training and dance philosophies to the film set where he works as a director, editor, and actor. He most enjoys working on action films, where he gets a chance to merge his dance into his stunts. Jason has been the cinematographer for many independent films like Keith Collins II's Assassin's Game (coming out June 16), and Immortal Combat The Code (coming out in Fall/Winter). Jason's first feature film, PROJECT E.1337: ALPHA, is currently distributed worldwide. Jason also started a youtube channel TL:DR Filmmaker that has garnered a lot of attention and viewers, an expert on many gears and its usage.

Shawn Adams. An incredible upcoming gimbal/steadycam operator and director of photography. Shawn will once again co-DP with Jason Wang for this movie. Previously worked on numerous short and feature films which many of them won many awards. He will bring his expertise to help make Wu Lin a success like before.

Keith Collins II. Keith has been in the martial arts all his life. From the age of 3, he trained under his Sensei and Father, Keith Collins I, in the art of Kenpo. After receiving his black belt, he also studied other styles ranging from Krav Maga to Silat believing that all martial art styles have something to offer. As a filmmaker, stunt coordinator and Fight choreographer, he has filmmaking achievements including, The Indie Gathering International film festival’s Best Micro Action Film 2012, 2013 & 2015. Best Action Short at Urban Action Showcase 2015 and multiple Film Festival official selections. And his award winning Film, Lions & Wolves, premiered on the national channel, El Rey Network. Keith's fight choreography is featured in Contracts: Redemption, T.R.A.C.E a Doctor Who Fan film, Wu Xia: A Martial Arts Tango, Project E.1337, Innerself and Wu Xia 2: the Code (to be released as Immortal Combat The Code in late Summer). His first feature film, "Assassin's Game" AKA “Maximillian” now available  stores.

Ron George, an independent special effects Makeup artist that caters towards professional work for the entertainment industry. Creating iconic looks for film, television, theater, museums, performance art, Music Videos and everything in between. Ron specialize in the darker side like Zombies, Gore, cuts, & bruises as well as Sci-Fi and cosplay using mainly practical FX. Ron is currently the producer of Cleveland 48hrs Film Project.

Aryavarta Kumar: Cleveland based composer Aryavarta Kumar (Arya) writes music for independent films, TV, commercials, radio, computer games, and other media. He started writing for film in 2002 and has expanded both his study and his passion for music since that time. Arya also plays live performance improvisations for events and has performed at weddings, festivals, and venues such as PlayHouse Square in downtown Cleveland. Over the course of several years, Arya explored different types of music and working in several bands in high school. At the same time he became fascinated with how music can influence a person's mood on a deeper level. During different travel experiences, he started learning different musical instruments and incorporated ethnic elements into his music. It was during this time, that he also became interested in science and medicine and ultimately graduated from medical school. Arya is also an entrepreneur and started a few companies. Music however has always been a passion for him and he has continued to pursue writing music. Starting in 2005, Arya scored A Joker's Card, a project which won a Silver Telly at the time and has won him acclaim from the independent film community. Arya went on to score several different shorts and features providing diverse music ranging from orchestral to a guitar driven heavier sound. His success has allowed him to assist projects with music supervisor placements as well. His most recent credits include Project E1337A, Wu Xia 2 for music composition and Maximillian for music supervision.

Scollard Reinhardt began supporting the performing arts with opera and stage in Cleveland, Ohio. From there he moved to Miami, Florida and then on to touring nationally with musical acts out of Dallas, Texas and children's theater out of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. He returned to northeast Ohio and continued to bring his expertise to community theaters throughout the region. Family interest in film brought new opportunities including feature films by Johnny K. Wu and Keith Collins III, and short films with Bernard Adams’s 48-hour crew, Misfit Toys. Scollard truly enjoys applying his unique skillsets and talent to supporting the creative creatively.

Todd Metzendorf, currently senior paramedic team member with a federal disaster medical assistance, also ohio homeland security deputy intelligence coordinator, and currently the Deputy Liaison Officer for Trumbull Counties Emergency Operations Center for the Covid 19. Todd has been a Firefighter / Paramedic since 1993.  Since 2006 he has been providing safety and medical on the sets of full features and shorts a like.  He has worked with multiple producers / directors and become friends with many of the local talent. 

Nick Muhlbach. Nick is extremely excited to be involved with his next MDI project, A graduate of Cleveland State University, he has also been taught countless skills by Johnny Wu. Nick has worked on countless projects with MDI, as well has ventured forward to making many short films,  as well as feature film directorial debut a shattered diamond, as a part of troubadour films. No stranger to assistant directing, with films like Parker and Rumble TV, Nick is excited to work with the extremely talented cast and crew of Wu Lin!

Terry Giancaterino. Having been in over 50 projects, both in front and behind the camera, Terry brings over 20 years of experience from short films to full length features, from television to the big screen. Being a martial artist since his 20’s, Terry is also credited for numerous stunts, stunt choreography and supervision, and was awarded Best Action Short Film at the New York International Independent Film & Video Festival. Terry has been the Assistant Director for Wu's previous film Immortal Combat the Code and has been one of the key trusted friend.

Dr. Scott E. Brosius, MBA, is veteran filmmaker with 20 years of filmmaking experience. He has Produced and Directed: 3 feature films, 54 short films not including 26 - 48 Hour Film Project films totaling 80 short films under his direction. His films have been accepted at 43 different film festivals, internationally, and have won over 37 different awards, including best film, best director, and best cinematography. Scott is also a highly experienced Director of Photography, Editor, Sound Engineer, and Colorist with over 20 years of experience under his belt. Over the years, Scott has acted in several films of his own and of other film makers, and has been nominated for best actor at 5 different festivals for 4 different films.

Scott T. Morrison graduated from the Florida Institute of Technology (Florida Tech) in 1983 with a triple major in Management Science, Marketing and Computer Science. He has had extensive experience in all aspects of portrait, architectural and fine art photography. He also attended continuing education programs at Rocky Mountain School of Photography, The Nikon School of Photography, The Cleveland Institute of Art, and EPIC. In 1991 he started his own business, Discovery Photo located in Beachwood, Ohio. Scott has been published locally, nationally, and internationally in magazines such as Outdoor Photographer, Evidence Technology , Properties, RPM, Beachwood Buzz, and, Surreal Beauty Magazine. Dozens of his prints, featuring stunningly vivid landscapes and visceral wildlife, appear in galleries across America, including The Cleveland Museum of Art. Discovery Photo specializes in fun, unique and creative portraits. We do everything from basic head shots to full portfolios. We have a state of the art studio located in Beachwood, Ohio. Cleveland is full of a wide variety of locations from beaches to urban. We are willing to go the extra mile to get the perfect shot. When he’s not working, Scott, his wife Liz and their two children, Daniel and Amanda, travel the countryside in style in their travel trailer. His two favorite places in the world are Glaciers National Park in Montana and Arches National Park in Utah. Scott enjoys driving his classic 1964 Dodge convertible. He also enjoys making craft beers

Mike Oradini has been an important member of White Midnight Films crew and has shown his talent by being able to provide and facilitate many props for Cleveland independent films. He also owner of Junk Monkey, where held more than a warehouse full of props and items that are needed for anyone (film or not film related).

and many others.

Talented Cast

We have many talented cast for the project, and you can check out their profiles from our FaceBook fan page at https://www.facebook.com/wulinthemovie
story_txt:
Short Summary
This is to help with an independent film that is planned for filming starting late September to December 2020. The movie is during the year 2050 when pollution, radiation and virus are rampant all over the world, and people needs to live with masks covering their faces. This story is about a serial killer is on the lose and the detectives need to catch the killer before it's too late. But they somehow ventured into a world of sorcery and witchcraft.
We opted to film this in Fall/Winter season as it helps increase production value for the film as well as having something for everyone to do during this slow seasons. We will be filming with at least 4 cameras (BMPCC4K and GH5, all using their highest quality standard) and breaking into different units. As this film's story evolves at evenings and night time, we opted to use mostly the Sirui's Anamorphic lenses.
Our crew for this project has been considered the all star members within the Cleveland/Akron film community while our Cast are seasonal veterans and we believed they will bring the story to life.
We have had very successful crowdfunding campaigns in the past and have also made several feature films that got distributions worldwide, our current feature film Wu Xia 2 The Code is now being distributed starting September 1st as Immortal Combat The Code by High Octane Picture,  it has been screen at many film festivals as well as being the recipient of Best Action Feature Film at the 2020 Indie Gathering and Film Festival, here's the current trailer for Immortal Combat the Code:

 

What We Need & What You Get
Your contribution would help us on the following:

As we will be filming all over Ohio and our cast/crew are from all parts of Cleveland/Akron even Columbus areas, we would love to provide some stipend to cover their gas during our weekends filming.
Additional monies will be used to purchase meals for cast/crew during production
Some portable warmers and heating pads and wardrobe for the cast.


The Impact and Concern
We understand while living in the current pandemic world, film productions are needed to adapt and increase safety precautions to make sure all members of the project is protected and safe.
As an no/low budget independent filmmaker, me and my team have been championing production safety. It is our number one priority in the past and continued to be so now. We have created a detailed safety guidelines as well as having  a national pandemic team representative as part of our crew. We are also, perhaps, the first in Ohio's independent filmmakers that will include various type of face masks, face shields and others to be part of the set where cast will be wearing them as part of the story, while it may limit their facial expression, but it would be also a welcoming challenge that they've accepted to demonstrate how talented they are. Of course, we will follow CDC and State's recommendation and suggestions and constantly adapt as needed. While we can not guaranteed everyone would be 100% safe, like everything in life, there is always risk involved, and here, we are doing our best to make sure everyone's safety is our priority.
Suffice to say: We will do as much as we can to make sure everyone on set is safe and protected. While creating an opportunity for us to express our vision and creativity to make a compelling feature film. 

Risks & Challenges
As this is a crowdfunding, there always risk involved, however, we will keep it as minimal, and perhaps the worst it may happen is that due to CDC and State's Mandate, we may have to push it to 2021. As of now, we are still planned ahead.
Your contribution will help us finish our production that you will be proud of.

Other Ways You Can Help
Understanding that we are right now in world where financial contribution can be hard, we would love that you can help share this project to your friends and family and ask them to consider supporting this independent film. Become our champion and help spread the words.

story:
The Mixtape: A Live Comedy Concert Film

My name is Taylor Moorey, and I am a comedian, writer, and musician based in Vancouver, Canada.

LINE-UP: Alisha Dhillon, Amanda Smith, Amber Harper-Young, Ed Konyha, Jake Spencer,  K.C. Novak, Kevin von Helvete, Kwasi Thomas, Robert Peng, Taylor Moorey

TICKETS: https://admitone.com/events/mixtape-vancouver-7...

Facebook event: https://fb.me/e/C9YUDRJ5

NEW: ANY DONOR WHO DONATES $50 OR MORE WILL BE GIVEN ONE FREE TICKET!

The Mixtape shoots November 19, live at the Biltmore Cabaret in Vancouver, British Columbia, and my aim with this project is to make an event out of a comedy special, in a time when every conceivable piece of art and entertainment is so ubiquitous as to be made boring among the ever-growing double-edged sword of streaming services. To that end, this live stand-up special will be part documentary on the challenges, hills, and valleys of independent comedy and art in Canada, and featuring some of Vancouver's top rising comedians. It will then be submitted to film festivals and theaters to bring this to a wide audience.

What We Need & What You Get

The total budget of this project is a modest $6, 500, including perk production costs. This pays for every facet including venue rental, security, comedians, our skeleton crew, gear rental, original music, film festival submissions, as well as merchandise production for Indiegogo perks, and more. Here is the full breakdown of costs:

SHOW COSTS: $5000
Venue and security: $1100
Gear Rental: $1000
Comedians: $1650
Crew: $400
Original Music: $200
Advertising: $250
Film Festival Submissions: $400(x8)

Perk production is a huge variable, as items will be printed as needed, but each item has been priced to pay for its production, along with contributing to the project. Including Indiegogo's platform, transaction, and transfer fees, there is <$1000 buffer for merchandise production.

If we go over any amount (in which case, oh my god, thank you), all money will go back into the project. If we fail to raise the full amount, we will go ahead with whatever we have, priority going to pay comics and crew. Here is a breakdown of bonus costs:

$6500-$8000 - these funds will go towards paying for a professional to mix and master the audio
>$8000 - these funds will towards paying a professional for colour correction
>$10 000 - these funds will go towards my inevitable hospital bills from glee-induced cardiac arrest (just kidding; bonuses for comedians and crew, and whatever else we can do to make this show better).

The Impact

Over the last year, everyone has lost so much, and had to conquer deeply disturbing hurdles - artists among them. In Vancouver, live stand-up comedy has suffered a lot - clubs have closed, businesses were lost, careers put on pause, or on the verge of imploding. And while music can be practised, mastered, recorded, and sold in a home studio, stand-up comedy, by its very nature, cannot. By contributing to this project, you are lending credence and legitimacy to aspiring professionals.

But perhaps more relevant than that, The Mixtape seeks to be a document in an ongoing battle within Canada. The Canadian arts sector is anemic, and sadly, has been for a long, long time. Our media is dominated by the US, and we lose a lot of our talent to them, understandably. More frustratingly, it is kept anemic by the government and large, risk-averse telecommunications corporations that monopolize the kind of media, art and performances that Canadians get to see, and interfere with or water down the creative goals. Whereas American entertainment is a blank slate, Canadian performing arts is kneecapped by the mandate: "Uniquely Canadian". Lastly, stand-up comedy is not considered a legitimate art form (by many), but most troublingly by the Canadian government. Therefore, this eliminates the ability to receive grants and other funding, as well as facing a confusing and extremely costly process in trying to get any work in the US while remaining a Canadian citizen. While the CASC (Canadian Associating of Stand-Up Comedians) has done amazing work in this direction, there is ever an uphill battle.

Risks & Challenges

Any positive response to this campaign and movie are more than overwhelming for me, and I realize that despite having an amazing team of people with me, this is a lot of work I have never done before, and there are a lot of hurdles, but we will face them and rise to the challenge. I've never dealt with such a hurry-up-and-wait situation before, so let's also see the toll it takes on my mental health!

Other Ways You Can Help

Money and time and resources are tight for everyone right now, so no sweat if you can't contribute. But if you could help share this with friends and family, that would be massively appreciated. To anyone who cares, I thank you from the bottom of my heart.

 

A quick note about perks: Any physical merchandise (posters, stickers, shirts) is expected to be fulfilled in October. Once the campaign ends, orders will be placed, and will be sent out as soon as possible.
Thank-yous and roasts will be fulfilled by the end of September.
Any film elements (completed cut, BTS material, stills, etc.) will be fulfilled April of next year, as I will need a few months to edit.

Our media is dominated by the US, and we lose a lot of our talent to them, understandably. More frustratingly, it is kept anemic by the government and large, risk-averse telecommunications corporations that monopolize the kind of media, art and performances that Canadians get to see, and interfere with or water down the creative goals. Whereas American entertainment is a blank slate, Canadian performing arts is kneecapped by the mandate: "Uniquely Canadian". Lastly, stand-up comedy is not considered a legitimate art form (by many), but most troublingly by the Canadian government. Therefore, this eliminates the ability to receive grants and other funding, as well as facing a confusing and extremely costly process in trying to get any work in the US while remaining a Canadian citizen. While the CASC (Canadian Associating of Stand-Up Comedians) has done amazing work in this direction, there is ever an uphill battle.

Risks & Challenges
Any positive response to this campaign and movie are more than overwhelming for me, and I realize that despite having an amazing team of people with me, this is a lot of work I have never done before, and there are a lot of hurdles, but we will face them and rise to the challenge. I've never dealt with such a hurry-up-and-wait situation before, so let's also see the toll it takes on my mental health!

Other Ways You Can Help
Money and time and resources are tight for everyone right now, so no sweat if you can't contribute. But if you could help share this with friends and family, that would be massively appreciated. To anyone who cares, I thank you from the bottom of my heart.
 
A quick note about perks: Any physical merchandise (posters, stickers, shirts) is expected to be fulfilled in October. Once the campaign ends, orders will be placed, and will be sent out as soon as possible.Thank-yous and roasts will be fulfilled by the end of September.Any film elements (completed cut, BTS material, stills, etc.) will be fulfilled April of next year, as I will need a few months to edit.

story:
Logline:

Zeph, a young black teenager on the cusp of adulthood, navigates the pitfalls of following his heart or denying who he is for the sake of others.

Image Credit: Arrideo on Shutterstock.

The Story:

Solitude is a narrative short following the struggle of a black LGBTQ+ youth named Zeph who is for the first time beginning to explore his identity and sexual orientation, while battling the homophobic social and cultural attitudes from within his own family.

Director Statement:

This project began as a meditation on masculinity and the internalization of homophobia within the black community. Issues intersecting Black and LGBTQ identity are close to my heart. Furthermore, this project also serves as a safe space for myself as an artist to examine aspects of my own gender and sexual identity. In doing so my intention is to facilitate dialogue on the experiences of queer black youth. I aim to bring visibility and awareness to how these threats often begin within our own homes.

What We're Seeking:

We have an amazing crew of very talented filmmakers. Because we are student filmmakers this production has been tailored to specifically account for affordable locations and equipment. The following is a breakdown of our budget to show how your contribution will be used. We would be immensely grateful if you would consider donating any amount to our project!

Others Ways You Can Help:

While we are doing everything within our power to spread word of this project amongst our networks, you can help boost its reach by sharing it with your family, friends, and individuals who you know that could relate to this story. It is our goal to spread the message of this film to as large an audience as possible and we can make that goal a reality with your help!

Strapped for cash? Trust us, we get it! We're student filmmakers after all. You can follow us on IG @Solitudefilm_ or on Facebook @Solitudefilm, as well as share this campaign on your social media pages.

Our Team:

Knial Saunders – Writer & Director

Knial Saunders is an award-winning writer and director who utilizes intimate coming-of-age storytelling as a vehicle to explore the intricacies of personal growth, impermanence, and self-acceptance. He is an alumnus of Howard University in Washington, D.C. where he obtained a Bachelor of Arts degree in TV & Film Production as well as a minor in photography. He is presently based in Los Angeles, CA where he is a second-year student in the USC School of Cinematic Arts, where he pursues an M.F.A. in Film Production.

Arden Sarner – Producer

Arden is currently pursuing her master’s degree at USC’s School of Cinematic Arts with a focus on producing and sound. Before coming to USC, she worked as a food videographer for Spoon University, creating recipe videos that received over 275 million views across social media platforms. Arden graduated from Duke University in 2016, Summa Cum Laude, Phi Beta Kappa, with a BA in Visual and Media Studies.

 

Bei “Beila” Lameng – Producer

A producer and writer. Bei graduated from Peking University School of Art. Before attending film school, she has focused on writing for more than ten years and has published pieces of short fiction. This diversified artistic background gives her a passion for storytelling and the motivation to bring these stories to the screen. In the journey of USC film school, she has produced dozens of short films ranging from sci-fi to documentaries and is exploring more possibilities.

 

Courtney Simpson – Producer

Courtney Simpson is a dedicated professional with 5 years of experience in film and television production. After graduating from the University of California Santa Barbara, she dived into children's animation, scripted film, and documentary production working directly with academy award-winning producers and directors. She has been an assistant director on award-winning short films, and whenever she's not working behind-the-scenes on set, she is a performer on camera and on stage as an actress, singer, dancer, and model. Being knowledgeable in both office and on-set production needs for a film and television series, allows her to be a versatile producer.  

 

Daniel Matsumoto – Director of Photography

Originally from the Big Island of Hawai’i, Daniel K. Matsumoto is a camera nerd turned cinematographer currently attending graduate school at the University of Southern California. While initially focused on digital cameras and photography, a chance introduction to 16mm film solidified Daniel’s love for storytelling through moving and organic images. Whether shooting film or digital, Daniel prioritizes bringing a feeling of warmth and liveliness to the projects he shoots.

 

Cecily Lo – Choreographer

Cecily Lo is a Taiwanese-American video artist, editor, and experimental filmmaker originally from Washington, DC. Her surrealist moving image-based work is heavily informed by two decades of dance training and choreographic experience, while her distinctive—and often aggressive—editing style comes from a lifelong love of punk rock. 

Cecily graduated cum laude with a B.S. in Computer Science from Tufts University’s School of Engineering in 2017, but ultimately found her calling through video editing and visual effects. Since then, she has created commercial video content for HBO, Showtime, and several Broadway musicals. She currently lives and works in Los Angeles, while pursuing an MFA in Film & Television Production at USC's School of Cinematic Arts as a recipient of the Samuel and Lorenza Gary Memorial Award. 

 

Amelia Allen - Composer

Amelia is a Canadian multimedia composer and songwriter based out of both Calgary, Canada & Los Angeles. She is a 2020 graduate from the prestigious Screen Scoring Master's program at the University of Southern California & also holds an undergraduate degree in Mechanical Engineering. Amelia has worked in a variety of genres and media types including film, TV, and video games and most recently has worked & studied under Emmy-winning composer Laura Karpman (Marvel’s ‘What If?’, HBO’s “Lovecraft Country”). Amelia's technical educational background paired with her roots in songwriting lend to her experimental voice and strong sense of melody present in her music.

 

Terah Kim - Production Designer

2 year old from Southern California. A graduate from the Entertainment Set Design and Decoration program at FIDM. Pursing a career in the art department world of film.

story:
As graduating RTA Media Production students, our Thesis film is something we look forward to throughout the four years of our program. A chance to create a project we’re truly passionate about and assert our voices as artists and storytellers. The COVID-19 pandemic has completely turned the last year of our program upside down, forcing us all to adapt to collaborating virtually with the rest of the world. 

Despite these challenges, we’ve spent the last 7 months in pre-production (100% virtually) for this film, writing and creating a nearly 700-page bible that includes schedules, budgets, storyboards, mood boards, costume & set designs and much more. We begin production in September 2021 and plan to release the film in March of 2022, but we cannot do it without your help.

To make our vision a reality, we’re asking you to join us in putting all these plans into action to create this refreshing and poignant coming-of-age film.

 

"Last Home, First Love"

 

Weeks before ageing out of the foster care system, 17-year old Kay falls into an electric friendship with Olivia, transforming the way they see themselves and their future. 

Dandelion Green is a coming-of-age short film that explores the friendship of two foster teens, who meet while placed in the same Toronto home. Kay, a non-binary, guarded teen, is weeks away from ageing out of the system. Olivia, a 16-year-old budding artist, acts as a support system for her mother, who suffers from mental illness. 

When the two teens meet, they are instantly drawn to each other, and bond over their shared experiences in the foster care system. As Kay’s impending 18th birthday approaches, and as Olivia’s mother’s health improves, both teens are forced to make a difficult decision. 

Inspired by the resilient stories of foster kids and our own friendships growing up, the film will challenge the idea of what family and ‘romantic’ relationships look like.

Toronto’s Little Italy and Annex neighbourhoods serve as the romantic backdrop to this intimate exploration of queer friendship, growing up, and the idea of ‘home’. 

 

Babyteeth Productions is a passionate group of Ryerson University Media Production students who specialize in a variety of roles within the film industry. Based out of Toronto, we are committed to creating visual products for Gen Z’s that inspire empathy and centre the lived experiences of underrepresented identities. We aim to highlight queer voices and center characters from diverse backgrounds. 

We are passionate about bringing this story to life, but we can’t do it without your help.

For this campaign, we will be raising $6500. With an overall budget of $13,000, with our IndieGoGo Campaign we hope to utilize your donations to cover the following costs:

  • Camera, audio, electrical, and lighting equipment
  • Craft services and catering to feed our hardworking cast and crew
  • A professional animator to bring our vision to life
  • Location rental costs

 

 

As a thank you for your support of our campaign, we have decided to create exclusive Dandelion Green merchandise! With a donation under the rewards panel, you could receive items such as a hand-embroidered shirt or tote, or an exclusive sticker or pin pack. Upon further development of the film, we will also be designing colouring books with hand-drawn designs directly from the short's animation and imagery, and the film's official poster. 

We are so lucky to have so many wonderful artists on our team who have worked tirelessly to create beautiful designs for you to wear and own with pride :)

 

Over 12,000 minors are in foster care in Ontario (Canadian Child Welfare Research Portal), and according to studies, LGBTQ+ youth are at a higher risk of experiencing abuse and mental illness while in the system (Youth.Gov). Foster kids are all around us, but their stories are rarely told. With Dandelion Green, we aim to explore the stories of foster kids respectively, in order to give them a voice. Our goal is for youth in foster care to see Dandelion Green and recognize pieces of themselves on screen.

When we see people that remind us of ourselves represented in the media, we feel more confident in our identities. By placing queer foster kids at the heart of this story, we aim to provide that representation. Kay and Olivia’s individual queer identities are not the driving forces of the film, as we believe that it’s important that stories about queer characters go beyond the traditional coming-out narrative. Just as their experiences in the foster care system do not define them, neither do their queer identities. They are simply one aspect of their evolving identities, explored in this coming-of-age story.

Dandelion Green is a teenage exploration of home, growing up, and the unexpected ways your friends shape you. In this short coming-of-age film, we hope to accomplish certain goals.

  • Firstly, we aim to paint a bittersweet and true-to-life picture of youth in foster care, capturing their resilience through hardships, and hopefulness about the future.
  • With our two leads, Kay and Olivia, we aim to center queer characters in a storyline that does not revolve around their Queerness.
  • Through the portrayal of their relationship, we hope to gracefully capture the intimacy and honesty in a platonic friendship, where both parties respect and understand each other in unique ways.
  • Visually, our goal is to allow the animated and live-action scenes to be seamlessly intertwined, creating a genre-bending story scape.
  • Finally, we aim to tell a refreshing coming of age story, giving a voice to those who have not been allowed one in the past.

At the moment, our biggest risk and challenge is the Covid-19 Pandemic. With safety at the highest priority level, we are determined to keep our cast and crew safe while creating a beautiful and authentic film.

We have created an in-depth safety plan following provincial and federal guidelines to ensure on-set safety for the duration of our shoot. This includes frequent Covid-19 testing, constant mask-wearing by crew members and cast when not on-camera, daily symptom questionnaire and temperature checks, and vaccine requirements, should availability become more widespread come our September start date. 

 

Another challenge we face is financing. As students, we are financing this film all on our own and rely heavily on support from benefactors such as yourself to make our creative vision come to life. We have devised a substantial financing plan with multiple sources of income, yet most are not guaranteed and fall into the hands of others. We have been able to invest a significant amount into the film as a group to help reach our production cost goal, but the rest is still to be raised.

 

How Can You Help?

To give thanks for any donation of $8 or more, we have set up a wide range of perks that we can offer from our skill sets. A larger donation can get you a personalized photoshoot, access to a private cast & crew screening, or our impressive merch vault which includes exclusive Dandelion Green items, handmade by us!

We understand that these times have been hard on everyone and supporting a short film campaign is not always accessible.

We are grateful to receive any form of support! Whether that is sharing our campaign on social media or word of mouth, any amount of support is appreciated. Together, we hope to create a queer coming of age story that will validate people’s struggles and uplift them during these times. 

For more information, follow us on Facebook, Instagram and Tik Tok @Dandeliongreenfilm

story:
Hello! My name is Mark, and first and foremost I want to thank you for taking the time to stop by our campaign page! I know your time is valuable.

I am an artist who has been fortunate enough to work in the television and film industry for several years now. For the majority of those years I have wanted to tell a certain kind of story through film: a story about the quest that has been a part of humanity since humanity began. In short, our search for a companion. Most of us at some time in our lives will actively search for some kind of partner. Ironically in our search for a companion we often learn more about who we are. With your help, I can tell this story about one of the most defining aspects of the human condition. A story that, on some level, we can all relate to because we have been there or we will be there. It is who we are.

This project, "Nice Guy," is a short film that I wrote last year. We will need to raise at least $35,000 to make the film and I honestly can't do it without your help. The Cast and the Director have been very generous and are lending us their great talents for very little money. The majority of the money raised will be needed to pay the film crew, pay for video and audio equipment and to cover the rental costs of the various locations where we will be shooting. There are several scenes in coffee shops, bars and restaurants in the Los Angeles area. So, $35,000 is the bare minimum we need to raise for the making of this film. We could use more money to cover recording the soundtrack, outsourcing some of the graphics and post production needs and also for marketing the finished film.

I know this project is not without challenges. In addition to raising the money to make this film, we must be diligent in achieving our goal of making a film worthy of you, our sponsors. I take this responsibility very seriously. We must make a film that makes a difference and that leaves you a slightly different person than you were before you saw the film. With your help I know we can do this!

My heartfelt thanks to you,
Mark

story:
DYSPHORIA

(n) a state of unease or generational dissatisfaction with life

When a suicidal woman is exposed to the stark reality of someone taking their own life,
she begins to question her own 

"We're making this film to give Asian women suffering from

hidden mental health issues a voice" - Yennis Cheung & team

Haunted by intrusive nightmares and flashbacks for the past three years, Lucia Leung, a Chinese immigrant in London, struggles with post-traumatic stress disorder. Despite having no one who understands her mental illness - not even her husband - she soldiers on with life. However, she starts to lose control of her brain, and her loneliness grows stronger.

Lucia’s pain, invisible to others, becomes unbearable. Living in a cosmopolitan city with a loving husband and a high-flying career no longer has meaning. Her mental illness chips away at her identity; she cannot see the end of the tunnel.

Just when Lucia decides to end her life, she witnesses another woman’s suicide in broad daylight. This woman, who’s also Chinese, lies dead on the road after getting hit by a car. "That should be me,” Lucia whispers to herself.

Witnessing this incident puts Lucia into a weird trance; she finds herself talking to the deceased’s spirit.The departed’s name is Janet, and despite their drastically different personalities, the two Chinese women's circumstances are similar. In their conversation, Lucia learns about Janet's abusive father and partner, and Janet learns about Lucia's suffering.

Janet shares with Lucia the Buddhist practice she uses to manage her adversities, and the two bond over their common culture.

Just when Lucia thinks she’s finally found someone to talk to, she realises Janet is merely a mirror of her imagination.

Nevertheless, this surreal encounter allows Lucia to realise that maybe the most effective way to relieve her suffering is to let go of her desire to control the negative intrusions in her brain and hold on to the happy moments, no matter how minute they are. Maybe she can learn to find comfort within herself.

 

Stylistic Elements as Reference for Film:

A MOOD BOARD

 

Why Dysphoria? 

WATCH WHAT THE WRITER/DIRECTOR HAS TO SAY ABOUT DYSPHORIA

 

East Asian immigrant women need a voice, and “Dysphoria” intends to shine a spotlight on the invisible struggles of UK’s modern immigrant women, the thoughts and challenges that shape them, and their hopes in a foreign land.

 

Who Are We? 

About the writer/director/producer

 

Yennis Cheung is a former Hong Kong recording artist, now actress, and director/screenwriter based in the UK. Born in China, raised in Hong Kong. The daughter of two Beijing opera performers, Yennis pursued her love of the arts by studying music composition and classical opera at the Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts. While still a teenager, she was discovered and signed to Sony Music, and released three solo pop albums in Asia.

After relocating to London, UK, Yennis has gone on to guest star in both film and TV projects; Mission Impossible 7 (Paramount), Ransom (CBS), Stan Lee’s Lucky Man (SKY), Silent Witness (BBC),Call the Midwife (BBC), Deathrace: Beyond Anarchy to Skyfall (Bond 23). After obtaining a psychology degree, Yennis' creative work extended into screenwriting and directing; co-creating, writing, and starring in the Chinese Girls in London web series.

This brought her to the attention of Roughcut TV’s Ash Atalla. For Roughcut, Yennis co-wrote, co-created, associate-produced & starred in the sitcom Chinese Burn, (BBC Television). Chinese Burn received much press attention from the UK and China as the first UK made Chinese female-led sitcom. Yennis and her writing partner were subsequently nominated for the Debut Writer Award (The Debbies Awards in 2018).

Yennis continues her creative work, developing and creating projects with All3 Media and Saffron Cherry Productions, whilst pursuing an MA in Forensic Psychology.

Nomination & Awards

Yennis and her co-writer Shin-Fei Chen have been nominated for:

  • "Chinese Burn” (The Debut Writer Award in The Debbie Awards) 
  • New comedy pilot "Selma & Clarice" won BEST PILOT and BEST SCRIPTWRITING (Best Shorts Competition, Toronto International Women Film Festival, Toronto Film Magazine Fest, Accolade Global Film Competition 2021)
  • "The Troll" won BEST MICRO SHORT (Realm Film Festival, Flicks Monthly Film Festival 2021) BEST EDITING (Women's Comedy Film Festival in Chicago 2021) 

 

Watch some of Our Previous Work here:

 

 

 

Meet The Cast! 

We are thrilled to have experienced, professional actors on board in this passion project, who are equally vocal about raising awareness on the East Asian immigrant woman's struggles and mental health issues.

 

 

Meet The Producers! 

 

How Are We Going to Spend Your Money? 

Charities - 5% of this funding will go to charities supporting mental health & ending domestic abuse:  WISH  &   WOMEN'S AID   

Cast + Crew - Every member of our diverse cast and crew will be paid on this project meaning, everyone will ACTUALLY get paid to do what they love to do!

Location Hire -  One interior, multiple exteriors including a Buddhist temple which will form part of the cultural landscape we aim to reflect,  three days on a busy urban London street requiring street permits, necessary to depict the lead character's isolation in a bustling, big city, and a boom lift crane for the final aerial concept shot.

Green Transportation - We will keep the location central for cast and crew to access easily via public transport. Car pool will be used whenever possible.

Makeup/ Hair + Costume + Props -We will be hiring a professional makeup artist who will also been in charge of buying costumes for our cast. Apart from the odd hand held prop, hiring a rain machine for a pivotal scene will be essential in constructing this stylised narrative.

Equipment + Lighting - We’re filming on the ARRI Alexa Mini - which is the gold standard camera in many award winning TV/Film projects.  We will be mainly using day light on exterior locations, however, diffusers and day light equipment will be required to keep the lighting effect consistent throughout the shoot in this unpredictable London weather.

Catering for Cast + Crew - Cast and crew will be fed to ensure we don't get sued! In all seriousness, nutritious, wholesome meals will be provided.

Sound, Editing + Post-Production - Visuals & Style: this film intends to take our audience into a surreal reality using reverse sequences and colour splash to enhance the feeling of isolation in a busy city. Therefore, to ensure this high standard of production value, we will be employing a professional sound designer, editor, colour and grading designer to achieve this stylised vision.

Insurance - To ensure cast and crew safety on set, we will employ a Covid Safety Supervisor, as well as secure Film Production Insurance for the duration of the shoot.

Film Festival Submissions - One of our main objectives is entries into multiple prestigious film festivals such as Cannes, Sundance, Tribeca etc

 

So What Hurdles Might We Encounter?

Working with a limited budget as unforeseen circumstances are rife when producing a film, especially when working on a tight and demanding schedule of a 3 day shoot. (Not forgetting, the passer by who is always keen to say a friendly hello to the camera!)

Shooting a film is always rife with unforeseen circumstances and problems to solve, and we realise that making our passion project during a pandemic is even more challenging. To combat what we can control, we will be ensuring Covid safe measures as per government regulations.

 

 

And How Else Can You Help? 

  • Spread the word with the Indiegogo link/share tools; you can copy and share our DYSPHORIA campaign link to your social media pages
  • Follow us on INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/dysphoriashortfilm/
  • Follow us on  FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/Dysphoriashortfilm
  • Follow our progress on IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt14872858/
  • Tag us on social media #dysphoriashortfilm
  • We're so excited to have you on board as part of DYSPHORIA's journey, so a huge                  THANK YOU from us all!
story_txt:
DYSPHORIA
(n) a state of unease or generational dissatisfaction with life
When a suicidal woman is exposed to the stark reality of someone taking their own life,she begins to question her own 
"We're making this film to give Asian women suffering from 
hidden mental health issues a voice" - Yennis Cheung & team
Haunted by intrusive nightmares and flashbacks for the past three years, Lucia Leung, a Chinese immigrant in London, struggles with post-traumatic stress disorder. Despite having no one who understands her mental illness - not even her husband - she soldiers on with life. However, she starts to lose control of her brain, and her loneliness grows stronger.
Lucia’s pain, invisible to others, becomes unbearable. Living in a cosmopolitan city with a loving husband and a high-flying career no longer has meaning. Her mental illness chips away at her identity; she cannot see the end of the tunnel.
Just when Lucia decides to end her life, she witnesses another woman’s suicide in broad daylight. This woman, who’s also Chinese, lies dead on the road after getting hit by a car. "That should be me,” Lucia whispers to herself.
Witnessing this incident puts Lucia into a weird trance; she finds herself talking to the deceased’s spirit.The departed’s name is Janet, and despite their drastically different personalities, the two Chinese women's circumstances are similar. In their conversation, Lucia learns about Janet's abusive father and partner, and Janet learns about Lucia's suffering.
Janet shares with Lucia the Buddhist practice she uses to manage her adversities, and the two bond over their common culture.
Just when Lucia thinks she’s finally found someone to talk to, she realises Janet is merely a mirror of her imagination.
Nevertheless, this surreal encounter allows Lucia to realise that maybe the most effective way to relieve her suffering is to let go of her desire to control the negative intrusions in her brain and hold on to the happy moments, no matter how minute they are. Maybe she can learn to find comfort within herself.

story:
Greetings Horror Movie Fans! 

BLUNT FORCE ENTERTAINMENT is excited to introduce BACKWOODS BUBBA, directed by Brad Thomasson and written by Brad Thomasson and Rebecca Rinehart.

Our cast and crew have worked tirelessly on our teasers and trailers with the goal of sharing a glimpse of our story with you.  With your generosity and support, we are ready to transform BACKWOODS BUBBA into a feature film. 

 

 

 

BUBBA'S STORY:  This a slasher movie not like any slasher movie you've seen before.

The ladies of rural Bradleyville County have been disappearing one by one. The local sheriff's department is not taking the nine disappearances seriously.  When Lynn is taken by Bubba, however, her parents take matters into their own hands before its to late.

The parents realize there has been two people involved  in the county's missing person cases: the heinous hillbilly siblings known as Bubba Wayne Bundy and John Edward Bundy. The parents must save their daughter and the other captured women before Bubba strikes again in Bradleyville County.

The Cast and Crew

 

What We Need

First and foremost, we need to be able to pay for lodging , travel and food for our wonderful cast and crew for filming throughout 2020 and principal filming in October  in Virginia and North Carolina.

As with any feature film project, we have costs associated with costume, props, special effects, lighting, video equipment, promotion and physical perks.  EVERY DOLLAR WE EARN will go directly into making this the best feature film possible!!!

Want to see more?  Help us fund our dream by contributing whatever you can.  No amount is too small...or too big.  This project is created  by horror lovers for horror lovers.

story:
Plot Overview

The film follows a screenwriter struggling with writer's block. Frustrated by his lack of progress, and all deadlines to meet, he expresses his concern to a friend. "I always come up with my best ideas when I'm in the shower," she says, jokingly - still, taking this advice seriously, our protagonist finds himself having a lengthy shower, where he not only finds inspiration to write but also comes up with the greatest ideas. However, as a result, he develops an addiction to the shower and becomes very, very pruney...

 

Prosthetic's

It's no secret that we want this film to look as "wet" as possible, in fact, that is the whole point of the film! in order to achieve this, we will be using heavy makeup and prosthetics to completely transform our character into the monster he is giving a sort of Cronenberg-esque look.

'The Fly' Cronenberg (1986)

We will be using a tier system to develop the prosthetic's: Dry, Wet, Pruney and Waterlogged. Below are some pre visualizations Colton Stevenson has drawn up for the film:

 

Merch!!! 

In order to encourage donations (if believing the super funny premise wasn't enough), we've added some incentives. Own your very own, limited edition, streetwear-inspired shirt and bucket hat with an original design from our very own producer, Julia Waller.

With limited stock available, get your hands on a piece of "Pruney" clothing today! We promise it's the latest fashion trend.

 

With a Bucket Hat starting at:

£20

 

Pruney Bucket hat

And two different colors of a super cool Pruney T-shirt, whichever tickles your fancy,

also starting at £20.

 

Pruney T-shirt

 

'Pruney' Black T-shirt

Director - Alec Simmons

Alec Simmons is a Canadian born award-winning filmmaker based in London. Alec has always had a passion for fiction comedy. During High School, he began performing and writing live comedy, from stand-up, to sketch and improv. After graduating highschool, Alec moved to London in order to pursue a career in film. Since then, he’s directed several short films, ranging from comedy, drama, and animation. Alec hopes to make films that not only relate to the public, but also makes them laugh.

Director of Photography - Rui Jang (R.J.) Ong

Rui Jiang (R.J.) Ong is a Malaysian Cinematographer based in London. His most recent camera work includes “Watamula”, directed by the Kevin Osepa, which earned a finalist spot at the prestigious Golden Calves Award in the Netherlands and a selection at the Go Shorts International Short Film Festival. R.J.’s other works have screened internationally at the Young Director’s Award, the Netherlands Film Festival and the 1.4 Awards. In 2020, he was awarded a spot at the National Film and Television School and is currently pursuing his postgraduate degree in cinematography.

 

 Producer - Julia Waller

Julia Waller is an Argentinian film and TV producer.  She moved to London in 2018 to pursue a career in the film industry. After graduating from uni, three years of experience in indie film, and having directed and produced a few short films with festival selections, she decided to enroll in the TV Directing and Producing course at the National Film and Television School. 

Her focus is on comedic content - sitcoms, sketch, panel, shorts, you name it!

 

Producer - Elliot Whittle

In 2020 Elliot graduated from the London Film Academy with a first-class honours degree in Filmmaking. He was able to gain on-set experience and develop skills across a number of disciplines. As a graduate, the role of Producer feels like the perfect position to harness and improve on what he learned at university. Pruney provides the opportunity to venture further into the world of filmmaking with a project he feels passionately about.

 

We want to make a fun comedy film, with pathos around themes of self-reflection, anxiety,  and loneliness.

Any donation that you would be able to make would help us to execute our ambitious film to a high standard. The funds would go towards cast/crew fees, locations, or production design for example. However big or small, your donation would be highly appreciated! 

Risks and challenges

Some of the risks are fairly obvious, as doors open to a post-pandemic world, restrictions are plummeting and numbers of covid cases skyrocketing, we plan to continue to maintain extra covid precautions as the well being of our cast and crew are the utmost importance to us. To achieve this, we will have sanitising stations set up around the set, maintain social distancing where possible, face covering in doors where essential, and have a covid supervisor on set at all times to maintain safety while on set.

To achieve this, we will have sanitising stations set up around the set, maintain social distancing where possible, face covering in doors where essential, and have a covid supervisor on set at all times to maintain safety while on set.

story:
Overview

Wes Craven's A Nightmare on Elm Street is a global cultural phenomenon that has given eternal life to its legacy and its villain, Freddy Krueger. FredHeads is about the fans within the A Nightmare on Elm Street community.

As A Nightmare on Elm Street continues to thrive many years after its 1984 release, fans of all ages, both nationally and internationally, are invited to share their stories. With the central theme of how being a fan can change your life, FredHeads will feature enthusiasts of all types: passionate fanatics, lifelong aficionados, cosplayers, creators, artists, filmmakers, kids, and more. The documentary will also feature insight from the stars and creatives involved in the original film series, exploring the enduring legacy, the cultural impact, and the passion of the Elm Street fan community.

Message from the Director

Welcome! My name is Paige Troxell, and I am the creator, director, and one of the producers of FredHeads. The Nightmare on Elm Street franchise has done more than impact my life, it has saved my life. In my darkest times I have turned to Elm Street. It is a survival story, it is my best friend, it is my comfort, and it is my home. Traveling the country and meeting other fans and friends who all share similar stories sparked an idea. I knew that there were others out there who saw this film for more than just the typical slasher. It is my goal to bring to life each and every story; to show the world that this community stands together, that we are a support team for each other. I want to show the world what it really means when we call each other FredHeads.

Venn Pictures and Northgate Pictures have been traveling the country to interview various people - from fans to celebrities - that represent some of the FredHeads culture. We have even opened our submissions worldwide. It’s my story, your story, our story... We are FredHeads!

Who's in the film?

Along with our main FredHeads - Jeremy Todd Morehead, Anthony Browlee, Diandra Lazor, Paige Troxell, and Kim Gunzinger - we have had pleasure of speaking with numerous cast and crew members involved in the Elm Street series, including:

  • Lisa Wilcox (actress, A Nightmare on Elm Street 4 & 5)
  • Tuesday Night (actress, A Nightmare on Elm Street 4)
  • Danny Hassel (actor, A Nightmare on Elm Street 4 & 5)
  • Andras Jones (actor, A Nightmare on Elm Street 4)
  • Toy Newkirk (actress, A Nightmare on Elm Street 4)
  • Kelly Jo Minter (actress, A Nightmare on Elm Street 5)
  • Ricky Dean Logan (actor, Freddy's Dead: The Final Nightmare)
  • Miko Hughes (actor, Wes Craven's New Nightmare)
  • Robert Kurtzman (special effects legend, A Nightmare on Elm Street 5)
  • Mick Strawn (production designer, A Nightmare on Elm street 4)
  • Roberto Lombardi (actor, Krueger fan film series)
  • Nathan Thomas Milliner (filmmaker/artist, NECA & Shout Factory)

What's on the DVD?

In addition to the feature-length FredHeads documentary, the limited edition DVD will include tons of extra content. Planned special features include multiple audio commentaries, deleted scenes, bloopers, and extended footage.

Why should I pre-order?

Pre-ordering FredHeads on Indiegogo shows your support and will help us complete the film faster. Those that order through the campaign will be the first to receive the limited edition FredHeads DVD, and we ship internationally!

Your money goes directly to producing the discs, which will be professionally authored and manufactured with the highest amount of care taken into consideration. The number of pre-orders also helps us to determine the demand.

Various other perks, many of which are exclusive to this Indiegogo campaign, are also available. Get them now while you have the chance!

How will my money be used?

Once Indiegogo takes out its fees, every cent raised from this campaign will go directly into the making of FredHeads. Funding will be broken down into production (40%), post-production (37%), talent/cast (10%), fulfilling perks (10%), and marketing/publicity (3%).

Thank you!

The FredHeads crew would like to thank you, from the bottom of our boiler room hearts, for taking the time to listen to our store. Even if you are unable to pledge to the campaign, you can still support FredHeads by sharing the link with your friends on social media.

We always love to hear from fellow FredHeads, so please visit FredHeads The Documentary on Facebook to find out how you can submit your story!

FredHeads is about the fans within the A Nightmare on Elm Street community.As A Nightmare on Elm Street continues to thrive many years after its 1984 release, fans of all ages, both nationally and internationally, are invited to share their stories. With the central theme of how being a fan can change your life, FredHeads will feature enthusiasts of all types: passionate fanatics, lifelong aficionados, cosplayers, creators, artists, filmmakers, kids, and more. The documentary will also feature insight from the stars and creatives involved in the original film series, exploring the enduring legacy, the cultural impact, and the passion of the Elm Street fan community.Message from the DirectorWelcome! My name is Paige Troxell, and I am the creator, director, and one of the producers of FredHeads. The Nightmare on Elm Street franchise has done more than impact my life, it has saved my life. In my darkest times I have turned to Elm Street. It is a survival story, it is my best friend, it is my comfort, and it is my home. Traveling the country and meeting other fans and friends who all share similar stories sparked an idea. I knew that there were others out there who saw this film for more than just the typical slasher. It is my goal to bring to life each and every story; to show the world that this community stands together, that we are a support team for each other. I want to show the world what it really means when we call each other FredHeads.Venn Pictures and Northgate Pictures have been traveling the country to interview various people - from fans to celebrities - that represent some of the FredHeads culture. We have even opened our submissions worldwide. It’s my story, your story, our story... We are FredHeads!Who's in the film?Along with our main FredHeads - Jeremy Todd Morehead, Anthony Browlee, Diandra Lazor, Paige Troxell, and Kim Gunzinger - we have had pleasure of speaking with numerous cast and crew members involved in the Elm Street series, including:
Lisa Wilcox (actress, A Nightmare on Elm Street 4 & 5)
Tuesday Night (actress, A Nightmare on Elm Street 4)
Danny Hassel (actor, A Nightmare on Elm Street 4 & 5)
Andras Jones (actor, A Nightmare on Elm Street 4)
Toy Newkirk (actress, A Nightmare on Elm Street 4)
Kelly Jo Minter (actress, A Nightmare on Elm Street 5)
Ricky Dean Logan (actor, Freddy's Dead: The Final Nightmare)
Miko Hughes (actor, Wes Craven's New Nightmare)
Robert Kurtzman (special effects legend, A Nightmare on Elm Street 5)
Mick Strawn (production designer, A Nightmare on Elm street 4)
Roberto Lombardi (actor, Krueger fan film series)
Nathan Thomas Milliner (filmmaker/artist, NECA & Shout Factory)
What's on the DVD?In addition to the feature-length FredHeads documentary, the limited edition DVD will include tons of extra content. Planned special features include multiple audio commentaries, deleted scenes, bloopers, and extended footage.Why should I pre-order?Pre-ordering FredHeads on Indiegogo shows your support and will help us complete the film faster. Those that order through the campaign will be the first to receive the limited edition FredHeads DVD, and we ship internationally!Your money goes directly to producing the discs, which will be professionally authored and manufactured with the highest amount of care taken into consideration. The number of pre-orders also helps us to determine the demand.Various other perks, many of which are exclusive to this Indiegogo campaign, are also available. Get them now while you have the chance!How will my money be used?Once Indiegogo takes out its fees, every cent raised from this campaign will go directly into the making of FredHeads. Funding will be broken down into production (40%), post-production (37%), talent/cast (10%), fulfilling perks (10%), and marketing/publicity (3%).Thank you!The FredHeads crew would like to thank you, from the bottom of our boiler room hearts, for taking the time to listen to our store. Even if you are unable to pledge to the campaign, you can still support FredHeads by sharing the link with your friends on social media.We always love to hear from fellow FredHeads, so please visit FredHeads The Documentary on Facebook to find out how you can submit your story!

story:
Hello!

Welcome to the crowd fund of TWELVE the FILM!

This is a short film that will be looking at eating disorders from the perspective of our lead character Raveena and through her eyes we see a variety of different cases others have struggled with eating disorders.

It's a majority female led cast and crew, with a diverse team, the lead actress being British South Asian. 

We are thrilled that we have a named actress in our cast, who we can’t yet reveal, and we are currently casting for further named and unnamed actors to help bring this film to life! 

We want to create a film that is both diverse and supportive to mental health in film.

This film is being run by two filmmakers (one of which is also a doctor in the NHS in mental health).

 

This film is unique as it has support from NHS doctors, The Royal College of Psychiatrists, Eating disorder Charities, as well as film experts! 
 

WRITER & DIRECTOR: Molly Vandermeer is a female British Director who has had years of experience in the industry and is ready to take this film to the next level at high levelled platforms. 

 

 

PRODUCER: Dr Parvinder Shergill, is an award winning filmmaker and NHS doctor who specialises in mental health, and has worked with BBC and Channel 4.

 

LINE PRODUCER: Leyla Alizada is a London based filmmaker who has a passion for bringing light on untold perspectives and taboo subjects. 

 

FIRST ASSISTANT DIRECTOR: Dhruv Bhatnagar has worked in Bollywood for 3 years on 8 high concept films as an assistant director and is now taking on London based productions!

We need  your support!

we need to raise some funds to help bring this film to life. 

We would like to hire some named actors to help promote this film as well as secure a great location and take to film festivals!

The Impact

We feel its very important to have a majority female led film, that's why our director, writer, producer and lead actress are women!

Majority of cast are women with a diverse backgrounds.

A film about eating disorders is extremely important to us, as so many have been affected by it and we wish to shed light on this topic in a positive manner. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our crowd fund and you can also follow our instagram page @TWELVE_Film2021

 

THANK YOU!

story:
WHAT IS DANGEROUS?

Dangerous is an award-winning neo-noir Western set in Southern Appalachia. Dangerous is a modern myth filled with heroes, villains, and important lessons. After all, Dangerous is a modern-interpretation of the Labors of Theseus. Dangerous is a lot of things, but at its core, Dangerous is an intense action adventure that will have you on the edge of your seat, and leave you begging for more!

The story of Dangerous revolves around two characters and the choices they have to make if they’re going to survive the night at the Procter Motel. 

Theo Troezen is a motorcycle riding cowboy on a mysterious quest for justice. After receiving a prophecy that he will use all six bullets in his Father’s revolver, Theo is determined to use them on evildoers. After all, an eye for an eye, right?

Lilly Procter is a young woman who acts tough, but is trapped in a terrible situation and forced to commit unspeakable acts by her abuser, her “sweet-as-pie” Aunt Polly.

Polly Procter, the villain of our story, is a southern belle and wicked serial killer. She’s determined to deal her own form of justice, luring men to stay at her motel then seducing, torturing, and murdering them. 

Theo will have to decide if his ideals are worth clinging on to, and Lilly will have to choose to escape the situation she’s in, even if it means more danger. 

Dangerous takes its inspiration from myth and legend, but also many of your favorite movies and television shows. Check it out!

WHAT WE NEED

Dangerous aims to earn as much acclaim as a film as it has earned as a script. To do this, Dangerous needs to raise a total of $60,000.

As you can see in the graphic below, Dangerous aims to put the majority of its budget into production. From the unsettlingly prim design of the Procter Motel to Theo’s iconic revolver, the budget for Dangerous will appear on screen for viewers to enjoy. Currently, Dangerous plans to shoot in New Mexico, so funds donated in our campaign will go to travel, lodging, and food for our talented cast and crew. Furthermore, it is important to us to pay all of our cast and crew a fair rate. It's not enough to make our film; we want to do it right. 

PERKS & HOW YOU CAN HELP

We’re offering several perks to our sponsors. Including props, signed copies of the poster and script, and Producer titles in the credits. Come be a part of this award-winning film!! 

Every little bit helps in our crowdfunding process. If you cannot afford to donate to our project, please share our page to your family and friends!

MEET THE CAST & CHARACTERS

“Three bullets left - I wonder who deserves 'em?”

Spencer Vaughn Kelly plays Theo Troezen! Based on the Greek Hero Theseus, Theo Troezen grew up impoverished in rural Tennessee. After discovering his estranged Father’s identity as a famous televangelist, Theo goes on a quest to find him and follows a prophecy that he’ll use all six bullets of the ornate revolver he inherited before reaching his destination. Theo takes inspiration from his religious roots and his Father’s radical preachings to slay evildoers on the road. Behind his rough exterior, Theo is a kind soul - and would rather choose mercy, when given the chance.

Check out Spencer on IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm9273278/

“You trying to save me, Cowboy?”

 Aleis Work plays Lilly Procter! A rebellious and strong young woman that life has been forced into a terrible situation. Orphaned at a young age, Lilly was taken in by her sadistic Aunt Polly. While psychologically and physically trapped at the Procter Motel, Lilly is forced to take part in her Aunt’s serial murder of men. When the charming Theo arrives, Lilly is not quick to trust, but that doesn’t mean she’s given up on her rebellious spirit. By the end of the night, she’ll have to take her life into her own hands if she’s going to escape confinement and save Theo from a torturous death.

Check out Aleis on IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm8475722/

“It's okay to beg.”

Leslie Stevens plays Polly Procter! In her youth, Polly was unspeakably abused and wronged by men. The trauma of those experiences has driven her to view them all as abusers and never trust men again. She takes revenge against any man who happens upon her motel where she seduces, tortures, and kills them.

Check out Leslie on IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0007061/

"You’re on the wrong road, Son."

Hunter C. Smith plays Cyrus Smiles! Cyrus is a killer who attacks cars lost on the road to feed his unending avarice. His companion, the giant-sized Piggie Piggie, is a mentally challenged man who Cyrus manipulates into helping him commit his crimes. The pair are famous for feeding their victims to their rabid dogs, and are hunted by Theo for their crimes. 

Check out Hunter on IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3772058/

We'll be announcing our Piggie throughout the campaign! 

MEET THE WRITER

Jacob Dalton is an writer and producer based in Los Angeles. Jacob is a trained actor, staring in over twenty live theater productions. As a writer, Jacob earned several awards for Dangerous, including winning the Screencraft Action & Adventure Screenplay Competition in 2020 and being ranked as being currently ranked as the #1 Adventure Short Script of all time on Coverfly!

Check out Jacob's work here: https://www.jacobdaltonactor.com/ 

MEET THE PRODUCTION TEAM

Adam Moses is Director, Producer and Writer known for the award winning action short film Katana (2018) andDon’t F**k with The Musketeers (2020). His upcoming work as a director includes a wide range of genres including 34902 - A surreal short film set in Auschwitz during the Second World War; A Siren’s Call - A fantasy/horror short film that features pirates, sirens, and cult rituals; and now, Dangerous.

Check out Adam’s work here: FirstManFilms.com

Sof Puchley is a classically trained actor/singer born in Chicago and raised in Los Angeles. She  graduated from one of the top drama schools in the U.K., the Liverpool Institute for Performing Arts,  where she earned her BA (HONS) Acting degree. She also studied improv at The Second City Chicago,  and advanced scene study at The Acting Studio Chicago, advance scene study). Sof has performed on  various stages in the U.S. from Shakespeare in the Park in Chicago, to the Beauty and the Beast show at  Disneyland. Sof is a proud member of SAG-AFTRA and Equity UK. She has done numerous TV and film  work – from national commercials to leads in multiple indie films (see resume). Along with acting, Sof is a  freelance director and producer. Most recently, she directed the short thriller, Lucky Day, and is currently  an executive producer of the upcoming fantasy film, A Siren's Call. Sof is passionate about continuous  advancement and training and currently with The Actors Community, Amy Lyndon, and Will Wallace.

Check out Sof on IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3414410/

Lauren Beausoleil moved to LA from Bellville, Texas to pursue her career in the industry. She is a SAG actress, producer, and casting director, and just finished producing and starring in her film Blood Ties. She loves all facets of the creative process and is so excited to be bringing Dangerous to life with this kickass team! 

Check out Lauren on IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm8650575/
