story:
72 is an independently produced horror-suspense movie from Gravestone Films that is written and directed by Carl Miller and will be produced by Scotty McCoy and Amanda Sawayer that will give a whole new meaning to "not listening to the guidelines".

Synopsis

A highly fatal and contagious virus that hits within 72 hours of exposure, begins to spread fast across the globe. The government has issued a mandatory 3-day stay-at-home quarantine in hopes of slowing the spread. For Rich, Jill, and some of their friends, that's not an option. They set off deep into the human-free woods where they hope to remain safe. Unbeknownst to the gang, one of their own is already infected and it quickly spreads through the group one by one. The group is faced with unexpected challenges as they struggle to fight for survival against the infection - and each other.

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising the funds to help us get even better SFX, movie poster designer, upgraded filmmaking lighting equipment, and cameras. By donating, you can be part of 72.  From a simple end title credit and social media shoutout to receiving merchandise. There's even an entire role of being killed in the movie to a credited associate producer role, and everything in between.

We have for you the perks of a lifetime to be part of a "72".  All you have to do is help us out with getting the movie made, and you too, will be part of this amazing movie experience.

Cast and Crew

The cast of "72" has been officially announced, and it includes some big names from the indie horror community.  You can see below the cast of the film, with the crew members to be added at a later date, once they have been officially announced.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: Spread the word by sharing this campaign to all of the horror and filmmaking groups on social media. Share this campaign to your personal social media accounts and let others passionate about film know that they can help and be part of a "72".

story:
** New Stretch Goal £15 000**

We made our goal in 14 days! Thank you so much to all of our backers. We are still raising funds! Every pound over the goal will go towards paying our cast and crew and producing a film of the best quality. Please continue to spread the word and contribute if you can. 

 

Across the UK today, 6.5 million people are carers, supporting a loved one who is older, disabled or seriously ill. Many don’t know how or where to get help. It can be frightening and lonely. Then you add a worldwide pandemic and care home crisis into the mix and the pressures and difficulties are tenfold.

The Carer is a story that centres around loneliness, guilt and sacrifice that aims to give a raw insight into a daughter’s mental and physical breakdown under the demands of full-time care giving at a time when so many are struggling. We explore the complexities of being the ‘carer’ and the cared for and how those roles can alternate depending on perspective and situation.

Thank you so much for supporting the arts during this time and helping raise awareness to our cause. By supporting our project, you will be helping a group of female filmmakers progress to the next stage in their careers and create even more important and relevant content.

The Story

With moments of dark comedy and heart-breaking sadness, The Carer meets LISA, a woman in her forties who has never truly left home, at the tipping point of her crippling inability to establish necessary boundaries in her life. Lisa is stuck in an endless routine of cleaning and caring for her sick mother MARY but today is tougher than most.

Georgia started writing The Carer, as a consequence of her own personal circumstances. As her own parents aged and some of her closest friends started to have to look after their parents, something was taken for granted and readily assumed; those who gave up full-time jobs, reorganised their lives, and even moved countries, were overwhelmingly female. 

Caring can be extremely rewarding and life enhancing. Knowing you are helping someone you deeply love and making them feel a little safer and less alone, is priceless. However, there is a cost and carers do need to be equally provided for. Being a sole carer, can be lonely and taxing. If you are a single person, or have a limited support system yourself, without a solid network around you, it can be an isolating and testing experience. Caring can go on for years, and who wants to listen to the daily updates of a story which can be monotonous and upsetting. Which led to the initial theme, of who actually cares for the carer? 

The pandemic has brought on many challenges, but nobody can deny that care homes have undergone tremendous difficulties and there is a fundamental crisis in regard to looking after the ageing population. Speaking to an elderly relative, at the start of lockdown, she protested that she would lock herself in, and have to be crow barred out, rather than go into a care home. She adamantly stated that “nobody was coming in”. When Georgia’s own father ended up in hospital during May 2020, and with her own mother being extremely critically vulnerable and shielding, Georgia became her full-time protector.  She witnessed first-hand the distress and terror, Covid 19 ushered in, on top of already pre-existing anxieties.

Who We Are

Writer: Georgia Fitch

Georgia grew up in East London. She has a Masters (distinction) in screenwriting from Raindance Film School, validated by De Montfort University, Leicester. Her short "What took you so long"' premiered at Raindance Film Festival in 2019.  She has previously developed projects for Size 9 and Cowboy Films. Her theatre work has been produced at the RSC, Soho Theatre, National Theatre and The Bush Theatre. "Adrenalin Heart" her critically lauded stage play, played in Tokyo, New York and Berlin, alongside being broadcast for Radio 3. It has now been adapted for film.  She has also had a substantial career in radio, writing for the BBC and working on the acclaimed “Home Front" primarily for Radio 4. In addition, she has been an actress in both film and television.

Director: Amrita Acharia

Amrita Acharia is an actress, writer and director of Nepalese Ukranian origin and grew up in both cultures as well as the UK and Northern Norway. Amrita has a decade of work in front of the camera, most notably for her roles as Irri in HBO's "Game of Thrones", Ruby in ITV's "The Good Karma Hospital" and the lead in Norway's award-winning indie "I am Yours." Amrita most recently starred alongside Russell Tovey in Neil Cross's limited series “The Sister" on ITV. Alongside her work as an actress Amrita has directed theatre for drama schools in Norway and London fringe theatres, The Bunker and The Courtyard. She is in the development phases of independent drama and comedy series' and is set to direct their proof of concepts.  Amrita is drawn to character driven and visceral storytelling and hopes to direct pieces for lesser heard voices. The Carer will be Amrita's directorial film debut.

Producer: Lizzie Worsdell

Lizzie is an award-winning actress who gained a degree from the American Academy of Dramatic Arts, Los Angeles before being invited to become a member of the prestigious BAFTA newcomers’ program. Lizzie worked in Hollywood and London for many years and has worked on a variety of short films as an actress but recently made her producing debut on short film "Disarm" starring Sophia Myles. Her role ranges from sourcing talent and crew to managing budgets, scouting locations, overseeing script development and preparing schedules. Lizzie is passionate about making female centred work and representing a side of society that isn’t typically shown on screen. The Carer will serve as her final Masters project at Raindance film school.

Lisa: Priyanga Burford

Portraying Lisa, The Carer’s protagonist and exploring the complexities involved in caring for a loved one under the most trying of circumstances will be experienced actress Priyanga Burford. Priyanga has had a varied career working in TV, Theatre, Film and Radio. She recently appeared in HBO’s ‘Industry’ and can soon be seen in the upcoming Bond film ‘No Time to Die.’  Her other credits include ITV’s ‘Innocent’, BBC’s ‘Press,’ ‘The Other Man’ directed by Richard Eyre, ‘Marcella,’ ‘Veep,’ ‘Law and Order,’ ‘The Thick of It’ and ‘Silent Witness’ as well as performing with The RSC, The National Theatre and Shakespeare’s Globe but to name a few.

Director Of Photography: Suzanne Smith

Heading up our camera team will be cinematographer Suzanne Smith. Suzanne has been shooting for over 12 years and has a wealth of experience working on short films, dramas, music promos and documentaries.  Her debut feature film “Guardians" was released in 2017 and garnered a number of awards including Best Comedy Feature at the Midwest Action Festival, Best Feature at Saints and Sinners Film Festival, and Best Comedy at Rome Independent Film Festival. Suzanne’s short film “KAREN", a drama shot on Alexa Mini with Cooke Anamorphic lenses, was recently selected for Sunday Shorts and Short to the Point Film Festival. Suzanne is represented by Intrinsic London and is a member of the Guild of British Camera Technicians.

How You Can Help

This is where you come in! Here's a look at where your contribution will go. 

Everybody involved is passionate about the project and willing to help make this film happen on a low budget

£5000 will get the film made but £10 000 would allow us to pay our cast and crew at a time when creatives are really struggling as well as allowing us to pay for an expensive hospital location.

Funds will go towards:

  • Cast and crew

  • Production Design 

  • Costumes

  • Locations (hospital, house, street)

  • Camera and sound equipment (including kit to film a car scene)

  • Insurance

  • Food

  • Covid testing and safety precautions

  • Festival fees

If you are unable to help by backing the project, perhaps you may be able to help us with any of the above. If so, please get in touch with Lizzie!

Risks & Challenges

Shooting a short film during Covid 19 can be difficult, but we have planned ahead, and we will have minimal cast and crew. Our priority will be making sure everyone involved is safe and healthy. Production will need to be delayed if anyone comes into contact with the virus or begins to show symptoms. We will be following all required protocols for a Covid safe set. Having a small cast and crew keeps the risk relatively low and easy to manage.  
 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that the last year has been incredibly challenging and not everyone has the financial resources to help out. If you cannot contribute financially, there are still ways you can help!  

Perhaps you can help with donating locations, equipment or food.

Or perhaps you can share this page with anyone who may be interested in supporting this project and follow and share our official instagram page @thecarershortfilm

Thank you!
story_txt:
** New Stretch Goal £15 000**
We made our goal in 14 days! Thank you so much to all of our backers. We are still raising funds! Every pound over the goal will go towards paying our cast and crew and producing a film of the best quality. Please continue to spread the word and contribute if you can. 
 
Across the UK today, 6.5 million people are carers, supporting a loved one who is older, disabled or seriously ill. Many don’t know how or where to get help. It can be frightening and lonely. Then you add a worldwide pandemic and care home crisis into the mix and the pressures and difficulties are tenfold.
The Carer is a story that centres around loneliness, guilt and sacrifice that aims to give a raw insight into a daughter’s mental and physical breakdown under the demands of full-time care giving at a time when so many are struggling. We explore the complexities of being the ‘carer’ and the cared for and how those roles can alternate depending on perspective and situation.
Thank you so much for supporting the arts during this time and helping raise awareness to our cause. By supporting our project, you will be helping a group of female filmmakers progress to the next stage in their careers and create even more important and relevant content.

The Story
With moments of dark comedy and heart-breaking sadness, The Carer meets LISA, a woman in her forties who has never truly left home, at the tipping point of her crippling inability to establish necessary boundaries in her life. Lisa is stuck in an endless routine of cleaning and caring for her sick mother MARY but today is tougher than most.
Georgia started writing The Carer, as a consequence of her own personal circumstances. As her own parents aged and some of her closest friends started to have to look after their parents, something was taken for granted and readily assumed; those who gave up full-time jobs, reorganised their lives, and even moved countries, were overwhelmingly female. 
Caring can be extremely rewarding and life enhancing. Knowing you are helping someone you deeply love and making them feel a little safer and less alone, is priceless. However, there is a cost and carers do need to be equally provided for. Being a sole carer, can be lonely and taxing. If you are a single person, or have a limited support system yourself, without a solid network around you, it can be an isolating and testing experience. Caring can go on for years, and who wants to listen to the daily updates of a story which can be monotonous and upsetting. Which led to the initial theme, of who actually cares for the carer? 
The pandemic has brought on many challenges, but nobody can deny that care homes have undergone tremendous difficulties and there is a fundamental crisis in regard to looking after the ageing population. Speaking to an elderly relative, at the start of lockdown, she protested that she would lock herself in, and have to be crow barred out, rather than go into a care home. She adamantly stated that “nobody was coming in”. When Georgia’s own father ended up in hospital during May 2020, and with her own mother being extremely critically vulnerable and shielding, Georgia became her full-time protector.  She witnessed first-hand the distress and terror, Covid 19 ushered in, on top of already pre-existing anxieties.
Who We Are
Writer: Georgia Fitch 

Georgia grew up in East London. She has a Masters (distinction) in screenwriting from Raindance Film School, validated by De Montfort University, Leicester. Her short "What took you so long"' premiered at Raindance Film Festival in 2019.  She has previously developed projects for Size 9 and Cowboy Films. Her theatre work has been produced at the RSC, Soho Theatre, National Theatre and The Bush Theatre. "Adrenalin Heart" her critically lauded stage play, played in Tokyo, New York and Berlin, alongside being broadcast for Radio 3. It has now been adapted for film.  She has also had a substantial career in radio, writing for the BBC and working on the acclaimed “Home Front" primarily for Radio 4. In addition, she has been an actress in both film and television.
Director: Amrita Acharia

Amrita Acharia is an actress, writer and director of Nepalese Ukranian origin and grew up in both cultures as well as the UK and Northern Norway. Amrita has a decade of work in front of the camera, most notably for her roles as Irri in HBO's "Game of Thrones", Ruby in ITV's "The Good Karma Hospital" and the lead in Norway's award-winning indie "I am Yours." Amrita most recently starred alongside Russell Tovey in Neil Cross's limited series “The Sister" on ITV. Alongside her work as an actress Amrita has directed theatre for drama schools in Norway and London fringe theatres, The Bunker and The Courtyard. She is in the development phases of independent drama and comedy series' and is set to direct their proof of concepts.  Amrita is drawn to character driven and visceral storytelling and hopes to direct pieces for lesser heard voices. The Carer will be Amrita's directorial film debut.
Producer: Lizzie Worsdell

Lizzie is an award-winning actress who gained a degree from the American Academy of Dramatic Arts, Los Angeles before being invited to become a member of the prestigious BAFTA newcomers’ program. Lizzie worked in Hollywood and London for many years and has worked on a variety of short films as an actress but recently made her producing debut on short film "Disarm" starring Sophia Myles. Her role ranges from sourcing talent and crew to managing budgets, scouting locations, overseeing script development and preparing schedules. Lizzie is passionate about making female centred work and representing a side of society that isn’t typically shown on screen. The Carer will serve as her final Masters project at Raindance film school.
Lisa: Priyanga Burford

Portraying Lisa, The Carer’s protagonist and exploring the complexities involved in caring for a loved one under the most trying of circumstances will be experienced actress Priyanga Burford. Priyanga has had a varied career working in TV, Theatre, Film and Radio. She recently appeared in HBO’s ‘Industry’ and can soon be seen in the upcoming Bond film ‘No Time to Die.’  Her other credits include ITV’s ‘Innocent’, BBC’s ‘Press,’ ‘The Other Man’ directed by Richard Eyre, ‘Marcella,’ ‘Veep,’ ‘Law and Order,’ ‘The Thick of It’ and ‘Silent Witness’ as well as performing with The RSC, The National Theatre and Shakespeare’s Globe but to name a few.
Director Of Photography: Suzanne Smith

Heading up our camera team will be cinematographer Suzanne Smith. Suzanne has been shooting for over 12 years and has a wealth of experience working on short films, dramas, music promos and documentaries.  Her debut feature film “Guardians" was released in 2017 and garnered a number of awards including Best Comedy Feature at the Midwest Action Festival, Best Feature at Saints and Sinners Film Festival, and Best Comedy at Rome Independent Film Festival. Suzanne’s short film “KAREN", a drama shot on Alexa Mini with Cooke Anamorphic lenses, was recently selected for Sunday Shorts and Short to the Point Film Festival. Suzanne is represented by Intrinsic London and is a member of the Guild of British Camera Technicians.
How You Can Help
This is where you come in! Here's a look at where your contribution will go. 
Everybody involved is passionate about the project and willing to help make this film happen on a low budget
£5000 will get the film made but £10 000 would allow us to pay our cast and crew at a time when creatives are really struggling as well as allowing us to pay for an expensive hospital location.
Funds will go towards:

Cast and crew
Production Design 
Costumes
Locations (hospital, house, street)
Camera and sound equipment (including kit to film a car scene)
Insurance
Food
Covid testing and safety precautions
Festival fees


If you are unable to help by backing the project, perhaps you may be able to help us with any of the above. If so, please get in touch with Lizzie!
Risks & Challenges
Shooting a short film during Covid 19 can be difficult, but we have planned ahead, and we will have minimal cast and crew. Our priority will be making sure everyone involved is safe and healthy. Production will need to be delayed if anyone comes into contact with the virus or begins to show symptoms. We will be following all required protocols for a Covid safe set. Having a small cast and crew keeps the risk relatively low and easy to manage.   
Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that the last year has been incredibly challenging and not everyone has the financial resources to help out. If you cannot contribute financially, there are still ways you can help!  
Perhaps you can help with donating locations, equipment or food.
Or perhaps you can share this page with anyone who may be interested in supporting this project and follow and share our official instagram page @thecarershortfilm
Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Over this spring, A Crew of third-year graduates from the University of the creative arts banded together under the height of the Covid-19 Pandemic to Produce a Short film for which they could all use as their entry point into the filmmaking industry in this troubled time, out of sheer ambition and tenacity, There film they shot was a science fiction film, about robots in a far off future and now that they've filmed it safely, they are now raising funds in order to finish the film, to make it the very best it could be!

What We Need (& What You Get!)

We are looking to raise funds to cover the cost of post-production of Flesh & Oil. 

Having the chance to film this project has been an amazing undertaking, but the journey hasn't ended just yet. In order to finish making the film and sending it to festivals all around the world, as well as marketing it so as many people as possible get to see the fruits of our labors, it'll we need your help!

Now that shooting is done and we have all the footage needed there are still several stages the piece must go through in order to be the best it can be. To do so it will need to be edited, an original soundtrack will need to be commissioned and added, as well as certain visual and sound effects of which can become quite costly, The money raised will be going towards covering the costs of designers and visual effects artists that will work incredibly hard to make sure everything looks and sounds the best it can so that audiences are able to immerse themselves in this amazing new world the filmmakers have conceived.

Once the film is fully finalized we will use the remainder of the money raised to get it into film festivals worldwide and marketing it around so that all people are able to access it and see the film!

 

The Impact

We believe that the themes of empathy, identity, discrimination, humanity, and hope which shape the film are more relevant now than ever before. We hope that when audiences watch this film they'll be immersed and moved by it and that it's something that will stay with them for a long time. 

Risks and COVID-19

All of the post-production will be done remotely to ensure the safety of the crew members involved in the process. This will create some challenges as we won't be able to collaborate in person but through good communication, we will be able to make it work!

The health and safety of our crew are our number one priority. We know this will cause some difficulties when finalizing our project and may prolong its release but we are determined to respect government guidelines in order to keep everyone safe and secure.

Other Ways You Can Help!

If you are able to donate anything at all we will be very grateful. Any small amount helps us reach our goal and bringing our vision to life. However, we are aware that these are difficult times and not everyone can help us by directly donating money. If that's the case for you but you still want to help don't worry! There are many ways you can support us.

Please share our Indiegogo campaign as well as our social media. By following them you can stay updated on how the project is going ;

https://www.instagram.com/flesh.and.oil/

https://www.facebook.com/FleshandOilUK

Remember! Liking our posts and sharing them when you see them can help us get traction and spread awareness of our film which is just as helpful as donating!

Meet The Crew!

Producer - Logan Bailey!

Hey Everybody! I'm Logan Bailey and I'm producing 'Flesh & Oil' I've always grown-up LOVING sci-fi particularly inspired by the early works of George Lucas & Ridley Scott, but it's a genre I've never had the opportunity to tackle myself until Adam's script came across my metaphorical desk and I just LOVED IT, As a producer, the most gratifying parts for me are finding the most Talented, Creative and Greatest crewmembers and uniting them under one vision worth working hard for, Then sitting back and watching movie-magic happen before my very eyes! We're working beyond hard every day to bring this fantastic Idea to life and any donations you can give means the whole world to us, but if you can't donate, That's okay! Sharing our social media posts helps out just as much!!! See you at the movies, everyone!

Director - Astyn Webb!

Hi, I'm Astyn Webb and I'm the Director of Flesh and Oil. I was attracted to the script because of its human element, the message within the film, and its social relevance. We have an incredible team of people working on this film, and I'm beyond excited to be working with them. Together we will bring this fantastic script to life on screen and tell a story that entertains and resonates with its audience.

Editor - Mohit Lumbhani!

My name is Mohit Lumbhani and I’m the editor for ‘Flesh and Oil.’ I believe in artistic integrity, and being part of ‘Flesh and Oil’ gives me the drive and energy to continue to work on narrative-based films. Accompanying the sharp story and intriguing characters, the film is sci-fi, which I have enormous admiration for. When it comes to the craft of film editing, I thrive on culminating the film to its full potential. As I’m the editor of the film, I’ve set my mind toward how I plan to construct and shape the story. Having read the script, it gives me optimism that the future of filmmaking is to be reserved for narrative films.

Our Other Links!

Follow us on all our different pages for updates on the future of the film!

- LinkTree (All our links) - https://linktr.ee/FleshandOil 

  - Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/FleshandOilUK

- Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/flesh.and.oil/

  - Youtube - https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC6FUu1Ryn_-q5L...

 IMDB - https://www.imdb.com/title/tt13398744/?ref_=ttf...

Email us! at - fleshandoilfilm@gmail.com​

 

Our PayPal (Send to us Directly!) - https://www.paypal.com/paypalme/FleshandOil?fbc...

story:
WHAT IS DYSTOPIA?

Dystopia is a brand new time travel TV show in the vein of Looper ? 12 Monkeys? The terminator films - all great time travel adventures about avoiding a future fate that we need to avoid at all costs.

As our mood reel above demonstrates we're about to embark on creating a post apocalyptic future landscape for a brand new TV show. 

SYNOPSIS

The future is a bleak place. Mankind is dying. The planet is now a war torn place, because of a worldwide fertility epidemic meaning that no one is able to have children. It’s because of a microchip identity system that was introduced into the population in 2019. An unexpected side effect of the chip in the human body was the loss of fertility in both men and women.  Riots and religious hysteria meant Marshall Law was implemented in 2023 and for the last 20 years that’s how the world has existed and tried to come to terms with their new situation. Every school has closed – as the world no has no children, the last of that generation are getting older.

Two scientists trying to discover teleportation, accidently stumble on time travel and work out that they can make a one way trip to 2017 to save humanity from the BIOCORP people that introduce the chip ID syetem and ultimately seal the fate of all mankind.

But all is not as easy as it seems. The Scientists who travel back in time must have the bodies in a state of cryo stasis in the future  - any harm coming to them in 2047 will effect them in 2017. 

The show is set both in the future and in the past. We traverse the two worlds with their unfolding narratives, equally effecting each other building to a surprising season finale.

CAST

We've assembled a fantastic prospective cast for the TV show, drawing on plenty of action and sci fi favourites . All the right ingredients for a hit TV show. 


EVE MAURO

MICHAEL COPON

MICHAEL HOGAN 

JASON DAVID FRANK 

JASON FAUNT 

SHEENA COLETTE

SIMON PHILLIPS

CHALET BRANNAN

EDWARD FURLONG

ZACH GALLIGAN

EMMA LOCK

THE DIRECTOR 

ADAM NEUTZSKY-WULFF - DIRECTOR/PRODUCER

The last 15 years of professional experience includes 39 episodes of four different drama tv-series for Danish national television, all of which were conceptualized and directed by him, more than 100 music videos and commercials, several short films, documentaries, radio drama and a feature film THE STRANGER INSIDE starring William Baldwin, that was picked up by Sony Pictures International in 2013.  Adam is the owner of production company Drama Deluxe.
His commercial reel: CLICK ME. 

Trailer for THE STRANGER INSIDE: CLICK ME. 

PAUL LINGAS - WRITER
A native of Portland, Oregon, Paul received a double BA in English Literature and Spanish at the University of Oregon before earning his MFA at the University of Southern California’s School of Cinema-Television.  His current film, Just Ask... has already won six awards on the festival circuit, including five prestigious Awards of Excellence from the Accolade, IndieFest and Best Shorts Global Film Competitions. His award winning Sci-Fi film Wide Awake in Nothing has screened at numerous festivals worldwide and on the Independent Film Channel.  He has produced, written and directed a number of other award winning films, many episodes of a web based sit-com, as well as a commercial for a New York based social media company.  His screenwriting work includes original screenplays, as well as working as a freelance screenwriter, script doctor and editor.  Paul has been commissioned to write and/or rewrite feature screenplays for a variety of production companies in Los Angeles, New York, London and Athens.

Paul continues to develop a number of feature film writing and directing projects including the Irish drama The Stare's Nest and the upcoming romantic comedy The Politics of Dating, the film that inspired Just Ask... Another film he wrote, Swing Away, is set to go into production in Rhodes, Greece, in the Spring of 2015

LEE WOZY WARREN - PRODUCER 

Lee ‘Wozy’ Warren has been involved with filmmaking since the age of 11 having shot his first films on Super 8mm. Over the past 10 years he has worked as a producer and director on such films as the Warner Bros La Estación Ausente for director Gustavo Letelier, the recent The Last Scout as well as the TV series No Easy Days. Through his post production company Wozy worked on such features as Scott Walker: 30th century Man, 12 in a Box, Tovarisch, I Am Not Dead (for BAFTA winning director Stuart Urban), The Golden Compass, Mutant Chronicles and Moon. Wozy directed the feature film Jack Says in 2008 for producer Simon Phillips. Wozy brings a wealth of production experience to the series through his company Bad Eden Entertainment Ltd.


WHAT WILL THE SHOW LOOK LIKE? THE WRITER

Our show will look amazing thanks to the good people at Light Works - who have agreed to provide the VFX for our time travel show. 

The portfolio of their work can be seen via: http://www.thelightworks.com/, but here's a few screen grabs of work they have done:

As you can see the guys know their sci fi stuff! And whilst we don't have spaceships in our story, we do have a time travel element and need to create a whole post apocalyptic landscape for our characters. The type of nightmare future that we're trying to create comes from these visual illustrations:

The show itself is being shot in Virginia and New York city. We're excited to be filming in the iconic city in both a pre and post apocalyptic landscape.

2017 NYC. 

2047 NYC. 

Surely this isn't the WHOLE budget of the show?

No - not at all. We have a great deal of private finance in place to execute the show, both in kind support and actual investment in the series. SO why are we doing this exactly? Well it's two fold - we want to use the money to attach a very special guest star in one of the season finale episodes, and this process will help execute that....now I know you'd all be saying 'Who?' - but we just can't reveal that at this stage...but let's just say anyone that lovers this genre would know who it is and it'll help push our show to millions more people!

 

THE PRODUCTION TEAM

The production team on this show have delivered several TV shows and over 30 feature films between them, here's just a few:

We're going to block shoot the entire first season in one 12 week shoot. It's a great deal of work - but very exciting for all the cast and the crew to get to grips with an entire season's worth of filming in one go. 
We've also just completed work on our 10 part US drama, NO EASY DAYS - which you can get a sneak peak of below:

WATCH THE SERIES SALES PROMO HERE

What Next?

Well, just get involved!

If you have any questions then we're always available to respond, just leave us a comment and if it's a fair point - we'll post an update to let everyone know the answer to the question. 

And if you can't get involved then please share our campaign as far and wide as possible! It all helps!

2047 NYC. 


Surely this isn't the WHOLE budget of the show?



No - not at all.
We have a great deal of private finance in place to execute the show, both in
kind support and actual investment in the series. SO why are we doing this
exactly? Well it's two fold - we want to use the money to attach a very special
guest star in one of the season finale episodes, and this process will help
execute that....now I know you'd all be saying 'Who?' - but we just can't
reveal that at this stage...but let's just say anyone that lovers this genre
would know who it is and it'll help push our show to millions more people!
 
THE PRODUCTION TEAM


The production team on this show have delivered several TV shows and over 30 feature films between them, here's just a few:



  We're going to block shoot the entire first season in one 12 week shoot. It's a great deal of work - but very exciting for all the cast and the crew to get to grips with an entire season's worth of filming in one go. We've also just completed work on our 10 part US drama, NO EASY DAYS - which you can get a sneak peak of below:

WATCH THE SERIES SALES PROMO HERE
  What Next? Well, just get involved!
If you have any questions then we're always available to respond, just leave us a comment and if it's a fair point - we'll post an update to let everyone know the answer to the question. 
And if you can't get involved then please share our campaign as far and wide as possible! It all helps!

story:
OUR FILM

UNCOMMON APPLICATION is a short film inspired by Ris Igrec and Stella Wunder's experiences with applying to college during the peak of the 2019 college admissions bribery scandal.    

 

Stella (left) and Ris (right), 2019   

It follows Jacqueline "Jack" Stewart, a high school senior facing constant pressure from her parents to go to a prestigious college. Following a stinging rejection from her first choice, she begins to realize that she may not be cut out to meet her parents' expectations. However, she is determined not to be a disappointment and begins to pursue some... unconventional methods to the college admissions process. She wants to prove that she can do it, that she is good enough, smart enough, strong enough. But the consequences of her lies inevitably catch up to her. Was all of it worth it? Will she make her own path in life? Can she ever be happy? 

YOUR IMPACT

Making a movie is expensive! Your donations will go towards renting equipment, costumes, set dressing, transportation/lodging on set, location rentals, COVID safety equipment, festival fees, and supporting our cast and crew in their incredibly hard work. We are endlessly grateful for any amount of support given to us, whether it's $1 or $100. By donating to our project, you are helping to support young artists in a time where art is suffering and enabling a community of talented people to make something beautiful. We want this film to be a career launching pad for every person on board, and with a high quality film, our chances of success only increase. If you choose to donate a set amount, we have many tiers available for you to receive perks. In the event that we exceed our goal, or our stretch goal, the money will be put back into supporting our cast and crew for their hard work over these many months, as well as expanding our opportunities to apply for more festivals.

THE TEAM

We are a collection of driven artists who are all banding together on this project to create a beautiful piece of art that tells a relatable, funny, and interesting story that is so familiar to so many people today.  Our crew is expansive and dedicated and we want to recognize each and every person's efforts in making a film that every person can be proud of. The arts need help right now as well as dedication and innovation, which is exactly what we intend to bring to the table. 

Meet the crew! 

Co-Creator/Writer/Director: Ris Igrec

Co-Creator/Writer/Producer: Stella Wunder

Producers: Danielle Gould and Abigail Arader

Director of Photography; Tony Wang

1st Assistant Director: Alex Dekelbaum

Production Designer: Jaclyn Goldstein

Sound Design/Boom Op: Rhea Li

Gaffer: Jason Wang

Gaffer/ 2nd Assistant Director: Evan Miller

Stylist/Wardrobe: Emiliana Lahrssen

Grip/Social Media Consultant: Kyle Farscht

Production Assistants: Jaeman Topalian and Zoe Larkin

Stills Photographer/BTS: Ethan Saffold

Crowdfunding Consultant/Merch Artist/Promo Design: Alice Mao 

Editors: Megan Winklemann and Seamus Slattery

Music Supervisors: Abigail Arader and Griffin Roberts

RISKS & CHALLENGES

There are obvious challenges to making an independent film, even more so with a pandemic going on. Through our school, our entire crew anticipates to be vaccinated by the time of shooting. However, COVID still poses a risk. In the event that the coronavirus halts our production, we will push back filming to a time when everybody is safe and healthy. Our contingency dates for filming would take place in late August. Regardless of the hurdles we may face, we can guarantee that should we reach our goal, you will see our film become a reality. 

I CAN'T DONATE. HOW CAN I HELP?

There are so many ways to support young creatives if you can’t support the project monetarily. We have many social medias which you can check out and share amongst your friends and family. Facebook (and other social media in general) shares do wonders for Indiegogo exposure, so even just a quick share will help get our campaign on more people’s radars. 

Instagram: instagram.com/uncommonappfilm 

Tiktok: @uncommonappfilm 

Facebook: @uncommonappfilm 

Twitter: @uncommonappfilm

story:
My Summary

 

  • My name is Michelle Farrell and this is my first of hopefully many projects in the near future!
  • This campaign is extremely important to me because, as a fiction thriller and suspense author, I have a story to tell and what better way than adapt the story for film?
  • Contributors will assist in bringing this project to life and make it happen! My readers can see the story in their heads while they read, imagine how they will feel when they see the story with their eyes and all because of the generous help from the contributors!

 

Some Basic 

 

  • Total needed is 27K
  • Let's talk perks, shall we! Some contributors will qualify to grab an on set extra role. Some contributors may qualify to hang out on set and watch the filming on a special day. All contributors will see their names written in the credits as a special THANK YOU! Do you like T-shirts? I think every human being that I know does, so if you make a small contribution, expect a T-shirt! The shirt will have the picture that is connected to this campaign.
  • If the goal is not reached (But we are going to stay positive, right!) Funds obtained will first go to the crew. Their cost is estimated to be $10,000 for 14 days of shooting. This brings me back to the "Staying positive part" if any over the 10k, will go towards the permits for locations and associated fees. Next will go towards the wonderful and very talented cast. The auditions were outstanding and I wish that you could see what each selected actor brought to the table! Back to the topic of funds, if not reached. Let's say we have the amount of the 19k that covers the cast and crew (including MUA and wardrobe assistant), this amount will go towards equipment rental. We have a scene that requires a lift as well as a large greenscreen backdrop to simulate a car falling into a river with someone jumping in after it. Since this is my first go-round...I can't actually involve real rivers and what-not. (One day...*crossing fingers*), so I have to fake it and make it look good!

The Impact

 

  • This project is valuable because the lead character is a character that has not been featured before! She is not a superhero, she doesn't have powers, she is like you and me. She has a 9 to 5, loves hanging out with her friend Denzel and hates to cook. But, yet, with Denzel by her side when her tenacity and curiosity gets a little out of hand, she is able to stand up to TWO feuding crime circles (one of them with a leader that is known as Bloody Diablo! But we are getting ahead of ourselves. Let's continue with the first film MERCIFUL SHOCK)
  • Because this is my first ever film, I don't have a track record per say, however, my story has an awesome one. I am the author of the series as I have mentioned and I am proud to say that each book of the series topped the top 50 (book 3 topped the top 5) in sells with a minimum holding titles of 1 month. The series does even better in audiobook sales! So people really like the story and that makes me proud and more determined to make this dream come true!

Risks & Challenges :(

 

  • I have some challenges ahead. It is a given for someone in my position. I am completely known as an unknown. I am just a 40 something woman that lives in Kentucky that writes books. That's it. 
  • Before I wrote book 1 Melody Green: Merciful Shock, I was told that I was wasting my time and I couldn't do it. Then after book 2 Melody Green: Narcissistic Trance was released, it was said again that book 1 was a fluke, book 2 was going to fail. I proved them wrong. Now that we are talking feature film, those same voice are starting to whisper and finger wag again. "You can't make a movie!" "Who do you think you are?" Well, I am ready to prove them wrong yet again. So if you have ever been an underdog, you know what I am going through. If you are determined to show your children that you can do whatever your dreams desire with sweat and tears, you understand me fully.
  • My plan to overcome the obstacle of being an "Unknown" into a "Oh, yeah! I've heard of her!" is to earn the trust, respect and showcase my talent to all that like thriller/suspense movies. I can get there by getting my film out in front of people.

Ways You Can Help

I know that some people  can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. So I have this to say:

  • Even if you can not contribute financially, you can still help me. Rest assured, if you help me get buzz out to as many people humanly possible, I will be ever so grateful! I mean, full blown ugly cry face grateful!
  • Use those Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for listening and reading my words. I am so ready to get to work and I thank each and every one of you so much in advance.

 

Michelle D Farrell

Use those Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for listening and reading my words. I am so ready to get to work and I thank each and every one of you so much in advance. Michelle D Farrell

story:
Summary

My name is William Wonders III and  I am New York born filmmaker. I work currently in the industry as  Assistant Editor in New York.  I graduated from New York Film Academy. And started teaching  risk youth Film & Video as a class in Brooklyn.  Though it was hard to break into the industry. Through Hard work I was able to. I started my own production company, QUIVERFULL PRODUCTIONS, LLC. My hope is to make films that that touch the heart, as well as make an impact in my community, While bridging to other communities.  

Othello Rising is a Documentary about the historical state of health 
of Black Man in America. The original character of Othello was a Moor black man. 
Othello was manipulated, mentally and ultimately physically. Many Black men in America feel like Othello. Through all of the trials Black men are still leading in heart disease, Hyper tension, High Cholesterol, Colon Cancer, Diabetes, Suicide Cigarettes' smoking. This is an attempt to educate and start a conversation that brings Black men face to face with their health, to make a better choice.

Contributors will literally help bring this issue to the forefront. Those that support Othello Rising will be making an impact to the Black community, and saving the lives of Black men. Every share, every dollar, every conversation is a help to this project. We need your support to make this happen.  As a Black man this project speaks to my heart directly. I have seen Black men suffer from heath related issues my whole life. I want to make a change and a difference. 

Funding

All the funds that are received for Othello Rising will go directly into the making of the film. We need $15,000 USD to finish making the project. We have friends that are allowing us to film at different locations. We are doing what we need to do to make this film happen. Money is needed for camera's, as well as lens rentals. We are hiring professionals so we can have a great film, aesthetically and in audio. 

If we do not reach our goal all the funds will go to production and post -production. We believe that we will meet our goal because of you.  If you are not able to give than we ask that you share our campaign on social media. Your voice counts. Please use the Indiegogo share tools.

I have created perks for those that contributed, that really speak to the project and push our campaign forward. I love to give and keep people in the loop. It will be like you are sitting in the seat next to me as I direct. These perks are jewels that will remind you of your involvement. Again thank you for your contribution and see you on set!

story:
Creeping Death is a full length film based on the mythology and lore behind HALLOWEEN.   

In 2017 I started shooting this film with a couple of friends on an iPhone. None of us had any experience in the industry and quickly realized we were in way over our heads. My passion for this project has led me to achieve a MASTERS in MOVIES and TELEVISION where I learned about the filmmaking process and how to establish myself within the industry. Since then I have gained experience working on multimillion dollar features and television shows  across the country, including the upcoming horror film "The Night House" that can be seen in theaters all over the world in August. These experiences all taught me how to work with a budget and run a production. 

While my inspiration for this film began in Syracuse I knew in order to push this project forward I needed to relocate. Two years ago I packed my bags and moved to Los Angeles. Since my arrival I have been pitching this project around, where I realized its true potential. While many people come to Hollywood with great stories, very few ever make it to screen. Instead of waiting on someone to say YES I decided to do it my own way.

I began rewriting the script and assembling the skills/team needed bring this to life. We were aiming to shoot in Fall 2020 but with the pandemic I realized it was not the time to make a feature of this magnitude. Instead, I gathered a few friends and shot a short film to lay the foundation for CREEPING DEATH. From this I learned of the challenges that can and will arise when shooting a horror feature and how to overcome those obstacles.

This September I will be bringing this project back to Syracuse to shoot the FULL LENGTH feature to show the world what HALLOWEEN and CREEPING DEATH is all about! Once finished, we will be bringing this movie to MAJOR FILM FESTIVALS and STUDIOS to get this into theaters and homes across the world!

We are shooting this film in Upstate NY during Late September - Early Oct to capture the fall aesthetic and activities that Halloween is often associated with.

This is a full length feature film, that will take at least 3 WEEKS to shoot.

All contributions are going towards paying our talented cast and crew, unique locations, props, costumes, GORE/CREATURE FX and most importantly PUMPKINS! TONS AND TONS OF PUMPKINS!. All these things add up quickly and money doesn't stretch as far as SKIN does when making a movie. So the more money we have, the better this film will be!

If you love Halloween and believe in this project as much as we do then you have multiple awesome perks to choose from as a THANK YOU for your contribution. Almost all perks include receiving a copy of the movie and having your name in it. Getting a producer credit in this film is a very special perk because we cannot make this movie without YOUR help! Just think... John Carpenter's Halloween was considered a failure after its initial release and look at it now, so don't miss out!

HORROR is HOTTER now more than ever and Halloween as a holiday is finally becoming more popular than Christmas. While there are many amazing Christmas movies, Halloween films are scarce and very few capture the look and feel of what this holiday is truly about.

Every winter hundreds of new Christmas movies are released yet Halloween still hasn't seen its fair share. We know this film has the potential to be considered a Halloween holiday classic that will be revisited and discovered by new audiences for generations long after its initial release.

The biggest challenge we will face is time. No matter how prepared we are, filmmaking takes time. It takes time to set up the location, light the scene, rehearse the actors and to actually film it so we get the best performance. We have a little extra challenge involved in this film because of all LARGE LOCATIONS and intense KILL scenes this film requires. Actors will need to wear prosthetics to make these gags look as realistic as possible which can take multiple hours to apply and our production crew will need more time to setup the shots due to the SCOPE this film entails.

With my experience working on major movie and television sets I am more than equipped and connected with the most talented cast and crew to execute my vision. I know these challenges are not easy, however, with the right preparation, planning and your support, we can definitely hurdle any obstacles. AND WE WILL!

We know that not everyone who reads this will be able to contribute financially. Whether you can or not, please do the campaign a giant favor and share this page with as many people as you can. In particular, share it with people you believe would love to see this movie come to life.

Share it with your nerdy horror friends, your goofy uncles, cool aunts and share it with the person you wanna have a movie night with! The more eyes on this campaign, the more money we can raise, and therefore, the better our movie will be! 

Everyone involved would love to see this thing go viral and make horror history, and we want you with us!

If you have any questions please reach out and we will absolutely answer everything we can! 

Looking forward to bringing this to a SILVER SCREAM near you very soon!

Just think... John Carpenter's Halloween was considered a failure after its initial release and look at it now, so don't miss out!


HORROR is HOTTER now more than ever and Halloween as a holiday is finally becoming more popular than Christmas. While there are many amazing Christmas movies, Halloween films are scarce and very few capture the look and feel of what this holiday is truly about.

Every winter hundreds of new Christmas movies are released yet Halloween still hasn't seen its fair share. We know this film has the potential to be considered a Halloween holiday classic that will be revisited and discovered by new audiences for generations long after its initial release.


The biggest challenge we will face is time. No matter how prepared we are, filmmaking takes time. It takes time to set up the location, light the scene, rehearse the actors and to actually film it so we get the best performance. We have a little extra challenge involved in this film because of all LARGE LOCATIONS and intense KILL scenes this film requires. Actors will need to wear prosthetics to make these gags look as realistic as possible which can take multiple hours to apply and our production crew will need more time to setup the shots due to the SCOPE this film entails.
With my experience working on major movie and television sets I am more than equipped and connected with the most talented cast and crew to execute my vision. I know these challenges are not easy, however, with the right preparation, planning and your support, we can definitely hurdle any obstacles. AND WE WILL!


We know that not everyone who reads this will be able to contribute financially. Whether you can or not, please do the campaign a giant favor and share this page with as many people as you can. In particular, share it with people you believe would love to see this movie come to life.
Share it with your nerdy horror friends, your goofy uncles, cool aunts and share it with the person you wanna have a movie night with! The more eyes on this campaign, the more money we can raise, and therefore, the better our movie will be! 
Everyone involved would love to see this thing go viral and make horror history, and we want you with us!
If you have any questions please reach out and we will absolutely answer everything we can! 
Looking forward to bringing this to a SILVER SCREAM near you very soon!

story:
The Story

A Ukrainian woman (Valentina) comes to the States to care for her sister after she and her fiancée are victims of a hit and run.  Her fiancée's father (Joe) pushes the authorities to find those responsible but faces a dead-end. With nowhere left to turn he decides to take matters into his own hands, enlisting the help of Valentina to bring justice.  

Who We Are

We are a group of passionate independent filmmakers nearing completion of our latest feature film Plight. We entered production in 2020 just before Covid hit and were fortunate enough to safely complete principal photography this past November. The film is currently in post-production and we need your help to get it across the finish line!


Our production companies, Impavid Entertainment and gritHouse Films have formed an alliance working on numerous Film and TV projects over the past few years. Plight marks the 5th project we have collaborated on.

 

What We Need 

We need $6,000 to get through post-production and have a film ready to submit to festivals :)

Where will that money go?

-Editing

- Musical Score

-Sound Design/Mix

-Visual Effects

- Color Correction

-Festival Submissions

 

What You Get

The contributions are not just donations. You can get a whole lot in return for your support. We have some phenomenal perks to offer. You can get a copy of the film, our original soundtrack, you can even join the team and officially be a producer on the film! Check 'em out to your right.

 

Other Ways You Can Help 

Every contribution helps, whether it is a few dollars or $100. It all goes toward finishing this film. If you are unable to contribute monetarily please share this page with others. Tell friends, co-workers, fans of film, fans of creatives working on their projects. Spreading the word allows for others to contribute and ultimately get this film to where it needs to be.

 

Meet our Cast:

Ada Pasternak as Valentina

 

Matthew J. Plumb as Joe

 

Ryan Manuel as Patrick

 

Ione Butler as Elizabeth

 

Lorraine May Isbell as Mia

 

Grace Kohler as Veronica

 

Our Team


We appreciate all the support! Thank you!!

story:
The Project

Lost and alone, a young woman battles a downward spiral of existential depression and anxiety when she fails to reforge her connection with the divine love and light that she once knew.

This short film is an explorative visual album that intertwines narrative story-telling, dance, music, art and animation...and made by an all-woman crew. Won't you join us on this journey?

Meet the Team!

Miranda Yung, Director

Follow on IG: @miranda_not_priestly

A Renaissance woman at heart, Miranda Yung is not only a filmmaker, but an artist of many talents, including drawing, acting, and writing. She has won numerous awards for short films as a director and actor, and recognition for her screenplays. Miranda has culminated her filmmaking practice and portfolio by pursuing a Master of Fine Arts in Film and Media Production at Emerson College, taking special interest in narrative fiction writing, music video production and motion graphics. Her career also continues to grow through her professional work as Associate Creative Producer and Lead Editor at Emerson Productions.

Director's Statement:

"Hide and Seek is so much more than a visual album about "having the blues". It is a deeply personal, abstract telling of my own journey through the trenches of poor mental health toward the epiphany that even when I am most lost and in the dark, I am still precious and loved by the light.

I believe that as human beings we view human suffering as such a tragedy and injustice because our purpose is not to suffer or to hate, but rather to love and to be loved. Our place is not within the darkness, but within the light. I believe that we are born with an innate connection to this light, but as our innocence wanes and we are forced to age and confront an increasingly flawed and dark world, we can lose sight of its majesty and become disconnected from it. This experience of existential loss - as well as the spectrum of emotional reactions that flow from it - is the true heart of Hide and Seek.

My ultimate goal in sharing this story, particularly after such a dark and tragic past year, is that anyone who feels lost or has lost track of the light may see a piece of themselves in this film and realize that even though their journey may seem hopeless and exhausting, the light is always there, and our connection to it can never be broken. We are all, always, precious and worthy of love in this light. And even though it may often seem like it's hiding...it is always seeking us, just as we are seeking it."

Amanda Reyes, Lead Actress as The Woman

Follow on IG: @amandareyesfilm

Amanda Reyes is a Tejana filmmaker from Texas whose work centers around incarceration, national identity, women’s and LGBTQA+ rights. Her short narrative films have screened on the international film festival circuit including Manchester, Oxford and Liverpool film festivals. Amanda has been featured in Remezcla Magazine, NoFilmSchool.com, NY Worth Magazine and The New York Times for the work she’s done while attending Feirstein Graduate School of Cinema where she graduated with a Masters of Fine Arts degree in directing narrative cinema. Amanda has acted in the title role of Marisol which is now streamable on Amazon Prime and her most recent directing work includes Chicas Fritas, a queer, coming of age, short film set in Queens and a series of shorts about Pandemic Life, titled This will Last and PANDEMONIUM, both streamable on her website and instagram.

"When I first read the script to Hide & Seek, I felt a deep connection to the main character. I felt like I was rereading some of the exact thoughts that have gone through my head before while I was questioning my own value on this earth. I've been through so much in my life and have had my own share of hardships that I've overcome through resilience and grace. I believe this past year has contained many tragic events that have reminded us of the resilience of humanity. Our realities are constantly shifting and, in turn, we are constantly adapting to these changes with the new information presented to us.

This story explores how these changes affect our personal connections to Love. Sometimes we can feel like Love has abandoned us completely when, in reality, the internal struggle to value ourselves after we experience trauma, is what clouds our judgement of how loved we actually are. I truly feel that we're creating a powerful work that reminds us of our purpose and value on this earth, that explores the deep, complex, struggle to accept and love ourselves even during our darkest hour."

Samantha McDanel, Producer

Follow on IG: @_sinmantha

Samantha McDanel is an emerging up and coming Texas filmmaker with a wide range of talent in art. She has won numerous awards and festival recognition for her short film 'Pageant Perfect', which she is now developing the feature film for. She is also well-known for her makeup artistry in media and as a variety streamer on Twitch. Throughout the last year, she has taken her skills to creative producing films and music videos with like-minded artists while she continues to explore all aspects of the medium. To Samantha, openness and vulnerability, and community are all most important to her and drive her to create.

"When Miranda first asked me to produce her film, without even knowing the project, I was interested in working with her in any role. I've known Miranda for several years and her art and drive inspires me. The story hooked me in and is one that I relate to as a woman with depression and anxiety who has lost that light in life before, and likely will more times throughout my life.

Moreover, I am so pleased to be working with a team of all women. I know the women on this team truly resonate with this story, so this is such a strong collaboration with some of my favorite artists, filmmakers, and friends. In the end, community is what it's all about!"

Amber Yang, Cinematographer

Follow on IG: @AmberYang12

Amber Yang is a multimedia artist. She studied photography and graphic design in her undergraduate career, and now Amber focuses on cinematography with graphic design on the side. She takes film photography for fun and is always working on a book design project! Amber believes that presenting images is the most direct way to make an influence or present an idea. Whether to the literate or the illiterate or even to speakers of different languages. Her goal is to not only share and express her thoughts but also make an influence step by step. In the end, presenting ideas and telling compelling stories through artworks.

“Hide and Seek is a visually exciting film, sends a great message, and is run by strong women. So what’s not to like about it? As an Asian woman in film, it is important for me to work on projects that support women of color and to be able to be on a set that’s run by women. I have been working with Miranda for quite some time now and it’s always a blast to work with her. She is so kind and talented, and above all a great friend. I am so grateful and excited to be able to be on this project!”

Cristina Gonzalez, Production Designer

Follow on IG: @cinecristina

Cristina Gonzalez is a Mexican-American filmmaker. She was born and raised in Austin, Texas, and received her BA in Media Arts from the University of North Texas. She's very passionate about being a director as well as a production designer, this shows in much of her work, like her short film 'Suffocate', which has had success in festivals and screenings all around. She hopes to make a change for women filmmakers by creating more minority-led, women-centered stories.

"This project is important to me because it highlights the emotional journey depression can cause. I think it's a story that can resonate with a lot of people, especially after collectively experiencing a pandemic.  It creates a space to converse and de-stigmatize our views around mental health, which is important now more than ever. I'm really excited to help bring this project to life and continue these types of conversations."

What We Need & What You Get!

The amount raised from this campaign goes right back into the people who are making this film possible. We love the ability to make art with our fellow creatives and friends, but we also understand that each person works in the industry and deserves payment for their skills and time. If we raise above our goal, we are able to do more for our cast and crew.

Beyond that, we wanted to give ourselves a great goal for this campaign to:

  • Give our friends good rates! First and foremost!
  • Take care of cast and crew and keep us all cool and safe in the Texas summer heat as we film, including feeding our team daily, supplying sunscreen and water bottles, as well as helping cover costs for our team's lodging in our further-away locations!
  • Afford our incredible locations and costume design.
  • Post-production needs, most-especially an amazing score since the film is also a visual album combining narrative storytelling with dance and music. The score is a large part of the story, so it will be a big investment, in both time and money, after we film.
  • Festivals! We would love to be able to have a fun festival run with this film and share it all around and invite you all to go, too!

Perks!

We'd like to thank you for supporting us as indie filmmakers! Our perks include:

  • $5 - Coffee Credit (A credit in the film simply for buying a cup of coffee to keep us awake in our long shooting days!)
  • $10 - Downloadable Link to film upon release
  • $25 - Special Thanks Credit (You are specially credited in the film!)
  • $50 Download link to Original Score
  • $100 Digital Production Bible: concept art, script with directors notes, shot list, mood board/lookbook, storyboards
  • $150 Percentage off Miranda’s art print shop (
  • $250 Personal “Love” letter from Director + Digital Download of Poster
  • $350 Sponsor Credit + Physical Poster + Script signed
  • $500 Impact Producer Credit + Be on set with us for a day! 
  • $1000 Producer Credit + Invite to Premiere Screening
  • $3000 Executive Producer Credit + Dinner with the Filmmakers (WOW! We are insanely grateful for this! You have taken care of our team immensely! Please eat and hang out with some of us!)

All previous perks for your support are included in each tier!

The Impact

This project has been filled with an all-woman team of people from all different backgrounds that we trust and work well with. We all work in the industry, and we live to create. Art and film is our livelihood and our passion! As women, and especially BIPOC women, we all have voices that we want to lift up and collaborate with - something that often feels rare for us to be able to do in the film industry.

However, as young independent artists, it's difficult to pay for everything and everyone who helps create with you. As much as we enjoy making films, we also must be realistic as professionals who work in the industry and freelance. We cannot expect artists, whether they be our friends or not, to work for free. It is imperative that we support and take care of one another!

There are so many moving pieces when it comes to making films. Stressing over monetary needs while creating art often negatively affects the project quality as well as the creators' ability to commit their time to their passion.

Every filmmaker on this team has had successes in this industry...and we know that goes beyond just ourselves. We are a community!

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenges fall into the ability to pay our professional filmmaking friends and colleagues for their skills and time, as well as paying for locations both to shoot at and for lodging. Director Miranda Yung is putting in funds beyond this campaign already for the heavy production design of the film, film equipment, travel, and more.

We have a 6-day shoot across multiple locations, including outside in the Texas summer heat. That is also a big challenge as we must keep our team transported, lodged, hydrated, cool, fed, healthy, and happy. The funds raised here go into our ability to do just that.

Making films over the years, we know that taking care of each other is Number One Priority! This campaign helps us do just that with ease.

Other Ways You Can Help

Every dollar helps us lift this project off the ground and up to the stars, so we'd love your contribution and support!

We hope you will all share this project around! We are SO excited to create this big art project together and hope you're excited to see it.

Follow the film and the rest of our team!

Hide and Seek Film on IG: @hideandseek.film

Priyanka Shah, Associate Producer on IG: @pri_filmmaker

Arnila Guha, Associate Producer on IG: @iamarnila

Caisa Charleston, Social Media Manager on IG: @notcaisa

Kaitlyn Kilpatrick, Grip/Gaff and BTS Photographer on IG: @kaitlynjkilpatrick

More to come soon!!
